loans.name: Ker

texts.en:
Mrs. Ker R., 41, is married and has three children. She has a butchery stand at a busy market selling beef and pork. Each day she makes around $5 of net profit. Her husband is a butcher who buys cow from the breeder and prepares the meat cuts for his wife’s butchery stand as well as other vendors in his town. Each day he also makes around $5 of profit. The family has three children enrolled in school who also assist with their parents' business.

Recently, Mrs. Ker R. and her husband has requested a loan to purchase more cows from the breeder to invest in their business as well as to meet her growing customer demand. ( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Ker R. is not available).

loans.use: To buy more cows

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja y con sus dos hijos de 17 y 16 años. Es agricultura, desde muy joven se dedica a la siembra de gladiolos, hermosas flores que con el lapso de  6 meses pueden ser extraídas, sus terrenos se encuentran en una zona cercanas a su hogar, lo que le permite tener cuidado de sus cultivos y de su familia. Le agrada de su trabajo el ver florecer sus gladiolos, pero para sembrarlas requiere de  bastante dinero, sobre todo en la compra de semillas.
Para Marlene su mejor motivador son sus hijos jóvenes, quienes tienen muchos deseos de superación.
Con el dinero del préstamo desea incrementar sus cultivos de gladiolos, además de iniciar la siembra de maíz y papa por esta temporada.
texts.en:
Marlene is 34 years old. She lives with her partner and their two children aged 17 and 16 years old. Since she was very young she dedicated her time to cultivating gladiolas, beautiful flowers that after only 6 months olds can be transplated. Her land is located in region close to her home and it permits her to care of her harvest as well as her family. She loves her work, to see her gladiolas flowering. But planting a new harvest requires a great deal of money, especially in the purchase of seeds.

For Marlene her greatest source of motivation is her two young children, both of whom have great dreams of self-improvement.

With the funds from this loan, she wishes to increase her harvest of gladiolas, and she always wants to start a corn and potato plantation for this season.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her fields of harvest to plant gladiolas and start producing potatoes and corn.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana M., 52, is married with three children. She has many years of experience in the pig farming business. She sells to the general public and villagers 4 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~$250 USD). SPBD loans are Susana's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband and children are doing the farming, with her great support.

loans.use: Susana would like to purchase coconuts for pig food, old tyres for drinking water, and wire fence to put pigs inside.

loans.name: Cate

texts.en: Cate N. is a devoted and hard working client of Pearl Microfinance of Kasenyanku women. She is a farmer growing potato and cassava both for sale and home consumption, as well as buying from others when the season is not favorable for her. When it is harvest time, she is always a happy woman with a lot of work to do that brings in more income. For a season like this where she has less on her plantations, she needs a loan to help with buying cassava and potatoes for sale, as well as employing manpower on her farm. She is married but her husband does not care about her and her children and this is why she works so hard to take them to school and feed them, and to save for their medical care. She is determined for a bright future for her four children in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale and to pay for labor on her farm.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhon H., 20, is a farmer who lives in Leach Commune in Pursat Province. She takes cares of two children. 

Sokhon is married to Mr. Chanthy Hean, age 39. He provides battery recharging services to his customers and also repairing bicycles for daily income. Chanthy needs to expand his business, but lacks the money to do so. Therefore, Sokhon is applying for a loan of $600 to buy more battery-recharging equipment and bicycle materials for her husband's business. 

Sokhon's husband is pictured because she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To buy more battery-recharging equipment

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr: Née vers 1972 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'ouémé au sud du Bénin,dame AH. Albertine est originaire de le vallée de l'ouémé, mariée et mère de cinq enfants,elle est revendeuse des articles divers qu'elle va s'approvisionner au marché Dantokpa qui est le plus grands marché du bénin,en plus de la vente de ces articles, distribut des tissus en pérode de fête ,Pour faire face à la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, elle démande ce crédit pour faire face à la démande des clients,
texts.en:
Born around 1972 in Adjohoun, Ouémé County, in southern Bénin, Ms. Albertine AH. is originally from the Ouémé Valley. She is married and the mother of five. As a retailer of various goods, she is going to acquire supplies at the Dantokpa marketplace, the largest marketplace in Bénin. In addition to these goods, she distributes fabrics during holiday periods. To address the burgeoning customer demand, she is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy w boxes of milk, 2 boxes of spaghetti, and a box of couscous

loans.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada hace 37 años, y madre D. 4 hijos, D. los cuales uno D. ellos falleció, actualmente vive en su casa propia; pero su negocio lo realiza en otro lugar, que también es propio. Hace 10 años atrás se dedicaba a la venta D. golosinas al por mayor, las que traía D. Lima y después las repartía en las bodegas D. su pueblo; esta actividad la realizaba cada 15 días y ahora la realiza con menor frecuencia porque está incursionando en el negocio D. la venta D. comida. Hace poco acaba D. adquirir un terreno en un lugar estratégico, que tiene zonas naturales muy bellas, y se está  acrecentando la concurrencia D. turistas, por ello, solo quiere vender platos típicos D. la región. Ahora, ella y otros comerciantes están viendo la manera D. construir locales D. madera muy atractivas, mientras eso, todos los fines D. semana prepara los diferentes platos y se traslada desD. su casa cargando varias cajas D. bebidas y sus ollas bien cubiertas con los papeles y plástico para que no se enfríen y se mantengan calientes. Alida ha estado preparando D. 15 a 20 platos, y por cada plato típico cobra 6 soles, aunque no gana mucho, pero este precio lo mantendrá mientras acreciente la concurrencia D. la gente y se conozca el lugar; y una vez que la zona se haga pública espera recuperar lo invertido. Alida es presidenta D. su banco comunal en MFP, y les inculca a todos los socios a que asistan y paguen en la fechas indicadas sus cuotas, para D. ese modo, al grupo se les siga facilitando los préstamos. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. cajas D. bebidas, y la otra parte es para que pueda construir su local D. madera donD. establecerá su negocio para no tener que cargar cada fin D. semana sus pesadas ollas y cajas.
texts.en:
Alida is 57 years old and has been married for 37 years. She is the mother of four children, one of whom passed away. At present she lives in her own home; however, her business is in another location, which she also owns. For the past ten years she has engaged in the wholesale candy traD.. She brings candy in from Lima and distributes it to stores in her town. She was making the trip every fifteen days, but now does so less frequently because she is branching out into the sale of food. Recently she was able to acquire a plot of land in a good location in very beautiful natural surroundings. The competition for tourists is increasing and she wants to sell traditional local meals. She and other businessmen are looking into building attractive shops out of wood, but in the meantime every weekend she prepares various dishes, and along with cases of drinks, transports them from her home in pots covered with paper and plastic so that they do not get cold, but stay hot. Alida has been preparing 15 to 20 meals, and for each traditional meal charges six Peruvian soles. Although she does not earn much, at this price she can be competitive and familiarize herself with the locale. Once the area opens to the public she hopes to recover her investment. Alida is the president of her MFP banco comunal, a business support group, and she instills in all the members the value of attending and making their loan payments on time. She continues to facilitate loans for the group in this fashion. The money that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of beverages by the case, and the rest will go towards building a shop out of wood where she can set up her business, and no longer have to carry heavy pots and boxes every week.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks by the case and construction of her shop

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị hằng năm nay 22 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại huyện Kim Động tỉnh Hưng Yên. Năm 2007 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư thêm vào của hàng kinh doanh vật liệu xây dựng của gia đình. Hiện tại công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị đang phát triển thuận lợn và cho thu nhập ổn định. Ngoài nguồn thu nhập từ kinh doanh gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm công việc lái xe của chồng  với  tổng thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Hằng mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn vào  của hàng kinh doanh nguyên vật liệu xây dựng  của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi H. is 22 years old. She lives with her husband and two small children at Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. In 2007, she joined TYM Fund to borrow loans to invest in her construction material retail business. Her family's business is expanding and her income is stable. In addition to her business, her family also has the additional income of her husband's salary as a driver, totalling at 3,000,000 VND per month. She wishes to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in her family's construction material retail business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: R. is 33 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are students. She is married to Koey, 39, who is a local farmer. R. has farmed since 2000 and she can earn $5 per day. Her farming land is located in a fertilized zone and near a water source. Recently, she is interested in the land surrounding her house. R. is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy a piece of land. The loan will help the family live more comfortably.

loans.use: To buy piece of land

loans.name: Josefa Avelina

texts.es: Josefa Avelina S., reside en La Coruña. Vive en la casa de su hijo y vive junto a el, su nuera y su nieto. Josefa posee una pequeña tienda, la cuál se ve muy beneficiada debido a que no se encuentran otras tiendas en el lugar, por lo cual los vecinos asisten únicamente a su tienda. Josefa solicita un préstamo para poder invertir más en su negocio, ya que desea poder comprar granos básicos y otros objetos de uso personal como jabón, papel higiénico, entre otros. Josefa desea  poder ampliar su tienda, de manera que pueda ser visitada  tanto por sus vecinos cercanos como por los más lejanos, esto contribuiría en gran manera a que Josefa obtenga mayores ganancias, ya que necesita mejorar sus ventas, debido a que solamente de esta manera podrá percibir mayores ganancias, de manera que pueda contribuir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Josefa Avelina S. lives in La Coruña. She lives in her son's house with him, her daughter-in-law, and her grandson. Josefa owns a small shop which has the great advantage of being the only one in the area, so the neighbors only patronize her shop. Josefa is requesting a loan that she will invest in her business, purchasing staple grains and items of personal use like soap and toilet paper. Josefa would like to be able to expand her store, so that it will be visited not just by nearby neighbors but also by people who live farther away. This would be a great help in increasing her earnings. She needs to increase her sales in order to earn more income and be able to contribute more to household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple grains for her store

loans.name: Konul

texts.en: Konul A. is 35-year-old woman who sells perfumes in the village of Imishli. She is a widow and lives with her parents. Konul has worked in her shop since 2005. She rents her space and purchases all her goods from the city of Baku, 3 hours away from her home town. Konul is applying for a $2000 loan to diversify the goods she sells. Let's do our best to help this hardworking woman.

loans.use: Diversify the products she sells

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris B. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters, who are all still in school. One is in the senior high school, one in junior high schoo, and another in primary school. Her husband works with a small mining firm in the community.

Doris lives with the husband and children in a family house in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Doris is a petty trader. She sells smoked fish and tilapia. She procures the goods from nearby towns and sells on a table top in the market square. Doris has been in business for one year and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Tataisuple Group

texts.en: This is Sulaiman H. F., Mohamed K. and Abdul Karim K.. They named their group Tataisuple. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs have received from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have had much impact on the lives of these borrowers. With previous loans, they were able to feed their families, send their children to school, pay medical bills and so on. Having repaid the last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 3,000,000 to further strengthen their businesses. Sulaiman H. F. (right) is the leader of the group. He is 38 years old and was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili district, northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have six children who are all still in primary school. Sulaiman has been a businessman for over 10 years. He sells locally produced goods like rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and ataya (Chinese green tea).

loans.use: To Invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
Corina es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Corina es conviviente tiene 59 años, un hijo de 41 años que es independiente.
Corina empezó a trabajar limpiando casas, lo quejo por que era muy pesado y puso una  bodega hace quince años, en su casa, poco a poco 
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a valorar el dinero, a llevar sus cuentas, a invertir. 
Corina necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para invertirlo en su bodega, copra de sacos de arroz, azúcar, fideo, leche. 
El sueño de Corina es comprar un carro para ponerlo  en alquiler.
texts.en:
Corina is a member of the Maria Elena Moyano Communal Bank. She is living with her partner, and she is 59 years old. She has one son who is 41 years old, and he is independent. Corina began to work cleaning homes, which she quit because it was very unpleasant. Fifteen years ago, she set up a store in her home [which grew] little by little. Since she has been working with Kiva partner Finca, Corina has learned the value of money, how to keep track of her personal finances, and how to invest. Corina needs a loan of 2400 soles to invest in her store, buying sacks of rice, sugar, pasta, and milk. Corina's dream is to buy a car, which she would rent out.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar, pasta, and milk.

loans.name: Lek

texts.en: Lek S., 32, is married and lives with her two young children in Kampong Cham province. She is a good housewife who stays at home looking after the children and cooking for the family. Her husband sells bananas and makes US$ 3.50 each day. Lek S. is asking for a loan to purchase bananas for her husband to sell at the market.

loans.use: Selling bananas at the market

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es: La señora Maria Alicia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Bandinas II”, Distrito Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02  hijos, que aun están a cargo de ella. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza le motivó a crear su propio negocio de Servicio de Internet, se inicio con  S/. 300.00 y día a día fue ganando clientela dado el buen trato que les brinda y el precio cómodo en la hora de servicio de Internet. Actualmente continúa con este negocio pero ya ampliando con mas cabinas y considerando la demanda que tiene entre sus clientes que generalmente son adolescentes y vecinos del barrio donde vive. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará 01 escáner y una computadora, para implementarlo mas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en cables,  para mejorar su cableado de red con canaletas, para dar un buen servicio y seguridad.Ella manifiesta que trabaja con mucho optimismo, agradeciendo la oportunidad de contar con préstamos que le ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Alicia is a client of the Community Bank “Las Bandinas II”, in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, San Martín. She is 33 years old, and lives with her two dependent children and their father. Her strength and perseverence motivated her to create her own Internet Service business, which she started with S/. 300.00. Day by day she gained customers because of the the good service she provides, and the reasonable hourly price she offers for internet service. Currently, Maria Alicia operates the business, but is expanding with more booths due to the demand of her customers, generally teenagers and neighbors from the area where she lives. With a loan of S/. 1,500.00, Maria Alicia will purchase a scanner and a computer for greater use. She will also invest in cables in order to upgrade the cabling in her network with cable concealers, and to provide better service and security. Maria Alicia tells us she is very optimistic in her work, and appreciates the opportunity to rely on these loans that help her develop as a woman and a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a scanner and computer

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
Donata is a member of the Ikweta center borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is a 42-year-old woman, married, and the mother of four children. Her children are aged 20, 16, 13, and 8 years. She also cares for four other dependents. 
Donata started her own grocery business selling beer and soda one year ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 50,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Donata’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 TSH in order to buy more beer and soda. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Donata hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soda

loans.name: Iloa

texts.en: Iloa T. (0) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Vavau. She is married and has five school-aged children. Iloa owns and operates a business running a bakery, baking and selling cookies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 800 WST a month. In 2001, Iloa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. Iloa is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase baking equipment. The loan will be her 6th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Lydia Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette dame a perdu son mari ; elle est devenue veuve et supporte seule les frais de scolarité de son enfant. C’est ainsi qu’en 2006, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de charbons de bois. Elle réussit bien dans ce commerce dans le quartier Adidogomé à Lomé. Actuellement elle dispose de beaucoup de clients achetant soit des sacs entiers, soit en détail. Pour renouveler son stock presque fini, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 25 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est convaincue qu’elle pourra rembourser à temps.
texts.en:
This lady lost her husband; she has become a widow. She covers the schooling costs for her child all by herself. And so, she got started in selling sacks of charcoal in 2006. She is successful in this business in the Adidogomé district of Lomé. She has many customers right now who buy either entire sacks or at the retail level. To renew her almost-depleted stock, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 25 sacks of charcoal. She is convinced of being able to repay on time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio G. is 42 years old and happily married to Cristeta. He manages a tricycle transport business as their source of income.  Rogelio is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle.  He would like to borrow PHP 5,000.  He hopes that he can sustain all the needs of his family by managing his transport business activities well.

loans.use: Motorcycle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Hazrat Wali

texts.en: Hazrat Wali, the son of Gull Wali, lives in Jalalabad Nangarhar.  He is marred and the father of two sons. He has a retail shop and has been involved in this business for more than 6 years. Every day he works hard to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to enlarge his shop and buy more food items for his business. He is happy with this loan and he would like to thank the lenders who help poor people around Afghanistan.

loans.use: Buying food and other things for his shop

loans.name: Nurbubu's Group

texts.ru:
Нурбубу – лидер этой группы. Нурбубу мать пятерых детей. Самому старшему уже тридцать один год, а самой младшей дочке всего лишь девять лет. Нурбубу и её муж – фермеры с многолетним стажем. Они разводят мелко – рогатый скот в специализированных сараях для содержания скота, известных под названием «кашар». Их кашар находится в пригороде Балыкчы. Нурбубу счастлива, что вырастила столько детей. Ведь все они теперь активно помогают своим родителям и вносят тем самым свой вклад в семейный бизнес. Начали же они с того, что держали скот у себя дома. За короткое время им удалось увеличить поголовье и им потребовалось более крупное помещение, которое они удачно нашли. Скотоводство стало золотой нишей для Нурбубу, так как благодаря этому роду деятельности Нурбубу и её муж значительно повысили свой жизненный уровень. Во-первых, они без особых трудностей женили сына, справили свадьбу и в придачу купили ему машину. Все расходы были покрыты за счёт проданной скотины. Ей пятьдесят два года, но даже сейчас она усердно трудится изо дня в день и вкладывает всю душу для того, чтобы их хозяйство процветало. Их изначальный вклад составлял около пятнадцати тысяч сомов. Теперь же, они зарабатывают треть этой суммы за один месяц.  
Нурбубу решила обратиться за кредитом с целью закупить корм на зиму. Это позволило бы успешно откармливать скот до весны. Нурбубу очень хочет выкупить кашар в течение двух лет. Для этого она готова приложить все усилия. 

Партнёры Нурбубу по группе: Абдыкадыр, Айгуль, Берметкан и Анара

Абдыкадыру пятьдесят шесть. Женат, отец двоих детей. Чтобы прокормить семью Абдыкадыр занимается разведением мелкого рогатого скота в кашаре. Абдыкадыру нужен кредит для того, чтобы заготовить корм на зиму. 

Айгуль сорок восемь. Она мать двоих детей. Айгуль – домохозяйка. Муж занимается перевозкой и продажей угля. А также 15 дней в месяц работает водителем на стекло – заводе. Айгуль нужен кредит, чтобы оплатить контракт дочери в ВУЗе. 

Берметкан сорок девять. У неё одна единственная дочь. Берметкан разводит мелкий рогатый скота, а её муж работает на стройке. С помощью кредита, Берметкан собирается закупить корм для скотины на зиму.

Анаре сорок. Четыре года назад Анара решила занятся коммерцией. Она начала продавать жевательные резинки, семечки, орехи и табачные изделия. Муж уже вовлечён в её бизнес. Анаре нужен кредит для увеличения товарооборота. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Nurbubu is a leader of this group. She is a mother of five children. Her oldest son is now 31 years old and youngest daughter is only nine. Nurbubu and her husband are farmers. They breed small cattle in specialized sheds for keeping cattle which are known as "kashars." Their kashar is in the suburb of Balykchi. Nurbubu is happy that she has grown so many children. Because all of them are actively helping their parents and by that contribute to their family business. They started with just keeping the cattle at their home. In a short period of time they managed to increase the headcount of cattle and they soon need a large space which they successfully found. Animal husbandry has become a golden niche for Nurbubu because thanks to this business Nurbubu and her husband have significantly improved their quality of life. Firstly, they have married their son without any difficulties, celebrated his wedding and bought him a car. All the expenses were covered by the profit made from selling cattle. Nurbubu is fifty two years old, but even now she works very hard every day and gives her soul to the growth of their business. Their starting capital included around fifteen thousand soms. Right now they can already make the third of this amount in one month. Nurbubu has decided to ask for a loan with the purpose to buy fodder for the winter time. This will allow her to successfully feed the cattle until the spring. Nurbubu very much wants to pay off the kashar in the next two years. She is ready to do everything she can to achieve it. Nurbubu's group partners are: Abdykadyr, Aigul, Bermetkan and Anara. Abdykadyr is sixty six years old. He is married and is a father of two children. To feed the family he breeds small cattle in the kashar. Abdykadyr needs a loan to prepare the fodder for the winter. Aigul is forty eight years old. She is a mother of two children. Aigul is a housewife. Her husband transports and sells coal. He also works as a driver on the glass factory every fifteen days. Aigul needs a loan to pay her daughter's college tuition. Bermetkan is forty nine years old. She is has an only daughter. Bermetkan breeds small cattle and her husband works in construction. With the help of the loan Bermetkan plans to buy fodder for the cattle for the winter. Anara is forty years old. Four years ago Anara decided to start a business. She started selling gum, seeds, nuts and tobacco products. Her husband is already involved in her business. Anara needs a loan to increase her circulation of merchandise. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fodder for cattle for winter time

loans.name: C2255 Abadacogora Group

texts.en:
Josephine M. is 32 years old, married with four children, and she also takes care of four dependents. She is the president of a group called Abadacogora, which operates the business of selling secondhand clothes in the Gasabo district, not far from the center of Kigali. The hours of their business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

This group has been in business for three years and has proven itself as a viable entity! They are requesting their first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through purchasing more bales of clothes. They hope this will increase their monthly sales of clothing to more customers which will hopefully bring them more profit. As the business grows and strengthens they hope, simply, to take better care of their families.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
La señora Pastora es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva”, en el Distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, D. la Región Puno, tiene 43 años, D. estado civil casada,  tiene 01 hijo quien está estudiando.  Ella tiene  estudios D. primaria completa.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 3años, se dedica a  la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno desD. que tenia 16 años D. edad, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 (Nuevos Soles) con el que compró ovinos porque no alcanzaba para comprar ganado vacuno, la actividad D. compra y venta D. gando vacuno no es diaria por ello paralelamente se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores y agricultura D. autoconsumo.
Ella solicitará el monto D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, con ello piensa comprar 01 toro.

Indica que es responsable en  su  Banco Comunal  y le gusta la puntualidad y el ahorro ya que D. ello le dan utilidades.

Su anhelo es tener mayor número D. ganado vacuno y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Pastora is a member of the Ciudad Nueva Communal Bank in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno region. She is 43, in a common law marriage, and has one child who goes to school. She has an elementary school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. She has been buying and selling cattle since she was 16 years old. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy sheep because it was not enough to buy cattle. She does not buy and sell cattle everyday. So she raises small animals at the same time. She also farms for her own consumption. She is asking for a loan for 3,000 PEN. She is planning on buying a bull. She is responsible in her communal bank. She likes the punctuality and the savings, which are very helpful. Her desire is to have a greater number of cattle and to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Lia

texts.es:
La señora Lia con 56 años D. edad, trabaja en sus tierras hace 30 años, se caso con un buen hombre que la apoya en las faenas diarias.

Juntos los dos lograron comprar un lote y construir una pequeña casita, criando en ella a su pequeña hija Gilma, a la cual le hicieron estudiar y salir con una profesión, ahora ella los ayuda a cosechar la tierra, la señora Lia es muy querida y respetada en el pueblo D. mizque, y aunque aun lleva el dolor D. haber perdido a su única hermana hace poco, ella sigue trabajando y con la sonrisa en los labios desea hacer crecer su tierra y su pequeño ganado que con mucho esmero cuida.

Ella solo quiere ver culminada su obra, y así llama a la crianza D. su nieta y sus plantaciones, el crédito lo utilizara para la compra D. semilla D. papa y abono para sembrar, esto ayudara a incrementar sus cosecha y por enD. sus ingresos y alcanzar más rápido ese sueño D. doña lía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lia C. is 56 years old and has worked her land for some 30 years. She is married to a good man who helps her in the daily tasks.

Together, the two were able to buy a lot and build a small house in which to raise their little daughter Gilma. They directed her to study and qualify for a profession. Now, she helps them harvest the earth. Lia is very much loved and respected in her Mizque village. Though she still carries the burden of the recent loss of her only sister, Lia continues to work with a smile on her lips as she makes the land produce and raises her small herd of livestock with much care.

She only wishes to see her work culminated and, thus, also cares for her granddaughter's livestock and crops. This loan will be used to buy potato seeds and manure for the planting, thereby aiding the growth of the harvest and, in the end, her income, achieving more rapidly Lia's dream.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY POTATO SEEDS AND MANURE FOR SEWING CROPS

loans.name: Machid

texts.ru: Очилдиев Мачид проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 52 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Мачид более 9 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает овощи. У него имеются постоянные клиенты, оптовики, которые покупают у него часть урожая. Остальную часть он оставляет для употребления семьи. Ему в этом помогает его семья. Кредит просит для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Machid O. lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 52 years old. He is married and has five children. Machid has been doing agriculture for more than nine years. He mainly grows vegetables. He has regular customers, wholesellers, who buy part of his crops. He keeps the remaining part for use for his family. In this business his family is helping him. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for sowing of new crops.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Beatriz Orieta

texts.es: La Señora Beatriz se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos, desde hace ya varios años, tambien da clases de aerobicos como instructora  en un gimnacio, Ella es soltera, vive en la casa de su madre, donde ayuda bastante en los gastos de su casa. Este credito lo utilizara para comprar una variedad de perfumes y cosmeticos para la venta en estas fiestas de navidad y fin de año. Ella ha demostrado ser una buena clienta y muy cumplida en sus pagos, ella ya esta en una 4º secuencia con la Institucion.
texts.en:
Beatriz has been selling cosmetics for several years. She also gives aerobic classes in a gym. She is single, and lives in her mother’s house where she helps quite a bit with the household expenses. She will use the loan to buy a variety of perfumes and cosmetics to sell for the Christmas and New Year’s parties. She has demonstrated herself to be a good client who makes her payments well. She is in her fourth cycle with the Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Prince

texts.en:
Prince G. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 28 years old. Prince is separated from his spouse and has one infant child. To make a living, Prince provides motorcycle services in the local community. Prince has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Prince joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Prince is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Prince from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20211020036) is a 39 year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 7-member loan group offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội nhóm 07 (7).

H. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling bamboo handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA.    She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị X. (20211020037) is a 37 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20211020038) is a 55 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20211020039) is a 36 year-old woman who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20211020040) is a 37 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.

5.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20211020041) is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 3.360.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.

6.  Nguyễn Thị Nhị (20211020042) is a 43 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Fidelia Buenaventura

texts.es: Fidelia Buenaventura tiene 46 años, por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de sastrería. Hace más 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que desde hace mucho tiempo esta humilde actividad forma parte de su vida, anteriormente solo ofrecía el servicio de reparaciones de camisas, vestidos, pantalones de vestir entre otros productos así fue que logro realizar su propia fama de ofrecer muy buenos servicios, fue así que decide realizar de este trabajo un medio de ingreso para su vida y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de telas, hilos, zipper, botones, tijeras, bordados y agujas. Fidelia sueña mejorar la calidad de sus productos o agrandar su taller.
texts.en:
Fidelia Buenaventura is 46 years old. Her economic activity is tailoring, which she has done for more than 15 years. This humble activity has been part of her life for quite some time. Previously, she only offered services repairing shirts, dresses, and pants, among other things, and this is how she built a reputation for doing good work. Then she decided to use this work as a source of income to improve the quality of life for her two children. She is seeking a loan for the purchase of fabrics, thread, zippers, buttons, scissors, embroidery, and needles. Fidelia wishes to improve the quality of her products and expand her workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase capital

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Margaritas” esta representado por la señora Mery Martha y conformado por 10 socios D. los cuales 4 son miembros varones y el reto esta conformado por mujeres, este banco se caracteriza por ser muy unido y alegre. La señora Mery Martha que es la presidenta y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en una tienda en el mercado, está casada su esposo se llama Juan ambos tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar, su esposo trabaja como chapista y tiene su propio taller en su hogar en la cuidad D. El Alto  para poder mantener a su familia, viven en una pequeña casa que les pertenece a sus padres,  las expectativas D. Mery Martha y su esposo son D. crecer poco a poco y poder comprase un terreno propio e independizarse para darles mayor comodidad a sus hijos. El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades, la mayoría  como venta D. ropa,  ya sea D. manera ambulante o en puestos fijos, uno socios se tiene su pequeño café internet, otras son vendedoras D. comida, otras se dedican a la venta D. mantas y al servicio D. fotocopiadora y transporte público D. pasajeros. El grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que son conocidos en las ferias donD. venden sus productos por lo que la competencia no les afecta demasiado. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital D. operaciones para la compra D. mercadería, insumos y materiales para mejorar sus negocios y poder darles a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida a sus familias. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es D. seguir trabajando y contando sobre todo con la confianza y el apoyo economicote Agrocapital para poder alcanzar sus metas ya que van cursando su quinto ciclo juntos y desea seguir creciendo junto a la institución.
texts.en:
The group "Las Margaritas" is represented by Señora Mery Martha and consists of 10 members, of whom 4 are men and the rest women. This community bank is characterized by being very united and happy. Señora Mery Martha is the president and sells groceries in a shop in the market. She is married, and she and her husband, Juan, have three children of school age. Her husband works in metal finishing and has his own shop in their home in the city of El Alto in order to maintain their family. They live in a little house that belongs to their parents. The expectations of Señora Mery Martha and her husband are to grow little by little and be able to buy themselves a piece of land of their own and become independent to give greater comfort to their children. The rest of the group works in different activities, the majority in clothing sales, either as traveling vendors or at fixed shops. Some members have a little internet cafe, others sell food, others sell blankets, have a photocopying service, or work in public transport. The group in general has sufficient experience in the businesses they operate, and it's for this reason that they are known in the markets where they sell their products, and thus competition does not affect them too much. The present loan will be used as operating capital for the purchase of merchandise, ingredients, and materials to improve their businesses and give their families a better quality of life. The expectation of the group is to continue working and counting, above all, on the confidence and economic support of Agrocapital to be able to reach their goals, since they are in their fifth loan cycle together and they want to continue growing along with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Sebastiana Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina pertenece al Banco Comunal San Juan Eudes en la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia Manabí en esta ciudad sus habitantes son la  gran mayoría artesanos se dedican a la elaboración de muebles, tiene 53 años de edad y 18 años que formó su hogar en los actuales momentos vive con el esposo y un hijo, ya sus demás hijos son adultos y están radicados en el Oriente.

La señora Cristina desde hace 10 ciclos forma parte de la Fundación Espoir junto a ella ha podido crecer en sus negocios a los largo de 6 años que empezó con la despensa no ha dejado de trabajar y cada día se entrega mas a su negocio, ella nos cuenta que su esposo en los actúales momentos no tiene trabajo y es quien le ayuda en cuanto a atender la despensa, 

por otra parte la señora Cristina nos comentó que también se dedica a vender productos a base de paja toquilla, ella se encarga de la elaboración y venta de los mismos y una vez terminados los lleva hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil donde los vende, a los almacenes, nuestra socia es una mujer bastante trabajadora, se da tiempo para estar al pendiente de sus dos negocios.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Cristina invertirá una parte en la despensa en comprar productos de primera necesidad como también bebidas, y la otra parte será en materiales para elaborar sus trabajos en paja toquilla como abastecerse de la materia prima.
texts.en:
Cristina belongs to the Communal Bank San Juan Eudes, located in the city of Montecristi, Manabí province. Most residents of this city are craftspeople and furniture makers. Cristina is 53 years old, and has been married for 18 years. She lives with her husband and one of her children - the others are grown and live in western Ecuador. Cristina has been with Fundación Espoir for 10 cycles and she has grown her little grocery store for the last six years. She has never stopped working and every day she puts everything into her business. She tells us that her husband is currently unemployed and he helps her at the grocery store. Cristina also sells Panama hats; she makes the hats, and once finished, she takes them to the city of Guayaquil to sell in the stores there. Cristina is a hardworking woman and she makes time to take care of her two businesses. With this loan, Cristina will buy products and drinks for her grocery store and raw materials to make her Panama hats.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials and supplies for her store

loans.name: Patience

texts.fr: Cette dame est une femme mariée qui vit dans le quartier de bè kpéhénou avec son époux et ses 4 enfants. Son mari est un agent de santé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales et de tubercules. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2006, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays. Voulant se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 7 sacs de maïs, 2 Sacs d’ignames, et divers.
texts.en:
This lady is married and lives in the Bè Kpéhénou borough with her husband and four children. Her husband is a health worker. Her revenue-generating activity is the trade of grain cereals and tuber roots. She has been in business since 2006 and gets her supplies from the country’s interior. Needing to resupply, she is requesting a loan from WAGES so she can buy seven bags of corn, two bags of cassava, and various other items.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, cassava and various items

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El señor Walter K. esta casado con la señora Rossana Maidana  ellos tienen 2 hijos menores  y viven en la casa de sus padres.

Walter  empezó desde muy joven a trabajar  como costurero en el taller de  su tía, luego viajo a la Argentina en busca de algo mejor y logro comprar unas maquinas, hace 2 años que regreso y esta trabajando con su señora en un pequeño local que alquilaron en la ciudad de San Lorenzo; ya tiene una buena clientela y  necesitan de este crédito para la compra de telas polar en cantidad por la temporada que esta llegando.
En el futuro desea construir  para su local propio.
texts.en:
Walter K. is married to Rossana Maidana. They live with their two young children in his parents' house. Walter began working as a tailor at a young age in his aunt's workshop. Later he travelled to Argentina to look for better work and managed to purchase two sewing machines. He returned to Paraguay two years ago and now works with his wife in a small shop which they rent in the city of San Lorenzo. They already have a good client base, so they need this loan to purchase fleece in bulk for the winter season that is on its way. In the future Walter would like to build his own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fleece

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Cristina B. N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 35 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 2 filhos de 18 e 07 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 10ą classe não continuou devido a gravidez indesejada. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Maputo para o bairro da Matola quando se casou. Tem um negócio próprio há mais de 5 anos, possui um empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa consegue poupar algum na sua conta Bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (ovos, arroz, feijão e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir casas de aluguer.
texts.en:
Cristina B. N. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 35 years old, widowed, and has 2 children who are 18 and 7 years old. Cristina only studied through 10th grade, and didn't continue because of an unplanned pregnancy. She lives with her children in their own house and doesn’t help support anyone else financially. She left Maputo for the neighborhood of Matola when she got married. She has owned her own buisness for more than 5 years and has one employee. She earns a monthly income of almost 5000 Meticais, which she uses to cover household expenses. She also saves some in her bank account. Cristina has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a friend who also works with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 25,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy products (rice, eggs, beans and other items) in order to increase her stock of merchandise. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to build rental houses.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of eggs, rice and beans

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza R. is from the village of Sabacan, Panadtalan maramag Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Liza is married and has ten adult children. To make a living, Liza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Liza has been in this business for more than eight years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Liza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine R. is from the barangay of Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years of age and married to Reynaldo R.. They have been blessed with two children who are both still infants. Kristine, at present, is engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been engaged in this kind of business for about four months and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2007, Kristine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Kristine is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase housing materials for her house repairs and renovation. This will be the fifth loan she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and to save in future for her children’s education.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials for their house repairs and renovation

loans.name: Taj Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Taj bibi lives in the city of Vehari with her husband and three children. Her husband is a daily-wage laborer. He works for a meager income which led Taj bibi to operate her own business to support the financial needs of the family.

Taj bibi is a working woman: she sells clothes, purchasing them from the cities of Faisalabad (famous for its textiles) and Multan and selling them in her city, in her local market and in her community to earn a profit.

Taj bibi has applied for a loan from Asasah for her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy a variety of clothes to minimize her cost of purchasing and to fulfill larger orders.

All of Taj bibi’s children are getting their education. She wants her children to become successful in life and she thinks that by increasing her profits she can give them a better education so that they become successful.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok R., 58, is a professional silk weaver who makes US $3 each day in the Takeo province. She is married and has one child living at home to support. Her husband makes approximately US $2.50 every day by selling rice at the local market. 

Sok R. would like a loan of US $1000 to expand her husband’s rice stock.

loans.use: Expand rice stock.

loans.name: Emerita Candida

texts.es: Emerita tiene 36 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, ella tiene algunas cosas en su vivienda y la mayor parte del tiempo ofrece sus productos ambulantes. Desde hace 2 años, Emerita se alista temprano por las mañanas para salir y mostrarles a sus clientes lo que tiene, ella los protege muy bien. Ella se encuentra muy contenta con este crédito, por lo que dará la oportunidad de comprar calzado, perfumes, cremas y ropa interior. Así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Emerita is 36 years old, and she sells general merchandise. She has some items at her house, but most of the time she sells her products in an itinerant way. For two years Emerita has been getting ready early in the morning in order to leave and show her customers her products. She protects them very well. She is very happy with this loan because it will give her the chance to buy footwear, perfume, creams, and underwear. She pledges to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “KUSIKOYLLOR ”,   El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Herminia;   ella tiene 68 años D. edad, es natural D. la ciudad D. Puno, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. artesanía, ella distribuye pedidos al por mayor y ahora la socia desea comprar materiales para realizar algunos pedidos por que ella misma junto a su familia elabora en arcilla diferentes ceramios y vasijas para la venta.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. materiales  para elaborar artesanía.   
                .
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Herminia belongs to the “KUSIKOYLLOR” Communal Bank, located in the Huanchac district of the province and department of Cusco. Herminia is 68 years old and a native of the city of Puno. She is married and has 4 children. Herminia buys and sells artisan goods. She distributes orders for wholesale and now, she wishes to buy materials to fill some of these orders because she herself, together with her family, makes different clay ceramics and vases to sell. Herminia requests a loan to invest in buying materials for making these artisan goods. She values and appreciates the loan granted by this source and, also, promises to comply with all payments on the schedule established.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING BASIC MATERIALS TO MAKE ARTISAN CERAMICS

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina D. is from the village of Cabisera 15. She is 40 years old. Gina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gina is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the thirteenth loan taken out by Gina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag T. is a 52-year-old widow. She lives with her two children in a "ger," the traditional Mongolian housing tent, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her oldest son is a student while her youngest son attends a local secondary school. Her husband passed away. 

Tungalag operates a tailoring business in her town. She has been engaged in this business since 2003 with her friend and they have built a successful business operation. After many years of business, she and her friend have managed to expand their business by operating in a popular location at the nearby local trade center. Her earnings have enabled her to pay her children's tuition fees and provide for her family. 

In the future, she plans to have her own workplace. Tungalag is a very modest and hardworking woman. She is requesting a 800,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase necessary materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials

loans.name: Hadicha's Group

texts.en: Hadicha H. is the leader of the group. She is 42 and married. She has a daughter and three sons. Hadicha makes money by selling wood and her husband works as a cook. He also earns money by transporting goods. Hadicha started her business five years ago with the initial investment of 300 soms and now she makes 6,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to improve her living conditions and provide her children with a good education. Muharramhan M. is the treasurer of the group. She is 59 and a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. Six years ago, with the initial investment of 80,000 soms, Mauharramhan started a wholesale trade in sunflowers. In this way, she makes 10,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to start building a house for her son. Manzurahon H., 37, is married. She has a son and two daughters. The son is at school and the daughters are not yet. Manzurahon is a nurse and her husband works as a cook. Six years ago, they started to breed livestock. Manzurahon hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase farm animals for breeding. In the future, she wants to increase the number of livestock, build a new house and provide her children with a good education. Muhtabarhon H., 62, is a widow. She has raised daughters and two sons. All the children are married and working. A year ago, Muhtabarhon bought a calf and now she wants to get a loan to purchase sheep for breeding. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Ludy Elisa

texts.es: La Sra. Ludy R. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el colegio Santa Cruz de la India donde tiene año y medio de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de ladrillos y cemento
texts.en: Ludy R. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, where she works as an elementary school teacher at the Santa Cruz de la India school.  She's worked there for a year and a half.  This will be her first loan through Ceprodel and she will use the money to buy bricks and cement so that she can make improvements to her home.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 59 años D. edad, es casado y resiD. junto a su esposo y a un hijo en el distrito D. Túcume, una zona agrícola y turística que pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a cuarenta y cinco minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace diez años a la crianza D. animales menores en su domicilio. Ella suele criar aves D. corral para venderlas a sus vecinos y negociantes D. la zona cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo, que trabaja como jornalero, con el mantenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Magdalena desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado, asimismo desea realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Magdalena es una mujer bastante trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y poder seguir ayudando a su esposo.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 59 years old, is married and lives alongsiD. her husband and son in the Túcume district, an agricultural and tourist area that belongs to the Lambayeque province and is situated 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For ten years, she has been dedicated to raising young animals in her home. She usually raises poultry to sell to her neighbors and stockists in the area when they have reached a good level of development. The business serves to help her husband, who works as a day laborer, with the economic support of the family.

Magdalena wishes to expand her business by buying more animals and food. At the same time, she wishes to complete some improvements to her pens. For this, she has seen fit to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 new soles that will help her achieve her objective.

Magdalena is a hard-working and responsible woman. Her greatest hope is to continue growing as a business woman and be able to continue helping her husband.

loans.use: Purchase young animals and food to grow her animal-raising and -selling business.

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en:
Chhean S., 48, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. S. grows vegetables, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a barber, earning an income of about USD 4 per day.

 S. has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 2 on electricity and water, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase old cars to repair for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy old cars to repair for resale

loans.name: Gladys Maribel

texts.es:
Gladys de 31 años, confecciona y cose ropa por pedido. Vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.

Hace 4 años atrás trabajaba en un taller de costura pero como se quería independizar porque le pagaban muy poco, comenzó a reunir dinero para comprar sus propias maquinas de costura. Ahora trabaja con su hermana desde las 09h00 hasta las 18h00pm. Ella trabaja con sus clientes por pedidos si son confecciones o enmendaduras. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar hilos y telas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una lista de clientes fijo y hacer más grande su taller.
texts.en:
Gladys, age 31, makes clothes to order.  She lives in an urban area called Guasmo.  Most of its inhabitants are merchants.

Four years ago she worked in a seamstress shop.  However, she wanted to become independent because they paid her very little.  She started to get money together to buy her own sewing machines.  She now works with her sister from 9:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She works with her customers on orders making clothes or mending clothes.

She wants to use this loan to buy thread and fabric for her business.  In the future she wants to have a list of fixed customers and to make her shop bigger.

loans.use: Fabric and thread

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
Policarpio es albañil, trabaja como constructor de vivienda y la esposa es comerciante de ropa; tienen cuatro hijos dos de ellos son independientes; tiene su casa propia. Viven en la zona Alto Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito que solicita es para cubrir el costo de compra de motor para la mezcladora de cemento que posee para su negocio de construcción de viviendas.
Es el quinto crédito con IMPRO y el segundo via Kiva. Excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Policarpio is a construction worker. He builds houses and his wife sells clothing. They have four children. Two of them are independent. He has his own house and lives in the Alto Chijini area in the city of La Paz.
This loan is requested to cover the costs of buying an engine for a cement mixer for his home construction company. 
This is his fifth loan with IMPRO and this is his second loan with Kiva. He is an excellent client.

loans.use: To buy an engine for a cement mixer used for his construction work

loans.name: Duo Las Princesas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
DUO  LAS PRINCESAS DE SAN BARTOLO
Doña Flor de María C. A. se dedica a vender frutas y verduras en el mercado de la terminal zona 4 de Guatemala, ella nos comenta  para lograr surtir su venta la forma de en que ella satisface las necesidades de sus clientes es vender huevos y detergentes que lo hace los miércoles y sábado el resto de los días  vende sus frutas en el mercado y siempre trata la forma de vender fruta de temporada, nos comenta que cada año salen a vender productos navideños que lo hacen en todo el mes de diciembre por lo que ella necesita su crédito para surtir mas su venta de esta temporada, como  uvas, manzanas,  de la misma forma doña Paula  se dedica vender frutas en el mercado  ella nos comenta que a cada fin de año ella prefiere vender las frutas de temporada  ya que es lo que sus clientes le solicitan mas en el área.Solicita el credito para surtir su venta de frutas, como manzanas,uvas etc.
texts.en: in English: Duo The Princesses of Saint Berthold Doña Flor de María C. A. sells fruit and vegetables at the market of the terminal area 4 of Guatemala. She told us that to achieve customer satisfaction she sells eggs and detergents on Wednesdays and Saturdays, and on the other days she sells seasonal fruit at the market. Furthermore she told us that every year she sells Christmas products that she produces during the whole month of December. She needs this loan to finance the additional sales during this season, such as grapes and apples. Similarly, Doña Paula sells fruit at the market. She told us that at the end of each year she prefers to sell seasonal fruit, because that is what her local customers expect her to do. She applies for this loan to increase her sale of fruit, such as apples, grapes, etc.

loans.use: To finance the sale of fruit such as apples, grapes, etc.

loans.name: Frente Al Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Frente al Sol” se ubica en el Municipio de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca optó por éste nombre, por la ubicación del punto de encuentro de los que integran al grupo, la ubicación del lugar es en el negocio de la señora Claudia C. C.,  quien es la representante de sus compañeras. El lugar donde se reúnen está al descubierto y en las mañanas se puede apreciar el inicio de la mañana y del nuevo sol.
En esta narración hablaremos de Martha Iris Nicolás Ramírez, ella tiene 31 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos y su esposo se dedica al oficio de albañil de 29 años de edad. Sus pequeños hijos se llaman: Denis de 13 años que estudia el 6to año de primaria, Axel de 11 quien cursa el 5to año, Irais de 8 y Jesús de 3 años. Martha se dedica a la venta y elaboración  de manualidades, actividad que inició desde hace mas de 1 año, esta actividad le ha permitido dedicarle mas tiempo a sus hijos, ya que antes ella era empleada en una tienda y esto no le permitía estar con sus hijos y atenderlos como ellos lo requerían, en el negocio de Martha se comercializan diversos artículos que son utilizados en fiestas infantiles y en diferentes eventos , ella vende piñatas, juguetes, ropa para bebé, recuerdos para fiestas y variedad de juguetes.
Martha  se integró a un grupo de crédito para solicitar un préstamo económico, el cual utilizará en la compra de mas artículos y materiales para su negocio, ella pudo adquirir piñatas, biberones, chupones, mordedoras, sonajas, gorritos, muñecas, carros de juguete, porta retratos, juego de té para niñas, figuras de acción, pañaleras, carriolas, pelotas y materiales para la elaboración de manualidades y recuerdos. El negocio de Marta marcha bien y en la temporada de diciembre sus ventas aumentaron mas, esto gracias a las tradicionales posadas que se realizan en la población, también el incremento de sus ventas se debió a la celebración de día de reyes  que por costumbre se adquieren juguetes para regalar a los niños, algunos artículos de Martha son de temporada y es por eso que su mercancía varia de acuerdo a las necesidades de la gente.
Las ganancias obtenidas en el negocio de Martha están destinadas para la adquisición de mas mercancía, también para liquidar su crédito, poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo, y mejorado.
Uno de sus grandes sueños de Martha es hacer crecer su negocio, mejorarlo en todos los aspectos en tener mercancía, en integrar alguna persona que le ayude en la atención a los clientes. También  desearía tener su casa propia, ya que por el momento ella vive con sus suegros.
La esperanza de Martha son sus hijos en ellos deposita sus sueños y anhelos, ella espera algún día verlos como personas de bien, seres humanos buenos que ayuden a su prójimo que no tengan que carecer de lo necesario en la vida, ella desea que sus niños  se preparen que crezcan llenos de amor y cariño, lo primordial para que se puedan desarrollar en un ambiente de salud, de armonía.
Gracias a kiva  por ser un espacio donde los seños pensados pueden ser hechos realidad, porque gracias a instituciones como Fundacion realidad los que menos tienen son los que reciben este gran gesto de apoyo y servicio, las mujeres de la costa de Oaxaca se sienten respaldadas por este gran equipo.
El grupo “Frente al sol”, se  integra por un número de 10 mujeres, que dedican su esfuerzo y tiempo en forjar un futuro mejor para sus hijos, ellas son mujeres responsables y trabajadoras de gran compromiso con sus familias y con la sociedad. Estos son los nombres de las personas que integran al grupo así como su actividad personal de cada integrante.

Claudia C. C..-Venta de comida económica y antojitos
Patricia Ramírez Hernández.- Venta de zapatos por catalogo
Trinidad Ramírez.- Venta de Ropa
Laura Licex Baños C..- Venta de dulces
Miriam Ramírez García.- Elaboración y venta de antojitos
Lucia N. A..- Venta de pescado
Ana Rocío Ramírez Hernández.- Venta de perfumería
Martha Iris Nicolás Ramírez.- Bisutería y venta de artículos de fiesta
Alberta Eugenia S. M..- Elaboración y venta de antojitos
Nereyda Patricia Pérez B..- Venta de ropa
texts.en:
The "Frente al Sol" group is from the town of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca.  The name comes from the actual place where the members of  the group meet, which happens to be the business site belonging to Mrs. Claudia C. C., who acts as the representative for her colleagues.  The meetings take place outside where the rising sun can be seen every morning.

In this narrative we will talk about Martha Iris Nicolás Ramírez who is 31 years old and the mother of four children.  Her husband is 29 years old and is a bricklayer.  Her small children are Denis, who is 13 years old and in the 6th grade, Axel who is 11 and in 5th grade, Irais who is 8 and Jesús who is 3 years old.  Martha has been making and selling crafts for over a year.
