Before she worked in a store and didn't have enough time to look after her children the way she wanted to but with her current job she can.  Martha sells all kinds of articles for children's parties and events.  She sells piñatas, toys, baby clothes and souvenirs.

Martha became a member of the group so she could request a loan to buy more items and materials for her business, such as piñatas, baby bottles, pacifiers, rattles, baby caps, dolls, doll buggies, photo frames, tea sets for little girls, action figures, diaper bags, balls and materials for handicrafts and souvenirs.  Martha's business is doing well and sales increased in December thanks to the traditional nativity scenes and celebrations carried out in the town.  Also there was more activity around the Epiphany dates as parents were buying toys for children.  Martha usually stocks her business depending on the season and on customer demand.

Martha uses her earnings to buy more goods and to pay back her loan.  Her business has improved greatly.

One of Martha's big dreams is to expand her business, make improvements in merchandise, and hire someone to help her out with customer service.  She also wants to buy her own home since she now lives with her in-laws.

Martha hopes to see her children grow into good citizens who help others in need.  She wants to see them happy and nurtured in love and affection, growing up in a healthy, harmonious atmosphere.

Thanks to Kiva these dreams can come true; and thanks to institutions like the Foundation, those who have less can receive a gesture of support and service.  The women from the Oaxaca coast feel supported by this great team.

The "Frente al sol" group is comprised of 10 ladies who work very hard to carve out a future for their children.  They are responsible, hard-working women who are very committed to their families and society.  These are the names of each member of the group and their individual activity.

Claudia C. C..- Sells fast food and snacks  
Patricia Ramírez Hernández.- Sells shoes by catalogue   
Trinidad Ramírez.- Sells clothing
Laura Licex Baños C..- Sells sweets
Miriam Ramírez García.- Makes and sells snacks
Lucia N. A..- Sell fish
Ana Rocío Ramírez Hernández.- Sells perfume
Martha Iris Nicolás Ramírez.- Sells costume jewelry and party supplies
Alberta Eugenia S. M..- Makes and sells snacks
Nereyda Patricia Pérez B..- Sells clothing

loans.use: To buy piñatas, balls, dolls, doll buggies, baby bottles, pacifiers, caps, photo frames, diaper bags, lipstick, nail polish, hairpieces, rattles, action figures and materials for handicrafts and souvenirs

loans.name: Alpenita

texts.en:
Mrs. Alpenita A. is 41 years old and married with a school-aged child. She lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City. Alpenita believes in determination and hard work and runs a sari-sari (general) store. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative last July to avail herself of its loan facilities. The coop teaches its members to have a “livelihood project,” or business, to become productive and self-reliant. Alpenita’s dream is to own a mini grocery store someday where her neighbors can come to buy items such as rice, oil, sauce, sugar and candy. Today, Alpenita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase good for her sari-sari store. She hopes and prays to God that she will always be blessed with good health.  

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao, reaching out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase store inventory

loans.name: Jose Emanuel

texts.es:
José Emanuel V. M., tiene la edad de 33 años, está casado y tiene 1 hijo que es su mayor prioridad al igual que su señora esposa. El cuenta con una soda y quiere seguir creciendo en el negocio. Por lo cual el pretende con el préstamo comprar más mercadería para ofrecer una gran mayoría de comidas o platillos. El también piensa en el futuro de su hijo y su esposa, al igual pretende brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y que su hijo no tenga ninguna necesidad para sus estudios, pues el quiere que sea un gran profesional en el futuro.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Emanuel V. M. is 33 years old, married, and has one child. Both his wife and child are his greatest priority. José manages a soda fountain and wants to continue growing his business. For this reason, he intends to use his loan to buy more supplies so that he can offer a wide variety of snacks and dishes. He also thinks about the future for his son and wife, as well as providing them a better quality of life. His son has no need for his studies, yet he still wants him to become a successful professional in the future.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. José has not taken any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better services and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies for his soda fountain

loans.name: Sengthai

texts.en:
Mr. Sengthai S. and his wife, Mrs. Sophea Yun, live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and have two children. 

Mr. Sengthai S. used to drive a motor taxi. In November 2009, he applied for a Kiva loan to purchase a Tuk Tuk. But, now his Tuk Tuk is old and is broken in some parts, so he is requesting another loan of $1,000 to purchase new Tuk Tuk to replace the old one. Sengthai will then be able to continue his Tuk Tuk business. 

Photo: Mr. Sengthai S. and his wife

loans.use: To replace his Tuk Tuk

loans.name: Dul

texts.en:
Dul K. is a 57-year-old widow who earns a living by selling different kinds of Khmer cake in her community. She was married, but her husband died of illness several years ago.
Dul K. is good at for making nice cakes. She has been in this business since 2005, and generates a revenue of approximately $3 USD a day, which she uses to meet her family’s needs. She has eight children, seven of whom are single and still live with her in the same house. One of her children is married and now lives separately. Dul K. says that her two daughters, who are employed in a garment factory as seamstreses, have been paying money for taxis to get to work because they don’t own a vehicle. In order to encourage her children, Dul K. is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her daughters to use to commute to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her daughters to commute to work

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira I., the treasurer of this group, is 38 and divorced. She takes care of her three daughters by herself; two daughters study at school and the youngest daughter is preschool age (under seven). As a supervisor Elmirai earns 6000 soms per month, and as a livestock breeder, an enterprise she started four years ago, she earns an additional 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she will purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future Elmira wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene S. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ailene owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap, and beverages in the local community. Ailene has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ailene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Ailene is requesting a new loan for 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, beverages, and snack foods. This loan will be Ailene's fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, beverages, and snack foods

loans.name: Solidario Los Cipresales Group

texts.es: Solidario los Cipresales: Este grupo esta conformado por tre señoras las cuales se dedican a la elavoracion de guipiles y a la venta de los mismos,ellas nos cuenta que llevan ya barios años de dedicarse a esta actividad y estan contentas ya que pues han tenido demanda de sus clientes y sus ganancias han mejorado pero ahora ellas solicitaneste credito para la compra de materia prima porque con lo que tienen no les alcanza para seguir elavorando mas guipiles,el sueño de ellas es darles a sus hijos lo mejor para que en un futuro tengan mas oportunidades de desarollo y sean unos profecionales.
texts.en:
Solidario los Cipresales is a group of three women that dedicate themselves to the production and sale of guipiles [Mayan blouses].  They tell us that they have done this for many years and are happy that they are in demand to their customers, and that their earnings have improved.

But now they ask for this loan to purchase primary materials because what they have is not enough to make more guipiles.  Their dream is to give their children the best so that in the future, they can have more development opportunities and become professionals.

loans.use: purchase primary materials.

loans.name: Luzviminda Catembung's Group

texts.en:
Luzviminda dreams of becoming a successful livestock farmer. She works hard to attain this to improve her family's living standard. She is already 41 years old and married with three school-aged children. Her husband is a farmer who tills a rice and corn field. Farming has been their main source of income. 

She raises pigs for fattening and sale, which is her family's alternative source of income to support the studies of her children. It is very helpful when there are emergencies. She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 as additional capital to buy feed and medicines for her piglets. Some of the loan will also be used to buy fertilizers for their farm. After two years of raising pigs, Luz had proven that this business is very helpful for her family needs.

loans.use: To buy feed and medicines for her piglets and to buy fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Nyamdorj is 27 years old.  He lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the  Uvs province of Mongolia. He manages a shoemaking business in his town with the help of his wife. Nyamdorj started this business in 2009 and has gained much experience. Now he makes a variety of Mongolian traditional shoes that sell for 40,000-50,000 MNT per pair. His business is one of the most profitable businesses in his town. With his earnings, Nyamdorj bought a washing machine and a motorcycle for his family. He is a hardworking man who is planning to expand his occupation and open a construction business. 

Nyamdorj is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials for his business.

loans.use: buy materials for his shoemaking business

loans.name: Estebana De La Concepcion

texts.es: Estebana de la Concepción tiene su pulpería. Hace más 15 años que tiene este negocio, la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a su vivienda en busca de los diferentes productos que ofrece, siempre esta preocupándose por brindar un buen servicio y sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos. Ella tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, con el paso del tiempo les ha enseñado a ganarse la vida de una forma muy honrada. Es por este motivo que realiza el crédito para la compra de sopas, enlatados, fósforos, pan, cremas, granos básicos y detergente.
texts.en: Estebana de la Concepción has her own grocery store.  She has had this business for more than 15 years, and most of her customers come to her store looking for the different products that she offers.  She is always concerned about providing good service and satisfying her customers.  She has 3 minor children in her care, and over time she has taught them to earn a living in an honest way.  She will use the proceeds of this loan to purchase soups, canned goods, matches, bread, creams, staple grains and detergent.

loans.use: to buy soups, canned goods, matches, bread, creams, staple grains and detergent

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.es: Uldarico de 30 años de edad, natural de la comunidad de Limonchayocc caserío de la ciudad de San Francisco, Uldarico convive con Consuelo de 28 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 02 hijos y habitan en su propio lecho construido a base de material rustico madera y techo de calamina. Uldarico con tanto cuidado logró reanudar sus parcelas en áreas verdes, rodeado de arboles frondosos a la vez cultivados con plantas de cacao, café y frutos de piña, donde viene realizando su actividad desde hace 12 años con el apoyo de los jornaleros. Uldarico menciona que desde muy niño aprendió a arar la tierra gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres y hoy trabaja sus propias tierras. Su producto mas rentable es la venta de café, porque los vende en cantidad  y a un buen precio,  y gracias a las ganancias adquiridas logró comprar animales de carga, como burros para facilitarse con el traslado de sus productos. Durante los meses de Junio a Agosto son tiempos donde mayormente siembra todo tipo de plantas, razón por la cual Uldarico acude a la entidad Financiera para tramitar sus crédito y poder sembrar mas plantas de café y frutos de piña. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir sembrando y adquiriendo mas espacios de terreno para así sobresalir de la pobreza que convive su familia. Este será su sexto crédito y está muy contento de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero de parte de ustedes, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su proyecto planeado. En su banco comunal es un socio solidario y vela por el progreso de su grupo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de café y piña.
texts.en:
Uldarico is 30 years old and a native of the village community of Limonchayocc in the city of San Francisco. He is in a common-law marriage with Conseulo, age 28, and their relationship resulted in two children. They live in their own home made of basic materials such as wood and tin. Uldarico carefully manages his parcels of green farmland surrounded by lush trees. He grows cacao, coffee, and pineapples. Uldarico has been farming for 12 years with the help of day laborers. He says that as a young boy he learned from his parents how to plow the land. Today he works on his own property. The product that is most profitable is the sale of coffee because he is able to sell in bulk and at a good price. With the profits he earned Uldarico was able to buy domesticated animals, such as donkeys, for transporting his products. The period from June to August is when he can plant all types of crops. For this reason, Uldarico approached MFP to request a loan so that he can sow more coffee and pineapple plants. His plans are to continue farming and acquiring more land so that his family can overcome poverty.

This will be his sixth loan and he is pleased to know that he has everyone’s support. Uldarico is confident that he can move forward with his plans. He is a supportive member of his Communal Bank and helps to oversee the progress of his group. This loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy coffee and pineapple seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and pineapple seedlings.

loans.name: Cristina Rosaura

texts.es: La señora Cristina es casada y tiene una hija de 18 años de edad, cristina se dedica a vender producto de belleza de diferentes catalagos como E bel, Avon, Esika entre otros,  viene laborando en esta actividad por casi 2 años , su esposo trabaja como maestro constructor y con los ingresos que genera ayuda en los gastos familiares, el préstamo que esta solicitando es para mejoramiento de vivienda,para comprar los materiales de construcción como ladrillo, cemento, arena,entre otros  cristina desea construir un cuarto mas en su casa, como toda mujer luchadora cristina tiene sueños uno de ellos es que su hija termine su carrera universitaria y también desea convertirse con el tiempo en una supervisora de los productos que vende y así tener mas ingresos para su bienestar familiar, cristina esta muy agradecida con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Cristina is married and has an 18-year-old daughter.  Cristina sells cosmetics from various catalogues like Ebel, Avon and Esika, among others.  She’s been working in this line of work for almost two years.  Her husband works as a master builder and helps meet family expenses with the income he earns.  

The loan she’s requesting is to do some home improvements.  She will buy building materials and supplies like bricks, cement and sand, among others.  Cristina wants to add an additional room to her house.

Like any hard working woman, she has dreams.  One of them is that her daughter completes her university studies and she also wants to become, in time, a sales supervisor of the products she sells to have more income for her family’s wellbeing.  Cristina is very grateful for the trust placed in her.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 53 years old.  She is married and has 6 children, 1 of whom is in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.  She has been raising livestock for 23 years now, and has borrowed and repaid 19 loans in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Helen has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise and sell.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more livestock

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda de 36 años de edad, convive con augusto de 41 con quien tiene 3 hermosos hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sta. Rosa Alta del distrito de Sivia. Para Yolanda su único objetivo es: “salir adelante“. Desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar muy arduamente para poder ayudar a sus padres en el gasto familiar.  Ella vendía los productos que cosechaban sus padres y ganaba sus primeras propinas.  Hoy tiene su propio terreno de cultivo, para la producción de Cacao, por el cual agradece profundamente a sus padres por el apoyo y las enseñanzas que le brindaron. Ella aún no se conforma por ello aspira en adquirir un terreno agrícola para poder incrementar su cultivo de cacao y otros productos para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su querido esposo y el de sus hijos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete a realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Yolanda esta feliz con el apoyo que recibe de su banco comunal. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles que solicita, desea adquirir un terreno agrícola.
texts.en: Yolanda is 36 and lives with Augusto who is 41 years old. They have three beautiful children together. They in their own home, located in the Sta Rosa Alta community of Sivia. Yolanda's only goal is to get ahead. She has had to work very hard since she was very young in order to help her parents with household expenses. She used to sell the products that her parents grew and she earned her first tips this way. Now she has her own farmland, where she grows cocoa. She is very grateful to her parents for their support and for everything they taught her. Yolanda would like to buy more farmland in order to increase her production of cocoa and other products. She has the support of her husband and three children. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is committed to repaying her loan on time. Yolanda is very happy with the support she receives from the community bank. With the $550 she plans to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Ashia

texts.en: Ashia is 32 years old and lives in Sinkor, Liberia.  She is married, her husband is a businessman, and they have no child presently.  For the past three years she has been selling soda and cold water and she has a lot of customers so her business is profitable.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more  crates of soda for her business.  In the near future, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of soda

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is married and her husband has a business selling groceries. He runs a grocery shop where he sells daily-use items such as spices, sugar etc. He is very fair in his rates and offers his customers good variety to choose their required products. 

Bashiraan is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Both of her sons also operate grocery businesses while her daughter is studying in class 10. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to be able to put in his shop for fulfilling the orders on time and increasing his profits. 

Bashiraan is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and her family will be able to live better as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bashiraan.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 47-year-old married man and father of 4 children. He has been working in agriculture for 15 years. Ali plants tobacco. His production is of very good quality as experts claim. Ali also works as a taxi driver. He uses his car for both businesses, transporting people and harvested tobacco to customers. He believes in customer care, and tobacco delivery is one of the best kinds of customer service he can provide.
Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new car to replace the old one he has. He will sell the old car and invest the proceeds to add to the requested loan, in order to pay the whole price. This car will improve both business sectors which will reflect positively on his family's social and financial situations.
This is Ali's first experience with Al Majmoua and he hopes it will have a very positive effect on future improvements.

loans.use: To buy a new car necessary for his business

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is 35 years old and married to a trader. They have five children, all of whom are in the school. She has a business selling bread and ice cream in Buluk branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Joice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread to sell. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Assia

texts.en:
Assia is a married woman with three children who are still attending school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past seven years; her potential clients are the residents of Kwale. She faces a major challenge of seasonality: there is no fish in the cold season. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase fish for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it’s friendly and flexible to clients needs.

loans.use: To purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna, a 44-year-old married mother of eight,  works hard to provide for her family. She has operated a sari-sari store in the Philippines for a year, and also earns an income from rice retailing. Having borrowed and repaid two previous loans from NWTF, Lorna is now requesting a new one for PHP 10000 to purchase more goods to sell, and aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
Fabiana  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad y es soltera.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.
La señora Fabiana trabaja desde hace cinco años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incremento al capital de su negocio de venta de artesanías en bordados de paisajes y culturas, venta de golosinas y galletas.
Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de treinta docenas de cometas para venderlo en las fiestas de todos los santos, vende en Desaguadero y Yunguyo, en el negocio le ayudan sus hermanas.
Su deseo es terminar el 2do. piso de su casa y tener más capital para el negocio.  Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Fabiana is a member  of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” communal bank located in Julí district, Chucuito province, in Puno department. She is 55 and single. She studied as far a high school.

Fabiana has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years. Her first loan was for the sum of 300 nuevos soles. She used the money to increase the working capital of her business selling handicrafts embroidered with scenery and cultural designs. She also sells candy and cookies.

She will apply for a new loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, and use it to buy thirty dozen kites to sell at the All Saints Day festivals. She sells in the towns of Desaguadero and Yunguyo, and her sisters help her in the business.  

She wishes to complete the second story of her house, and have more working capital for the business. What she likes about the communal bank are the easy terms for the loan.

loans.use: To buy thirty dozen kites.

loans.name: Rolando Alberto

texts.es:
Ronaldo vive con su esposa y un hijo, es casado, se dedica a la agricultura, este trabajo lo inicio por su propia iniciativa, no tiene un horario establecido que le permita laborar, cuenta con experiencia ya que lo realiza desde hace mucho tiempo.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de 6 sacos de abono para la siembra, esta compra le ayudara a sacar una buena cosecha y a mejorar sus ingresos económicos en el hogar.
Su mayor sueño es crecer económicamente para sacar adelante a su familia y darle el estudio adecuado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ronaldo lives with his wife and son.  He’s married and works in farming.  He started this work on his own initiative.  He does not have a fixed work schedule.  He has experience since he’s been doing this for a very long time.

He’s asking for a loan to buy six sacks of manure for his crops.  This purchase will help him produce a good harvest and improve his home’s income.  His greatest dream is to grow economically to move his family forward and give his children an adequate education.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of manure.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a mother of four children, ages 23, 19, 17 and 9, with the last two children still in school. She has been in the farming business for 10 years and currently produces beans, potatoes, maize and milk, which she sells to the local market.

Monica has made a loan request for 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. She would like to use 32,000 KES to purchase a water tank and 3,000 KES for irrigation pipes. She says this will help her production during dry spells and improve her income, which will be helpful in educating her two youngest children.

Monica says her main business challenge is inadequate rainfall for farming. She says she has a long-term plan of acquiring more farm land. She adds that Juhudi Kilimo loans are helpful since they come with grace periods.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Manuk

texts.en:
Manuk is 22 years old. He lives in Tsovagyugh village in the Sevan area with his parents and his brother. Manuk is studying by correspondence at Yerevan State Economic University, and at the same time Manuk and his family members are engaged in animal breeding. They have a plot of land where they raise cows, pigs and chickens. The main line of their business is cattle breeding, so they produce a large amount of milk, which they sell to a procurement agency, and meat that they sell to butcher shops. 

Thanks to farming, Manuk and his family provide for themselves and pay for Manuk’s education. To increase the family’s income Manuk intends to develop his farm, and so he is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy 3 more cows.

loans.use: To buy 3 more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 11 children. 

Merly has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy a stock of clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon.

Merly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a resident of Kitale and has been in the farming business for four years, producing eggs and milk for the local market. She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 13, all of whom are in school.

Francisca has requested a loan of 41,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy poultry birds at 10,000 KES and a dairy cow at 31,200 KES. She says she will be able to get more milk for family consumption as well as to sell in order to meet other family needs. She wants to manage her farming business well so that she can install a cereals grinding machine in the local market.

She laments the remaining challenge of food and water shortages during dry seasons.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds and a dairy cow and to insure the cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for soft drinks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is 39 years old and has three children, one daughter and two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hang and her husband have been running a food stall for thirteen years. They sell noodles to people in the local community. She would like a 15,000,000 VND loan from CEP to buy furniture to place around her stall, bowls, chopsticks and meat to expand her business and meet her customers' demands.

Hang hopes that through this loan she can earn more money and save more for reinvestment.

loans.use: To buy furniture, bowls, chopsticks and meat for her stall.

loans.name: Evens

texts.en:
Evens is learning project management at a Haitian university. Apart from his study, he is running an eco-friendly shop where his team manufactures brooms and wine racks. "Evens has a brilliant future in his business" testifies his mentor. However, he needs wise investment to offer a variety of products at low cost.His products, though very durable, lack some finish. That why he wants a loan to improve them as well increasing them. Evens'employees show a wonderful mixture of people coming from shanty towns and middle-class people. Evens' team has a vision to make a green Haiti. They are all in the picture.
From left to right in the picture, you will see:
Jean, as a volunteer, holds a green broom.
Dieufene, as a worker, holds a gray broom.
Sebastien, as a volunteer, hods a red broom.
Vanessa(volunteer) is behind Sebeastien.
Evens, as the CEO, is in the back.
Sooky, as co-manager, is smiling.
Carl, as a volunteer, holds a wine rack.
Alabre, as a worker, wears the sunglasses.

loans.use: To buy a polisher machine, a generator and some hardware tools

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina lives in Yombo area,on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam.She is married with four children.She sells maize flour,beans ,rice and other types of dry food.Her clients are food vendors and several restaurants in Temeke district of Dar es Salaam.She buys these food items from wholesellers and pack them on bags of 5-10 kilogrammes ready for resale.She is planning to increase stock for these food items as she usually faced with stockouts.Christina is worried about these stockouts ,competitors may take this as an advantage and reduce her market share.To meet her planning target she is need of USD 400.

loans.use: INCREASE STOCK

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili owns a hairdressing salon in a busy area of Kariakoo in Dar es Salaam. The salon is well situated and thus fetches a lot of customers. She has built a strong relationship with her regular customers who act as ambassadors to new ones. As a result she has more customers than she can serve.

She wants to employ one more assistant to the two she currently has, add a stock of hairdressing materials, driers and chairs. To facilitate this plan she is in need of USD750.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Mr. Antonio owns a well-located diner in a main street, where he sales traditional dishes, lunches and breakfasts. He started his business with the initiative of his wife who motivated him to save $300, since they already owned the kitchen and a few tables.

At the beginning he mostly served breakfasts to people in his neighbourhood. Now, and thanks to his wife's cooking skills, his clientèle has increased and he now sales lunches and traditional dishes as well.

With this loan Antonio is hoping to improve the shop so that they can attend better and to more clients, and he is hoping to buy the cooking utensils they are lacking.

Antonio is confident that with the shop's improvements and the purchase of cooking utensils he can increase the clientèle and hence provide his family with the stability they need.

Antonio is 51 years old. He has an 8 year old son who is still studying. They live in a house made of cement in a corner of a main street. He considers that with the shop's improvements he can improve the life quality for all his family.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


El Sr. Antonio tiene un comedor muy bien ubicado en una calle pricipal donde vende platos tipicos, almuerzos y meriendas. El empezo su negocio por iniciativa de su esposa que le motivo a que ahorrada 300 teniendo el la cocina y unas mesas. Primero el atendia a las persona de su vecindario vendiendo solo almuerzos. Actualmente debido a la buena sazon de su esposa su clientela ha aumentado y vende meriendas y platos tipicos. Con este prestamo Antonio tiene pensado adecuar su local para poder de mejro manera a mas clientes y comprar mas utensilios de cocina que le estan haciendo falta. Antonio tiene la seguridad de que con las adecuacione de su local y la compra de más utensilios podra aumentar su clientela y asi poder darle la estabilidad que su familia necesita. Antonio tiene 51 años, un hijo de 8 años que estudia y una vivienda de cemento en calle principal y es esquinera. El considera que con los arrglos de su negocio podra mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.

loans.use: Shop improvements

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.en:
Maria Mercedes M. Garcia, 50, buys vegetables at one market and then sells them at another market in the major city of Quetzaltengo. Some of the vegetables she sells are radishes, carrots, lettuce, and other cool weather vegetables. 
Maria  will buy a calf with the next loan and raise it to sell. She does not have her own pasture so she will have to take the bull to various grazing places, like along the side of the road. The town where she lives grows lots of vegetables and there is little if any land for cattle to graze, so she will lead it by a rope to various places where there is a patch of grass to graze. It might be a mound of grass in the back of the neighbor's house or along the side of the road or high in the hills. She may tie it up there or may hang out with it all day so the it can eat enough to grow into a full blown bull to sell for the meat: She hopes to sell the bull for up to Q4000 ($525) Maria is a widow and lives with her daughter. She had five children and three lived to adulthood, but two died of a fever that struck the village. She has never had schooling and can not read.
As you can see in the picture, Maria wears the beautiful traditional Mayan skirt and top called a huipil which identifies what village she comes from. The huipil is the most valuable possession a woman from the highlands of Guatemala can own and is often their only possession. She is very proud of the three beautiful huipils she has been able to acquire over her adult life.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase and raise a calf for sale

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is 30 years old and lives in the northeastern Azerbaijan region known as Khachmaz. He works as a taxi driver, using his own car to transport people around town and to distant places such as Baku. His income is not what it could be because his car is old and prone to break down, especially if he drives long distances. He has applied for a loan of $300 to repair his car so that he can provide better service to his customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 61 years old and has eight children. Her husband died 10 years ago, and since that time she has raised and provided for her family on her own. She has a small shop that is open seven days a week and sells items needed by the people of her village. She has applied for a loan of $300 to buy inventory to sell. She believes that the loan will help her earn more income, and may also allow her to employee three of her children as helpers.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Pahala

texts.id:
Pahala resides in Bali since 1984 and his work is selling carpet in surrounding area. Pahala sells carpet purchased from the carpet factory in surrounding area with a bicycle. He starts this carpet selling activity from 7:30 in the morning until 4 in the evening. Each carpet costing Rp. 40.000 (about USD4) is sold for Rp. 60.000 (about USD6); each day Pahala usually sell 3 to 4 carpets. The profit generated is used to fund purchase of more carpets and also to pay for daily living expenses. Father of 1 child still in middle school, he wants to be able to provide adequate education to be a professional carpet merchant.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Pahala tinggal di Bali sejak tahun 1984 dan usaha yang dijalani usaha adalah penjual karpet keliling. Karpet yang di beli dari gudang karpet yang ada di Monang-maning dijual oleh Pahala dengan cara berkeliling menggunakan sepeda onthel. Dia uali menjual karpetnya pada pukul 07.30 pagi sampai jam 4 sore. Satu karpet dibelinya dengan harga 40.000 rupah dan dijual oleh Pahala dengan harga 60.000 rupiah, dalam sehari kadang Pahala bisa menjual 3 sampai 4 karpet. Keutungan yang diperoleh dipergunakan untuk modal untuk membeli karpet dan juga buat biaya hidup setiaphari. Bapak satu anak ini mampu menyekolahkan anaknya yang masih SMP hanya dengan berprofesi sebagai penjual karpet.

loans.use: Capital to purchase carpets (Modal untuk membeli Karpet)

loans.name: Alifmo

texts.ru:
Alifmo S. is 61 years old. She has a college education, married and has 4 children. Alifmo is in a retail business and sells children's winter clothing at one of the markets of Vahdat city. She has been in the retail business for the past 4 years. She will use her loan to get a new assortment of merchandise. The loan will also give an opportunity for the locals to buy the necessary clothing for the children at affordable prices because the closest market is 30 kilometers away from the city of Vahdat. Alifmo plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сулаймонова Алифмо – 61 год, образование высшее, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Алифмо занимается торговлей детской зимней одеждой на одном из рынков города Вахдата. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на приобретение нового ассртимента товара. Этим видом деятельности она занимаетя уже в течение 4 лет. Данный кредит даст возмлжность местным жителям приобретать необходимые детские вещи для маленьких детей по приемлемым ценам, так как близлежащий рынок находится на расстояние 30 км о города Вахдата. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
"I've tried to make improvements to my home but in reality the economic situation is very tough. I already did the roof of a room and now I would like to install tile flooring to avoid rain water from collecting in front of my house. This causes humidity in the walls and hence diseases for my family" I am requesting $1,200 to put tile flooring in my house.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


“He tratado de hacerle mejoras a mi vivienda pero en realidad la situación económica esta muy difícil, ya le hice un techo de losa a un cuarto y ahora me gustaría poner vitropiso para evitar que el agua de las lluvias se junte en la entrada de mi casa, ya que esto provoca humedad en las paredes y por lo tanto enfermedades para mi familia”. Solicito $ 1.200.00 dlls para poner vitropiso en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Tile flooring my house / Poner vitropiso en mi vivienda

loans.name: Thi Xuan

texts.vi:
Mrs Xuân is 38 years old. She has 2 young children. Selling waste metal and raising poultry are the main source of income for her family. She makes between 50000-70000 VND a day (~3.15-4.40 USD). She has borrowed from lenders before and she nad repaid. She likes SEDA loan condition plus she can make weekly payment and it does not require collateral. She is requesting a loan of 200600 VND to have capital to buy waste metal.

Translated by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Xuân, 38 tuổi, có 2 con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Đi chợ sắt vụn và chăn nuôi gà là hai nghề chính tạo thu nhập cho gia đình chị. Thu nhập trung bình của cả nhà cũng được 50000-70000 đồng/ngày. Chị đã từng vay ở ngoài và đã trả hết. Chị thích vay ở Chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc hơn vì được trả góp và không phải thế chấp, nên chị đã vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn đi chợ.

loans.use: buy waste metal

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe Martinez is married with 5 children. He works in agriculture, in the municipality of El Sauce where he has a small ranch. His ranch is located quite far from his house and he has to travel there by horse, which is the main means of transportation in this area.

Because he is a very responsible person, he has worked in this business for most of his life. It generates a small income for maintaining his home and his children. In order to improve this situation and provide a better standard of living to his family, Mr. Martinez has decided to request a loan from Ceprodel so that he can purchase some pregnant cows, from which he can get milk to sell and later on, sell the calves.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Felipe Martinez es un caballero casado y con 5 hijos a su deber. Se dedica en el municipio El Sauce al negocio de agropecuario teniendo su propia finca y por el hecho de estar ubicada muy alejado de su casa de habitación, debe de trasladarle hacia ella cabalgando un caballo que es su medio de transporte en esta localidad.

Por ser una persona muy responsable, ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a este negocio el cual le genera bajos ingreso para la mantención de su hogar y de sus hijos. Para mejorar esta situación y consiente de que debe de proporcionar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida, el señor Martinez ha decidido solicitar crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de dar lugar a la compra de vacas en preñez para así extraer de ellas la leche para su respectiva venta y luego comercializar sus productos derivados de este animal.

loans.use: Purchase cattle.

loans.name: Sugeng

texts.id:
This loan if approved would be the second loan for Sugeng P.. In the first loan, his payment record is good. His printing business also is progressing compared to earlier times. This time there were so many orders that need to be printed, from greetings, invitations and posters. Because of the many orders, Sugeng could not finish it all by himself. Therefore he is employing his brother to assist him. The objective of this loan is to buy raw materials, like cloth, paper and ink. At the moment Sugeng lives in Pulau Pinang street with his wife and two children.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Pinjaman kali ini merupakan pinjaman kedua bagi Sugeng P.. Pada pinjaman tahap pertama, rekor pembayarannya bagus. Usaha percetakannyapun memiliki kemajuan dibandingkan sebelumnya. Saat ini begitu banyak pesanan yang harus dicetak, mulai dari kartu ucapan, undangan dan baliho atau spanduk. Karena begitu banyaknya pesanan, Sugeng sampai kewalahan untuk menyelesaikan semuanya sendiri. Karena itu ia mempekerjakan saudaranya untuk membantunya . Tujuan dari pinjaman kali ini untuk membeli bahan baku untuk percatakan sepeerti kain, kertas dan tinta. Sugeng saat ini tinggal di Jl.Pulau Pinang bersama istri dan kedua anaknya.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional scratch cards and telephone accessories to expand her business.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina S., 35, is married with 5 children. She has 2 years of experience in the food and restaurant business. She operates the restaurant and sells food to the public 6 days a week. She has received 1 prior loan from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

SPBD loans are Nina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. The loan will be used to organise the restaurant and purchase goods needed to run the restaurant . Her husband also helps out in running the business.

loans.use: To purchase goods and equipment for the restaurant.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam S., 56, is a mother of six children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a basketmaker, making various kinds of baskets and selling them outdoors. Her husband has been a motor-taxi driver since 2006 and makes $3 each day of profit. Most of the Cambodian people living in Siem Reap operate a souvenir store and some run a motor-taxi business. All of their children are married and only one child still lives at home. 

Mrs. S. would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, to purchase more bamboo to make more baskets to meet her customers' demands, and the leftover would be used to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. (Mrs. Lam is pictured with her old mother at home.)

loans.use: Purchase more bamboo to make baskets.

loans.name: Emiliana Adela

texts.es:
Emiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Emiliana es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Emiliana tiene un pequeño taller de corte y confección de prendas en su casa, actividad que realiza sola, Emiliana confecciona ropa típica de la zona como blusas, fustanes, mandiles, los cuales son vendidos en los diferentes pueblos del distrito de Socos a donde viaja los días sábados, vende al crédito. Además Emiliana trabaja por las tardes como personal de servicio en una institución estatal y por las noches se dedica a la confección de las prendas.

Emiliana necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas variadas. Los sueños de Emiliana son construir su casa, mejorar más su negocio y que sus hijos estudien para ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a member of the Arco Iris Communal Bank.

Emiliana lives with her partner, is 43 years old and has four children. Emiliana has a small seamstress shop in her home, an activity that she does alone. Emiliana produces typical clothing for her area such as blouses, slips and aprons, which are sold in different towns in the Socos district where she travels on Saturdays and sells on credit. In addition, Emiliana works in the afternoons as a service person at a state institution and, at night, dedicates herself to making garments.

Emiliana needs a loan of 2,800 soles which she will invest in the purchase of various fabrics. Emiliana's dreams are to build a house, improve her business more, and that her children study to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Emiliana needs a loan of 2,800 soles which she will invest in the purchase of various fabrics.

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en: Alisa R. comes from Te anj. She is married and her husband is employed. She is a housewife and she does a lot of work in agriculture. She produces different sorts of vegetables and some of what she produces she sells and some is for her own use. Beside that she has a cow and goats. She has requested a loan through WWI in the amount of 1200 KM to buy livestock fodder. She hopes that she will sell all her young goats around New Year and be able to buy others to raise.

loans.use: To buy livestock fodder

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina H. has been selling clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She earns a profit of approximately $25 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop and increase her sales and profit. If this loan helps her to expand her business, she intends to use the increased profits to pay her children's school fees and improve her home.

Amina is 25 years old, divorced, and has two children, aged 3 and 5. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Aziza, Siti, Hadia and Mwajuma. Each has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elmita

texts.en:
In the little village of Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental lives Mrs. Elmita M. L., 53 years old, married and with 5 children. Her husband is 73 years old is still able to fix cars and trucks and is known as a good mechanic in their area.

Elmita started their little "sari-sari" (convenience) store after their marriage and also raises swine as their other source of income. By these means, they were able to send their children to school. Luckily, all got stable jobs, 3 are happily married and 2 are still single. It hasn't been the case that they sit prettily as all the children got their jobs. They continue the store and swine businesses for their own living. To give them company, their "apos" (grandchildren) live with them.

Elmita joined Paglaum MPC after a friend referred her. She is attracted to the programs and services like micro financing, livelihood program and other benefits like dividends and insurance. Mrs. L. has already been a member for more than a year. She is a member in good standing and very helpful to her co-group members. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 12,000.00 and is intending to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store and additional feed for hog fattening.

All she wants for her life now is to live comfortably in their renovated house.

loans.use: Sari-sari Store (Mini Store) and Hog Fattening

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu S. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through primary level. Salamatu sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Praso market near Abura, as she has done since 2006. Her husband is a teacher.

Salamatu uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the financial needs of the family. Salamatu will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Salamatu plans to invest in a building project she is embarking on with her husband for their family.

loans.use: to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale

loans.name: Kek

texts.en: Kek K. lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He earns a living by providing building services as a construction worker, as well as catching fish by using nets and traps and selling them in the market. He has been running his businesses for a long time ago. He is married to Sar Sameth, who is a good mother of three children; all of them are single and attend school. She is a local cultivator, and she also is a housewife who cooks delicious meals for her family and is especially good at caring children. K. hopes to begin a new investment and to earn mor income. Thus he would like to request a loan to purchase a trailer-motorcycle (tuk tuk) to pick up passengers. (K.'s wife is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase a trailer- motorcycle

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Lafia sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelle avec les frères, sœurs, enfants  et époux dans le village Coni sous préfecture de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Grâce à des liens de mariage et de voisinage ces femmes se sont connues et exercent toutes le commerce de savon de fabrication traditionnelle appelé «  gabacourouni. » 
Dans le souci de développer leur commerce elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et tous les précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Elles comptent acheter, 1500 morceaux de savons de fabrication locale avec les commerçants grossistes de Fana  pour les revendrent en détail au comptant ou en crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes dans le village de Coni.
Elles espèrent obtenir un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA  chacune, qui sera utilisé pour l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the group Lafia are married women who average 28 years of age and three children. They live in traditional conjugal families with brothers, sisters, children, and spouses in the village of Coni (Fana sub-prefecture, Dioïla prefecture) in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. Thanks to ties of marriage and community, they got to know one another. They all do commerce in soap called "gabacourouni" that is made in the traditional way.

Concerned about developing their commerce, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The women plan to buy 1,500 pieces of locally-made soap from wholesalers from Fana in order to resell them, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men and women in the village of Coni.

The group members each hope to obtain a profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used for educating the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Pagmatsogsmaa

texts.en:
Pagmatsogsmaa S. is a married woman with one child, living in Uvurhangay province. Uvurhangay is a one of Mongolia's southern provinces, located 400 km from the capital city, Ulaanbaatar. Pagmatsogsmaa and her family live in a "ger," which is the traditional, nomadic house in Mongolia. Her ger is situated in what is known as a “ger district,” an ad hoc settlement where many families live in gers near one another.

Since 2007 she has been running a food stall business with her own stall and employing one saleswoman. She buys candy, biscuits, cookies, chocolates, dried fruits, etc. from wholesalers and re-sells them. Her business income from the food stall is her family’s main source of income.

Pagmatsogsmaa has said in Mongolian: "I have a dream to have my own supermarket in the future". With the Lunar New Year celebration approaching, small items have sold quickly; therefore, she wants a loan to buy more food products for her food stall.

loans.use: to buy more food products such as candy, biscuits, chocolate etc.

loans.name: Chhang

texts.en:
Chhang C. R., 26, is a professional decorator of handicrafts living at home in the Takeo province. Since 2005, she has been using beads and other materials to make flowers on women's clothing to earn a living, and typically makes US$5 each day. Decorated dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and the price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer handmade to machine made. Her husband sells wood and earns US$20 in revenue every day.

In order to increase her profits, she is asking for a loan of US$500 to raise pigs. (She is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Hamady

texts.fr: Hamady B. est un jeune de 25ans habitant à kolda. Il est marié et pére d'un enfant. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille,il méne des activités commerciales. Ainsi chaque matin, il s'approvisionne, chez le fabricant, en laits caillé mis dans des sachets de 100 et de 200F CFA, et avec son vélo, il parcours la ville de kolda de long en large pour la revente. Cette activité lui permet d'avoir des revenus avec lesquelles il assure les fonctions de pére de famille. Ainsi il voudrait pouvoir élargir sa clientéle(boutiques, restaurants, alimentations) par ses propres moyens.
texts.en:
Hamady B., 25, lives in Kolda. He is married and the father of one child. To support his family, he is engaged in a small business. Every morning, he gets his daily supply from the person who prepares buttermilk in bags at 100 and 200 F CFA and, on his bicycle, he pedals up and down through the town of Kolda, re-selling the buttermilk. This business allows him to make enough money to function as the father of a family. Thus, he would like to expand his clientele (shops, restaurants, grocery stores) with his own means.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking and re-selling buttermilk in bags

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama S., twenty eight years, is a married woman with three children who are in school. Mariama lives with her family at Bawjiase, a suburb of Sweduru in Ghana. She runs a small provision kiosk in her neighborhood. She also sells food items such as macaroni, tomatoes, etc. on a table top in front of her kiosk. She has been in business for seven years.

 Mariama buys her goods from wholesalers in the city and markets in nearby towns.  She desires to buy the goods in bulk whenever she travels to the city in order to save her the problem of frequent trips. She is in a group called “Shining Star”. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de María es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos.
Flor de María es casada, tiene46 años, dos hijos de 20 y 18 años, ellos estudian en instituto superior.
Flor de María ha puesto en su casa una bodega y poco a poco la está surtiendo. 
Flor de María necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de gaseosa, abarrotes para su bodega.
 Desde que Flor de María está en Finca, su autoestima ha crecido,   tiene más seguridad, tiene independencia económica.
El sueño de Flor de María es que su negocio crezca y tener su bodega bien surtida.
texts.en:
Flor de María is a member of the communal bank “los Viñedos.” She is married, 46 years old, and has two children, ages 20 and 18, who are both college students. Flor de María has opened a small store in her home and is stocking it bit by bit. She needs a loan of 1,400 soles to buy soft drinks and groceries for her store. Since Flor de María has been with Finca, she has gained more self esteem, become more sure of herself, and increased her economic independence. Flor de María’s dream is to grow her business and have a well stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flor de María necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de gaseosa, abarrotes para su bodega.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y sus dos hijos.
La señora Petrona es comerciante y atiende su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en su domicilio y su esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte publico de esta ciudad.
El crédito solicitado es para incrementar los productos que tiene en su tienda y así mejorar los ingresos para la familia.
Esta es la octava vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002.
texts.en:
Mrs. Petrona C. lives in her own home in the Llojeta zone, near the city of La Paz. Petrona lives with her husband and two children. She works at a small store in her home, and her husband works as a driver for public transportation in the city. This loan will be used to increase the products in Petrona's store and thereby increase the family's income. This is the eighth time that Petrona has used a loan and her socioeconomic analysis qualifies her for access to credit. She has been an IMPRO client since 2002.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater variety of products to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Sarumi

texts.en: Sarumi is 41 years old and is married with one child. She has a shop where she sells plastics and gift items. Sarumi is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more plastics and gift items to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics and gift items to sell

loans.name: Emiline

texts.en:
Emiline F. is a 49-year-old woman with the determination and faith to get out from the ties of poverty. She is a mother to three children who are all of legal age. She is married to Joel, a private employee, but the salary of her husband is not enough for their daily needs.

As a woman of dreams, in 2005, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Since then, she opened a general store and it really helped them to meet their needs. Now on her seventh loan, she proposes the amount of 40,000 pesos to pay for cases of soft drinks, liquor, rice, and groceries for her store.

She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and KIVA, she can reach her aspiration to step out from poverty, expand her business, and pay for the needs of her children in school.

loans.use: To pay for cases of soft drinks, liquor, rice, and groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. is 41 years of age and is happily married to Rufino, who is a 42-year-old farmer. The two were blessed with four children whose ages range from 19 to 12 years old. All of her kids are in school and are accumulating bigger amounts of expenses each year. Through a business she has been growing for 19 years, she has been able to sustain her children's education. 

Carmelita's hog (pig) breeding and fattening (raising a pig for four months and selling after that) business started to grow when she availed a loan after she became a member of ASHI five years ago. Just recently, she sold eight piglets - which were the piglets of her raised pig amounting to PHP2,500. Aside from having a gilt (mother pig), she also has two hogs for fattening.

Because of the success she found in her business, the loan she is applying for will be used to purchase more piglets to raise and another gilt. She hopes that her business will prosper and that she can start up another business supported by the profit from her hog raising and breeding business so that she can employ some of the members of her family, especially her mother in- law.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and a gilt

loans.name: Rosa Paula

texts.es:
La señora ROSA PAULA V. S., tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS 
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria  , tiene 4hijos de y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
ROSA  se dedica a la confección  de ropa de vestir para damas , caballeros y niños.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de telas , hilos, tijeras, etc
Este crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá  en la compra de mas materiales de costuras para cubrir unos pedidos y también confeccionar prendas que ofrecerá a sus amistades, familiares y vecinos.
 ROSA   sueña con asociarse con una amiga y tener un pequeño taller de costuras.

loans.use: compra de mas materiales de costuras para confeccionar prendas

loans.name: Merema

texts.fr: Cette femme assure seule l’éducation scolaire de ses 02 enfants. Elle est mariée, mais elle a perdu son mari et est devenue veuve. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, elle s’est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce d’alimentation générale. Elle exerce cette activité dans sa maison dans le quartier Souza-Nétimé à Lomé. Elle a besoin d’avoir de nouveaux stocks, c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 01 carton de mayonnaises, 04 cartons de sardines, 05 cartons de tomates en boîtes, 05 cartons de Spaghetti, plusieurs sachets de savons en poudre et 05 cartons de piles de 3 voltes.
texts.en:
This woman is alone responsible for the schooling of her two children. She is married but she lost her husband and is a widow. To support her children, she began selling groceries in 2007. She does this business in her home in the Souza-Nétimé neighborhood in Lomé. She needs to replenish her stock and that is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 1 case of mayonnaise, 4 cases of sardines, 5 cases of tinned tomatoes, 5 cases of spaghetti, several bags of powdered soap and 5 cartons of 3-volt batteries.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Asenso

texts.en: Asenso M. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread  and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking materials .  Asenso is 35 years old and is Single.   She has no children.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more baking materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells plastic goods in the market and has been in the business for the past seventeen years. She is 50 years old and married with six children.

Esther hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more plastic goods to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel H. García tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente vive en casa propia en el Caserío San Antonio distrito de Santiago junto a su esposa y sus 3 menores hijos en edad escolar, anteriormente vivían en casa de sus suegros. Producto de su trabajo han comprado un terreno el cual lo han acondicionado con caña y adobe. Ambos laboran en empresas Agroindustriales desempeñando la labor de obreros de campo, sus suegros los apoyan con el cuidado de sus hijos cuando laboran. Su anhelo es construir su casa de material noble para brindar mejor seguridad a sus hijos. El Sr. Daniel y su esposa agradecen el apoyo que le podamos brindarle para lograr sus sueños otorgándole préstamos los cuales están dirigidos para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. Daniel H. García is 31 years old and in a common law marriage. He lives in his own home in the village of San Antonio, Santiago District, with his wife and 3 school-age children. They previously lived with his in-laws. With his income, Daniel bought a plot of land that is well-suited for growing sugar cane and making adobe. He and his wife both work in the agriculture industry as field laborers. His in-laws look after the children when they are at work.

Daniel desires to build a house out of quality materials so that he can provide better security for his children. He and his wife appreciate the support we can provide to help them achieve their dreams. The proceeds of this loan will be used to upgrade his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Upgrade his home with better materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a charcoal business

loans.name: Amine

texts.en:
Amine is a 31-year-old engaged man living in Hasbayya, Southern Lebanon. Amine is a school bus driver. He owns the bus and uses it in summer for touristic trips. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to continue building his house and for his wedding costs. 

Amine’s clients are his neighbors and friends’ children in addition to the tourists. His good public relations make him famous in the area. Amine experienced two years of micro-credit and he believes it’s worth it. He hopes to be the owner of a group of school buses, in addition to specialized touristic ones.

loans.use: To continue building his house and for his wedding costs

loans.name: El Aguacate Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Aguacate está integrado por Silvia L. quien vende comida ella empezó su negocio por la necesidad y la demanda que visualizo que tenían lo trabajadores de las empresas aledañas a su casa de adquirir alimentos. Mientras sus compañeras Eloisa L. y Miriam V. comercializan ropa de diferentes estilos.  

Ellas desean iniciar el nuevo año con trabajo, fuerza y la esperanza de  seguir laborando para que sus negocios crezcan. Es por esta razón que ellas desde los primeros días de este año trabajaran arduamente.
texts.en:
The group “El Aguacate” consists of Silvia L., Eloisa L., and Miriam V.. Silvia started her business selling food out of necessity and because she saw the demand among workers employed by businesses in her neighborhood to purchase something to eat. Her fellow group members, Eloisa and Miriam, sell clothing of different styles.

They wish to start the New Year with the work, strength, and hope needed to continue growing their businesses. This is why they have worked so hard the first few days of this year.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Ivone Guadalupe

texts.es: Ivone Guadalupe Jirón tiene una pequeña pulpería bien surtida. Ella comento que cuando inicio su negocio era muy pequeño ella solo vendía refrescos, helados, hielo y gaseosa pero poco a poco lo fue ampliando. Actualmente ella necesita de capital para poder comprar mayores cantidades  de los productos y nuevas inversiones.
texts.en:
Ivone Guadalupe Jirón has a small general store that is well-supplied. She told us that when she started her business, it was very small, and she only sold drinks, ice cream, ice, and soft drinks. But little by little, she grew her business. Currently she needs capital to be able to buy larger quantities of products and to make new investments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat, vegetables, cleaning products, beauty products, etc.

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San S., 56, is a hard working woman who resides in a rural area of Phnom Penh city. San S. cultivates rice and vegetable crops in the village, on which she earns a living. She is a widow and mother blessed with five children. Three of them are married and working at different jobs, while the remaining two are single. San S. also depends on the income from her sons who are construction laborers. San S. faced difficulty cooking foods because her house doesn’t include a suitable kitchen. Therefore, she has applied for a loan which will enable her to construct a kitchen. She will use some remaining money from the loan for her crop growing.

loans.use: To construct a kitchen.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora María Eugenia inicia su actividad  a las 7:00 am ofreciendo sus productos en las diferentes unidades inter urbanas y públicos en general de forma ambulante en el mercado la terminal.
Este crédito que solicito la señora Chavarria es para la compra de productos como: gaseosas, jugos, agua, y cosa de horno. 

Un hecho relevante de la señora María Eugenia es que este negocio lo inicio desde que era una niña alado de su mamá y fue en el mercado la terminal.

Es madre soltera de  tres niños, dos de ellos son los que  están en la escuela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Eugenia starts working at 7:00 am selling her products to customers using local and interurban buses in the market at the bus terminal. Mrs. Chavarria will use this loan to buy products like soda, juice, water, and baked goods. A relevant fact is that Maria Eugenia has worked in this business since she was a child assisting her mother. She is a single mother with three children, two of whom are in school.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soda, juice, water, and baked goods

loans.name: Brenda Aracely

texts.es:
La señora Brenda Aracely  C. Patzàn, es bordadora oficio que aprendió de su mamá desde que tenia 14 años, gracias a este oficio de bordara  pudo pagar ella misma sus estudios y se graduó de maestra  de educación primaria  ya estando casada.  Ahora tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad.    Además de bordar, tuvo la iniciativa de vender pollo que ella misma destaza, se levanta a las 4:30 de la mañana para destazar a los pollos y una persona le ayuda a venderlo ya que sale a trabajar toda la mañana como maestra y por la tarde se dedica a sus labores de bordado.

Es una joven mujer emprendedora  con muchos sueños y anhelos por su hijo, durante 3 años ha sido parte de un Banco de Confianza pero ahora  requiere de más capital para seguir trabajando, ella cuenta que esto le ha ayudado mucho y ha sido un apoyo para  su familia. Su sueño para el futuro y también un reto  es abrir un café  Internet en  su domicilio por la cercanía que tiene a la  escuela local, ya que no cuentan  con este servicio, y además de ser una oportunidad de mejorar económicamente también prestaría un servicio para su comunidad
texts.en:
Brenda Aracely C. P. is an embroiderer. She learned the craft from her mother starting when she was 14 years old. With her embroidery work, she was able to pay her way through school and received a license to teach primary school. She is married and has a three-year-old son. In addition to embroidery, she also started selling chickens that she butchers herself. She gets up at 4:30 in the morning to butcher the chickens, and someone else helps her sell them, since she goes off to work as a teacher in the mornings and in the afternoons works at her embroidery. She's a young, enterprising woman with many dreams for her little son. She's been a member of the Banco de Confianza for three years, but now she needs more funds in order to keep working. She reports that the village bank has helped her a lot and been a great support for her family. Her dream for the future -- as well as a challenge -- is to open an Internet café in her home, since it's near the local school and they don't already have this service locally. In addition to being an opportunity to be better off financially, it would also offer a service to her community.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest more in her business

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es: Reina de la Paz P. de 31 años de edad, reside en Santiago de María, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar como albañil y sus dos hijos de 2 y 1 año de edad. Reina posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado municipal de Santiago de María siempre ubicado al  oriente del país. Desde hace 8 años que ella posee este negocio, por medio del cual ha logrado crecer mucho como persona, ya que ha podido realizar uno de sus sueños el cual era contar con su propio negocio, es así como por medio de esta pueda brindarle ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que el trabajo de él en muchas ocasiones se vuelve algo inconstante por la falta de contratos, razón por la que Reina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras, las cuales le permitan contar con más clientes, a los cuales pueda satisfacer todas sus preferencias y deseos. Esto es de gran beneficio tanto para Reina como para su hogar ya que podrá contar con mucho más clientes y más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Reina de la Paz P. is 31 years old and resides in Santiago de María, located in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her husband, who works as a mason, and their two children (ages 2 and 1). Reina has a vegetable and fruit stand at the Santiago de María municipal market, which is located in the eastern part of the country. For the past eight years she has owned this business, which has enabled her to grow as a person.
