One of her dreams was to have her own business, so now she is able to help her husband with the household expenses.

On many occasions her work become unstable because of a lack of contracts, so Reina is requesting a loan so that she will have the money to buy more fruits and vegetables. This will allow her to gain more customers since she will be able to satisfy all of their preferences and desires. Having more customers will be of great benefit to Reina because it means she will have more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

location.town: Santiago de María, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Demetrio Calendonio

texts.es:
El señor Demetrio Calendonio C. es casado y habita en el barrio La Borgoña, tiene 9 hijos, los mayores están casados y los menores estudian y apoyan a sus padres en los trabajos del campo, debido a que los ellos se dedican a la agricultura de frutas cítricas.

Desde hace más de 26 años, se dedican a esto y fue con el apoyo de sus padres y su esfuerzo propio, que se valió de los recursos necesarios para realizar la compra de un terreno, ahora con el problema de la sequia y la afectación de los de las plagas y enfermedades, solicitan un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos vegetativos que provean a las tierras de mejores condiciones de producción que a futuro favorezcan económicamente a la familia.
texts.en:
Demetrio Calendonio C. is married and lives in the La Borgoña neighborhood. He has 9 children the older ones are married and the younger ones are students and help their parents with field work because they farm citrus fruits. They have been farmers for over 26 years. With help from his parents and his own effort he was able to buy a field. However, the current drought, pest infestations and plant illnesses make it necessary to request funds to buy fertilizers and farm supplies that will provide their lands with better production conditions that will favor the family in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fungicides.

loans.name: Inocência

texts.pt:
Inocência E. N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 1 filha de 3 anos de idade, ainda não vai a escola. Fez 12ą classe não continuou porque não conseguia ingressar no ensino superior. Vive na casa cedida pelos serviços e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Maputo para Boane quando se juntou ao seu marido. Trabalha como docente há mais de 06 anos é do quadro do Ministério da Educação, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 5.585.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Ja teve um empréstimo na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA e decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma colega que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, blocos, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 7.000.00mt para compra de bens. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para conclusão da sua casa e para aquisição de um meio de transporte próprio.
texts.en:
29 year-old Inocência E. N. was born in Maputo, in Southern Mozambique. Unable to continue her studies after high school, because she was not accepted into college, she left Maputo for Boane when she met the father of her daughter. The single mother of a 3 year-old girl, for the last six years Inocência has been working as a teacher for the Ministry of Education, earning a monthly salary of 5.585.00mt, which allows her to pay for her household expenses and to put some money into a savings account. Inocência has had a loan in the past with the credit cooperative TCHUMA. She heard about Hluvuku through a friend and this is her second loan with the institution. She plans to use the 15.000.00mt to buy construction material to continue building her house. She is committed to paying back her loan according to the loan's terms and plans to apply for more credit in the future, to finish the construction of her house and to buy a car.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sand, cement blocks, stones and other construction materials

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: This young lady is 30 years old. She is married to a chauffeur and they have two children. She sells different kinds of spices from her street stall, and has been in this sort of business for 20 years. She has requested her first loan from Kiva partner, WAGES, for 200,000 XOF to purchase spices and potash.

loans.use: To purchase spices and potash

loans.name: Magbesseh Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the “Magbesseh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka town who have applied for a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses and make more sales and better profits.

Fatmata B. (shown on the left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Masang, a village near Magburaka. She is approximately 40 years of age, married to a businessman, and they have five children; two of her children are attending primary school and three are in secondary school. 

Fatmata sells vegetable oil, groundnuts (peanuts) and Margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste). Fatmata has had many years of experience in business. With her share of this loan, she will buy more oil, groundnuts and Margi in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable oil, groundnuts and Margi in large quantities

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita A. is a widow who lives in Brgy. 8, Tanjay City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by buying and selling dried fish.

Zita joined Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of two previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through her hard work, Zita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP enabled her to earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, which helped to improve her family's standard of living.

This time, for her 3rd cycle loan, she is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP ($300), which she intends to use to buy an additional stock of dried fish. In turn, she hopes to continue to save up to expand her business. Zita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, NWTF is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 per day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, which is a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional fish

loans.name: Evelyn's Group

texts.en:
Evelyn Y. is from the village of Poblacion Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidntal. She is 43 years old and the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Pineapple 2.

Evelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn runs a store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife T. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 32 years old. Marife is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling cell phone electronic load time from different networks  in the local community. Marife has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cell phone electronic load time to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marife from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional cell phone electronic load time to sell

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos aún menores. Vive junto a su familia en el Caserío Jesús del Valle – Valle de los Incas, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande,  zona productora de frutas para exportación que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde que se casó a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría animales menores como aves de corral y ovinos en unos ambientes sutiados cerca a su vivienda. Una vez que han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre frecuentan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente se dedica también a la preparación y venta de chicha (bebida típica de la región hecha a base de harina de maíz) en su domicilio.

Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad se encarga de ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos familiares. Ella desea mejorar la alimentación de sus animales para así poder obtener mayores ingresos al momento de venderlos, para realizar su objetivo se ha propuesto adquirir alimento balanceado, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Julia es una mujer alegre y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su esposo a brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Julia is 45 years old. She is married and has five children who are still underage. She lives with her family in the settlement of Jesús del Valle – Valle de los Incas, a rural zone within the agricultural district of Tambogrande. The area produces fruits for export and lies in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name, situated more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Since she got married, Julia has worked raising and selling animals. She raises small animals such as poultry and sheep in enclosures located near her home. Once the animals have reached a good stage of development, she offers them for sale to traders who regularly frequent the area where she lives. In addition, she also makes and sells chicha (a typical beverage of the region, made from a base of corn flour) in her home. With the income she receives from this work, she helps her husband, who is a farmer, with the family's expenses. She would like to improve the nutrition of her animals so that she can obtain a higher income when she sells them. To achieve her objective, she plans to buy balanced animal feed, and for this reason she has requested a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 800 Peruvian new soles. Julia is a cheerful and responsible woman. Her greatest desire is to keep working to help her husband and provide her children with a better quality of life. In the area where she lives, her neighbors and others who know her consider her a steady and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying balanced feed to improve the nutrition of the small animals she raises for sale

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en: Maria Teresa is from the village of Locus, Sapang Dalaga. She is 40 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Teresa owns and operates a business in the construction sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling coconut lumber in the local community. Maria Teresa has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2004, Maria Teresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Teresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Maria Teresa is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Maria Teresa from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: To make a living, Nelia I. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 36 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Salucong. Nelia has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Nelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Nelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her eighth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.pt:
Luciana T. nasceu na cidade de Tete, Província do mesmo nome, norte de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 6 filhos maiores de idade 2 dos quais ainda freqüentam escola. Fez ensino primário na Republica do Zimbabwe, não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa própria e sustenta sua irmã e 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

Saiu de Tete para Maputo com o seu esposo quando foi transferido pelos serviços. É pensionista do Ministério da Defesa e recebe 5.154.00 por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum com ajuda do marido que também é reformado do mesmo Ministério.

Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (pregos, ferro, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa.

No futuro quer solicitar mais um empréstimo para a conclusão da sua casa. Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema.
texts.en:
Luciana T. was born in the town of Tete, in the province of the same name, in Northern Mozambique. Married and the mother of six children (four of them fully grown and two still in school), Luciana attended elementary school in Zimbabwe but couldn't continue her schooling because of her family's financial constraints.

She lives with her children, sister and two nephews, whom she supports, in a house she owns. She left Tete for Maputo when her husband's work transferred him there. She receives a monthly pension of 5.154.00mt from the Ministry of Defense. The money allows her to take care of household expenses as well as, with the help of her husband's pension, put some money into a savings account. She has never had loans with other institutions and this is her first one with Hluvuku.

Luciana plans to use the 20.000.00mt to buy construction material (nails, iron, cement, sand, stones, etc) to continue the construction of her house. She is confident in her ability to pay back this loan and plans to apply for others  in the future, to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy construction material (nails, iron, cement, sand, stones, etc)

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
La Sra. Olivia L. P. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del peñón, actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el colegio José de la cruz mena Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene 22 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y zinc con el objetivo de mejora de su vivienda en repello de pared y piso. 
Esta señora tiene 2 hijos a su cargo.
Esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Olivia L. P. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and currently works as an elementary school teacher at the José de la Cruz Mena school in town.  She’s been working there for 22 years and is requesting her first loan through CEPRODEL, in order to make improvements to her house.  She will use the money to buy bricks, cement, sand, and zinc metal sheeting so that she can repair a wall and the floor of her home.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard J. is from the village of Bitibut Sapang Dalaga in Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old.  Eduard is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Eduard owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. 

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, coffee, sardines, toothpaste, and other items in the local community. Eduard has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eduard joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduard has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & increase working capital.  

Eduard is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Eduard from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie F. is from the village of Brgy. Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Rosie owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Rosie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Janet Ndinda

texts.en:
Janet Ndinda, aged 36 years, is a single mother of two children, Banice, aged 15 years in grade 4, and Njeri, aged 8 months. She has a boutique at Mlolongo market, which is a very busy market. She sells clothes to Mlolongo residents. She was introduced to KADET by her friends.

Janet has been running her boutique for a period of three years, and her monthly profit is Kshs 4,000. This loan of Kshs 40,000 is Janet's second loan with KADET. The first loan was paid well and in time. She plans to use Kshs 20,000 to increase her stocks of clothes for resale and Kshs 20,000 to open another boutique. If the loan boosts the business, Janet will buy food and clothing for her children, which has been a challenge in her life. She will also pay school fees for her daughter.

Janet describes herself as bright and enterprising. She dreams of building her own business premises and her own home.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothes and open another boutique.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, residen en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, han instalado una tienda que administra su esposa desde hace 10 años, es hasta el momento el negocio de la familia.
Este negocio tiene la dificultad de no poseer luz eléctrica propia sino que se la alquilan, y quieren instalarla en estos días a través de la solicitud de un préstamo que cubra con los gastos para llevar a cabo el proceso de instalación de energía eléctrica.
Con este préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de que su negocio posea luz propia y poder conservar mejor los productos que necesitan refrigeración además es un progreso como persona y comerciante. Tiene como objetivo el progresar cada día en el negocio aumentando la mercadería y brindando una mejor atención a los clientes.
texts.en:
39-year old Juan lives with his wife and two children in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután. He and his wife have been running their family business for ten years. The problem is that the business does not have its own electricity supply. Now they wish to use the loan to cover the expense of installing it.

With a permanent electricity supply, Juan will be able to better conserve those items that need refrigeration. In addition it shows that he is a forward-looking person and businessman. His goal is to improve his business each day by increasing his stock and providing his customers with even better service.

loans.use: to install electricity in his store

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles es una persona muy emprendedora y se siente muy feliz. Su actividad es la venta de leña y cerdos ella es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de realizar este tipo de actividad. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para mejorar su negocio la mayoría de sus clientes saben que ofrece muy buenos servicios, pues siempre esta preocupándose por satisfacer la demanda. El crédito es para la compra de materia prima como  leña y cerdo debido a las temporadas festivas tiene bastante demanda.
texts.en: Maria De Los Ángeles is a very enterprising person who feels very happy.  Her business is selling firewood and pigs.  She is a very enterprising person and she enjoys her work.  This is not the first time that she has taken a loan to improve her business.  Most of Maria's customers know that she offers very good services as she is always keen to satisfy her customers' demands.  She will use her loan to buy raw materials such as firewood and pigs as she will have a lot of demand during the festive season.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eusebio Alejandro

texts.es:
Eusebio Alejandro A. M. tiene 46 años. Vive en Unión Libre vive con la compañera y con los hijos, vive en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Campos Grandes perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Eusebio Alejandro  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Eusebio Alejandro A. M. is 46. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his partner and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has five children.

The members of the V.R.C. Esfuerzo y Trabajo ["Effort and Work"] are located in the Campos Grandes neighbourhood belonging to the Pueblo Viejo Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Eusebio Alejandro has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for three years. He buys his products in Agripac and sells them in the market in the same area.

He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to have his own house.

He enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Loem

texts.en:
Mrs. Loem T. is a villager in Thmei village, Takeo province, and she was born in 1966. She has three children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory, and the others are studying in the local public school. She is a pig breeder who is able to earn some money to support her family. 

Her husband, Mr. Tong Un, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell. Besides farming, he is also a basket maker.

Loem wants to buy a new motorbike for use by her family, yet her savings is not enough. So to achieve this purpose, Mrs. Loem T. is requesting a loan to buy a new motorbike. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Jessica Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Jessica Carolina V. tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de su madre y atiende sus dos hermanos que estan pequeños ya que su mama vive y trabaja en los estados unidos. Jessica tiene toda la responsabilidad de la casa y de sus hermanitos.
 
Jessica se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio ya que habia quedado descapitalizado por algunos gastos familiares que se le presentaron. 
 
Su deseo es que su mama regrese a vivir con ellos y pueda atenderlos y vivir en familia.
texts.en:
Jessica is 26 years old, single, and lives in her mother's house where she looks after her little brothers because her mother lives and works in the United States. Jessica has total responsibility for the house and her little brothers. 
Jessica sells basic groceries. She has a little grocery store in her home. She will use the loan to buy merchandise and supply her store. She has been left short of working capital by some family expenses that she had to cover.
Her greatest desire is that her mother will return to live with them, take care of them, and live together as a family.

loans.use: To buy sodas, bread, cookies, donuts, butter, rice, beans, four, sugar, coffee, soups, chicken, spaghettis, chili,  chile, candy, mosquito repellant, veneno para mosquitos, matches, and candles.

loans.name: Rufio

texts.en:
Rufio is a married man who lives in Bago, Negros Occidental. He earns his living by operating three business ventures: pig-fattening, meat-vending and farming. His wife Edna, who is 51 years old, works as a teacher to earn her living and helps in her husband's business activities. They have three children who are between 20 and  26 years old. Rufio joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because he aspired for something better for his family. With the help of his past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rufio has been incrementally lifting his family out of poverty by the sweat of his brow. His previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped him earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for his 11th loan, he is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase feed, hogs & fertilizers so that he can to save up for his children's education and family needs. Rufio is a Dungganon man who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of his dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase feed, hogs & fertilizer

loans.name: Islomidin

texts.ru: Рахматов Исломидин проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Сын, на заработках за границей. Сам Исломидин имеет средне - специальное образование, технолог. Он уже 28 лет преподает в средней школе. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для покупки бычков.
texts.en: Islomidin R. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 47 years old. He is married and has five children. His son is working abroad. Islomidin has specialized secondary education, he is a technician. He has been teaching in the secondary school for 28 years. He also does animal husbandry. He breeds large horned cattle for future resale and has been in this business for eight years. He is taking out the loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 44 years old and married with five children.

Bernardita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock.

Bernardita has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from being an MSE, AVON, JTY dealer.

Bernardita aspires to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar M. is 60 years old and lives with his wife in the village of Martkopi, Gardabani district. The family has four milk cows and sells milk locally. Along with agriculture, Nodar has a tanker (truck) and works as a contractor for a local private company – he performs transportation of gasoline with his tanker. 

With the requested credit, Nodar plans to renovate his tanker in such a way that he will be able to transport two types of fuel (gasoline and diesel) simultaneously, i.e., split the cistern into two parts. That will allow him to take more orders from other companies and individuals as well and will significantly increase his income. 

He plans to put aside some savings to use for further development of the family's dairy farm.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his tanker.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Teresa A. V. que tiene la edad de 43 años, estudio hasta el tercer gado de secundaria y estacasada con el señor ciriaco que trabaja en el campo, con el cual tiene dos hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela en su comunidad.

Doña teresa nos platica que ella tiene una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes la cual abrio con el apoyo de su esposo para ayudarse un poco con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus pequeños.

tambien nos comenta que asistio a un curso de reposteria en el cual aprendio a cosinar pasteles y postres y algunas veces en las señoras de la comunidad mandan le mandan ha hacer los pasteles de cumple años de sus hijos y gana un poco de dinero extra.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, jabon, pasta dental, refrescos, dulces, cafe, galletas, jugos, veladoras, crema, queso, tomates, chiles, cebolla, papel higienicas y chiles enlatados para surtir su negocio.

ella espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y en un futuro que estudien una carrera.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called "Arroyo de Pita", characterized for being the only community in the area that has a high-school, Teresa A. V. lives in this community, she is 43 years old, went to 9th grade and is married to Ciriaco, who works in the fields, they have to children that go to the community school.  

Teresa has a small grocery store that she opened with her husband's help to contribute with the home expenses and their children's studies.

She also tells us that she attended a pastries course in which she learned to make cakes and desserts and sometimes the ladies in the community make cake orders for their children's birthdays and this way she makes a bit of extra cash.  

She needs this loan to invest it in the purchase of rice, beans, oil, soup, toothpaste, soda, candy, coffee, cookies, juice, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, onions, toilet paper and canned peppers to stock her business.  

She hopes that this loan will help grow her business, she wishes to give her kids a better quality of life and the opportunity to have post-secondary studies in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona tiene 33 años, está acompañada con Alberto Martinez y tienen 3 hijos, todos ellos se encuentran en edad escolar.
Se dedica a la panaderia desde hace tres años aproximadamente, fabrica sus panificados y realiza sus ventas en un carro estirado por un caballo por las zonas conocidas como Cañadas e Itayvu (ciudad de Piribebuy y Caacupé respectivamente). 
Doña Ramona, como es conocida en la comunidad, cuenta con clientela formada a quienes en forma diaria los visita a entregarles su producto recien salido del horno.
Solicita el crédito especialmente para la compra de harina, levadura y los elementos necesarios para continuar con su negocio de panadería, mediante esto ella podrá ir aumentando sus ingresos y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, que cada vez van aumentando. Por ello agradece a Fundacion Paraguaya y Kiva por tan ponderado apoyo y confianza.
texts.en:
Ramona, 33, is in a relationship with Alberto Martínez; they have three school age children.

She’s been a Baker for the last three years approximately.  She manufactures her baked goods and sells them from a horse-drawn cart throughout the areas of Cañadas and Itayvu (cities of Piribebuy and Caacupé, respectively). Doña Ramona, as she’s known in the community, has a well established clientele that she visits daily to deliver products fresh out of the oven.

She is asking for this loan specifically to buy flour, yeast and other necessary elements to continue with her bakery.  Through it she will be able to increase her income and meet customer demand that increases each time.  Because of this she thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for such considerable support and trust.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past two years, she has operated a second- hand clothes selling business at the market and door-to-door. Susan faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation when selling door-to-door. She dreams of expanding and becoming a wholesale distributor in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 Susan wants to purchase bales of second-hand clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Leydis Maria

texts.es: Leydis Maria empezó a congeniarse con sus clientes potenciales, como clientes nuevos, con el propósito de que pueda ofrecer una buena variedad  ya que le resulta buenos ingresos económicos. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de la gran variedad de pedidos que tiene que comprar para complacer a sus clientes. El crédito, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus pagos, con el comprara ropa en general, toallas, sabanas, cosméticos y calzado.
texts.en:
Leydis Maria began talking to potential customers so that when they start to do business with her, she can offer them a wide variety of products and generate a good income.  She sells general merchandise.  Leydis is a very enterprising individual who enjoys getting different orders so that she can please her customers.

Upon receiving this loan, she promises to continue submitting her payments.  The money will be used to buy clothing, towels, bed sheets, cosmetics, and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, towels, bed sheets, cosmetics, and shoes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with ten children and only three of her children go to school. Rose also takes care of additional family members (a niece and nephew).  She own a mini bakery and makes chapattis, samosas, pancakes and donuts. 

Rose has requested a loan of 500,000 from Kiva partner MCDDT SACCO which she will use to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil, baking flour and cow peas. She has been in this business for sixteen years and she works six days week. Rose sells her produce door to door, by means of retail. Her business challenges include ever increasing prices of commodities and the rainy season. Rose decided to join MCDT SACCO to get additional capital for her business. Rose lives in a two room rented house.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil, baking flour and cow peas.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es: Enma tiene 28 años, es una mujer soltera y trabajadora, que junto a su mamá  luchan por salir adelante. Viven juntas en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Está hermosa y valiosa mujer, todos los días trabaja en la venta de papa al por mayor y menor, ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a ello, pues desde que era joven ayudaba a su mamá en la venta de papa por kilos. Pero con el tiempo su Mamá enfermó y por tanto Enma tuvo que dedicarse al negocio familia. Ahora en el mercado mayorista, donde ella vende, todos la admiran y respetan por su buen corazón y dedicación, ya que al mes genera una ganancia de 2 mil a 3 mil nuevos soles. La otra actividad que tiene es la agricultura, donde siembra papa, zanahoria y hortalizas en los terrenos agrícolas de sus padres, que según cuenta se ubican en el caserío de Huaricolca, donde todos los fines de semana los fertiliza, riega y cultiva. Para después cosechar y venderlo en el mercado de Tarma, donde ella trabaja, así obtiene mayores ganancias. Ahora ella está ahorrando para comprar su propia casa. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Integra” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todas ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Enma de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja y de papa de la variedad “yungay”, con ello comenzará su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Enma is 28, single and a hard worker, who works to better her life alongside her mother.  They live in their own house in the city of Tarma.  For the past 10 years, Enma has worked selling potatoes in both retail and wholesale markets.  She has been in the business since she was small, helping her mother sell potatoes by the kilo. After her mother took ill, Enma took over the family business.  She now has quite a following in the wholesale market, where she is widely admired for her good nature and dedication; each month she makes a profit of 2,000-3,000 soles.  Enma also grows crops such as potatoes and carrots on lands in the town of Huaricolca, which she visits every weekend to water, fertilize and tend her crops. After harvest, she sells her produce in the market inTarma, where they fetch good prices.  Enma is now saving to buy a house, and with this credit (her seventh with MFP) she hopes to move toward her goals.  Enma plans to buy sacks of seed to grow peas and potatoes of the “yungay” variety, to plant next season.  She is committed to prompt repayment.

loans.use: to buy sacks of seed to grow peas and potatoes

loans.name: 56 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Linh has a retail business, selling plastic goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase plastic goods for resaL..

Linh is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Linh is the group leader of the 56 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

This is Linh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Linh has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Linh faces in her business is not being abL. to meet the high demand for products.

With her business profit, Linh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy a motorbike, and to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic goods for resale.

loans.name: Tavhida

texts.en:
Tavhida is a hard-working woman. She is married and the loving mother of three children. She is engaged in processing dried fruits. Always she tries to make a good profit and provide her children's needs. 

Tavhida wants to expand her business and increase her working capital. She would like to get a loan of 1200 USD for purchasing dried fruits for sale in order to make a good profit. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy dried fruit for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a single man with no children yet. He runs a bread supply business at Migadini area in Mombasa. In this business, he says the major challenges he has are financial constraints. 

He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy more bread to supply and meet the demand of his customers and also buy other items to diversify his business to a general store. He describes himself as a determined man.

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Gena has a shop that sells school & office supplies. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of office & school supplies to sell.
Gena has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of office & school supplies to sell

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en: Ammar is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child who is attending school. He has 10 years of experience working as a farmer; and in 2006, he started running his own business. He grows a wide variety of vegetables using large plastic tents. These agricultural tents allow him to better monitor his product’s quality throughout the year. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to install new plastic tents on his farm. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to install new plastic tents on his farm

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mariam dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil to sell.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her child.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of license fees for the business. She dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the KES 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 57 years old and married with 7 children.

Pacita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general goods) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoos, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Pacita has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 7 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Pacita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (general goods) store

loans.name: Nuvia Aidee

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Al Poder.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Nuvia, tiene 40 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  4 hijos de 19, 14, 13 y 10 años, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del banco y le gusta por los beneficios que les da la institución.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto sacar a sus hijos adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos  días  en sus ventas y también da el servicio de pintado de uña a domicilio, cuando realizar sus trabajos de manicura también ofrece sus productos. Ella vende a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 8  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, Capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the “Damas al Poder” communal bank meet every two weeks.

We met Nuvia, 40, here.  She’s a single mother of four children who are 19, 14, 13 and 10 years old.  The three oldest go to secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school; all her children live with her still.  She’s been in the communal bank for 5 years; she’s the bank President and she likes it because of the benefits she gets from the institution.

She’s a housewife who in order to earn her own resources to support her children sells clothes via catalogue and Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories).  She works every day at her sales and she also provides in-home manicure services and when she goes out to provide manicures she offers her products for sale.  She sells on credit and collects payment weekly.  She’s been in this line of work for over 8 years and does very well.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es: José Gilberto desde hace 7 años tiene esta actividad que es la venta de granos básicos. Inicio su negocio porque trabajaba en una empresa y no pudo seguir laborando por motivos de salud y con el dinero que obtuvo logro establecer su propio negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, maíz, trigo entre otros. Con esto el podrá tener variedad de productos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, que es mucha y no da abasto.  El desea que sus hijos sean profesionales, y tener una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
José Gilberto has had a business selling staple grains for 7 years.  He started this business because he used to work in a company, but was not able to continue working for health reasons.  With the money he obtained, he managed to start up his own business.  He is taking this loan to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, corn, wheat, and other products.  With the loan, he will be able to have a variety of products and satisfy the demands of his customers, which are very great, and which he has not been able to meet.  

He wants his children to become professionals, and to have a decent home for his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, corn, wheat, and other items

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with four children who are all adults. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Chizi has operated a clothes selling business for the past 10 years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase more stock of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access fund to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy (pictured here), age 25, is single, and lives with his mother in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophy is a rice farmer. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $700 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 53-year-old widow; her husband passed away 12 years ago. In order to cover her living expenses, Gina sells various household appliances (stoves, shoes, rice cookers, pillows etc). She has been involved in the business for five years. 

Since Christmas Day is coming, Gina plans to sell women's shoes in large quantity, ovens, bed springs and bracelets. Unfortunately she does not have enough capital to do so. She would like to request a loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She is really hoping that TLM is willing to assist her with the loan for her business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase women's shoes in large quantity, stoves, bed springs and bracelets to resell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been in active farming for four years in his home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married and has five children aged between 1 and 15 years. He has been producing milk and maize for the local market.

Peter has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He adds he will use the income to improve his farming. He will use the income to improve the living standards of his children.

He is, however, worried about the high costs for running the business, especially with the management of diseases.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Dilbaroi

texts.ru:
Дилбарой- труженица,ей 41 лет,имеет одного сына и дочь подросткового возраста.Муж Азим- разнорабочий и имеет работу сезонного характера.Сама занимается бизнесом более 6ти лет, продает продукты питания на центральном продуктовом рынке.В её ассортименте есть необходимые продукты повседневного спроса, такие как яйцо, слив. масло,напитки,сахар и т.д.Исходя из сказанного,её реализация стоит на стабильном уровне.Работает повседневно без перерыва и по необходимости отдыхает.По совету соседей по бизнесу с 2007 года получила первый кредит. Тогда 
 у неё был маленький товарооборот и после кредита постепенно расширила свои активы,улучшила  свою обстановку дома,здоровье...  На предыдущий кредит купила холодильник,который использует на свой бизнес, а на очередной кредит хочет закупить большую партию продуктов,так как  перед Новым годом  она может хорошо реализовать свои продукты.
texts.en:
Dilbaroi is a hard worker. She is 41 years old and has a son and a teenage daughter. Her husband Azim is a handyman and he has a seasonal job. Dilbaroi has been in business for more than six years, selling food at the central food market. In her product range, she has products that are needed daily, like eggs, butter, beverages, sugar and so on. She has a stable income from this business. Dilbaroi works daily without a break, and rests only when needed. 

At the advice of her neighbors, she took her first loan in 2007. Back then she had a small turnover and after the loan she gradually expanded her activities, and improved their situation at home, their health,... For the previous loan she bought a refrigerator, which she uses in her business, and for the next loan she wants to buy a large quantity of products, so that before New Year's she can sell a lot of her products.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of eggs and butter at wholesale price

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Nao is a 56-year-old woman. She is the mother of four children. She lives with her children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a bricklayer. She earns an income by cooking and selling steamed glutinous rice to her customers. She has done this since 2006. 

Nao would like to take out a loan to buy good quality ingredients to cook a better food for selling. This will increase her production capacity and allow her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her family.

loans.use: To buy good quality ingredients to cook better food to sell

loans.name: Tailoring Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Tailoring” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their individual businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Amara is the featured leader of this group. The 38-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have three children. Amara is a tailor and has been a professional tailor for 8 years now.  With his share of this loan, he is going to buy cloth, threads, needles, poplins and other materials in order to sew a large quantity of clothes that he will sell.

loans.use: to buy cloth, threads, needles, poplins, and other materials in order to sew a large quantity of clothes that he will sell

loans.name: Enagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jacqueline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jacqueline est âgée de 37 ans est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Jean-Marie. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Jacqueline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Jacqueline vend depuis huit ans du pain, des sucres et des condiments. Parallèlement a cette activité vend aussi des paniers et des balais. Jacqueline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Jacqueline ensemble avec les membres du groupe ENAGNON, sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du pain, des condiments, des paniers et des palais.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rhoda would like to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia has a beauty shop in her home. She started her business 12 years ago working out of her mother's home and visiting her clients' homes. Recently Sonia has taken the opportunity to sell cosmetics and perfumes to her beauty shop clients. This gives her a second source of income to support herself, since she is alone.

She would use the loan to make investments in the new products that she sells, such as perfumes, make-up and accessories, since these are her best-selling products. With these additional earnings she would like to make improvements to the shop in order to attract more clients.

Sonia is 41 years old and has 2 children. She is the only source of income in the household, since her husband abandoned her and left her with full responsibility for the family. Unfortunately one of her sons has a motor disability. She does not have sufficient resources to invest in a special school for him. She aspires to increase her earnings in order to support her children and give them an education.

Translated from the Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sonia tiene un gabinete de belleza en su domicilio. Ella empezó su negocio hace 12 años realizando su actividad desde el hogar de su madre y también haciendo visitas a clientes fijos. Recientemente Sonia también ha visto la oportunidad de vender cosméticos y perfumes a los clientes de su gabinete. Esto le da una segunda fuente de ingreso para poder ser sustente de su hogar ya que ella es sola.

Ella usara el préstamo para hacer inversiones en los productos nuevos que vende, como perfumes, maquillaje y bisutería, ya que estos son los productos que mas se vende. Con estos ingresos adicionales que genera quiere adecuar el local para atraer más clientes.

La señora tiene 41 años y tiene dos niños. Ella es la única fuente de ingreso en su hogar ya que su marido la abandono y la dejo a cargo de la familia. Desafortunadamente un hijo de Sonia tiene una discapacidad motriz, pero ella no tiene suficiente recursos para ingresarlo en una escuela especial. Aspira poder incrementar los ingresos para apoyar a sus hijos y darles educaciones.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell to her clients in her beauty shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ruth would like to buy dairy meal and maize gem

loans.name: Petrona Celestina

texts.en:
Petrona Celestina S. G. has a small store and a small garden. She lives high above the highway along a path in an agricultural area, so her store is not in a densely populated area, but it serves a neighborhood need, selling snack foods, drinks, eggs, juices, and the like. She just started the store about 6 months ago, and is gradually growing the inventory, bit by bit. Petrona has 10 children, of whom five are still in school, so it's a struggle to keep up with school expenses.

Petrona will use this credit for a bit of carrot and radish seed so she can sell some of the produce from her garden, and to increase the inventory in her little store.

Petrona and her neighbors in the area speak mostly the Quiché language among themselves. Spanish is a second language that some speak well and others just a little.

Written by Kiva Fellows: Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay

loans.use: Radish and carrot seed for the garden, purchase more inventory for the store

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Temurova Tursunoy is a dynamic businesswoman and owns her own wedding salon, renting out wedding dresses. She is married with three children and is a highly experienced designer. 
She buys her goods from Russia through an online catalogue. One batch of her dresses consists of 10-20 items, with all necessary accessories such as veil, gloves and so on. She wants to expand her business by including decorated wedding cars, wedding halls and clothes for the groom as well as the bride and is requesting a loan of $800, payable over 8 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Leaia

texts.en: Leaia is 59 years old, married, with 8 children and 15 grand-children. Having a large family has always been financially difficult, but, despite the hard times, Leaia has managed to find solutions. She is now running her beach fales business on the eastern side of the island of Upolu, and is asking for a loan of US$1,200. This is her 4th loan with SPBD, and she will use it to renovate the fales.

loans.use: Renovation of beach fales (Samoan lodging huts for tourists)

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: I am Farzana K.. I am 36, married, and a mother of one son. My husband is a rickshaw driver and I am a seamstress.  I sew very trendy clothes in the latest fashion.  My clients like the clothes very much. I would like to borrow $350 to buy a more modern sewing machine for my business in order to respond promptly to my clients.  The wedding season has just started and I have a great number of orders to fulfill. Thank you.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and few other necessary materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new goods for inventory

loans.name: Donald Rogelio

texts.es:
Donald is a welder and electrician, with more than 20 years experience. He works from home, making metal railings, steel-framed windows and supports for porches and houses, among other things. He works every day from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening.

He has a broad customer base that includes single orders from individuals along with private companies that hire him for temporary jobs. He is the sole provider for his family. His wife cares for their 2 young children. His work has allowed him to provide a humble living for all of them. His priority now is to lay new floors in the living room and the children's room, both of which have been damaged by time and use.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Donald es de profesión soldador y electricista industrial, posee 20 años de experiencia en esta rama, trabaja a domicilio, se dedica a elaborar verjas, ventanas de hierro, remodelar habitaciones y soldar perlines para porches y viviendas. Se encuentra disponible todos los días de 7:00 a.m. a 6:00p.m.

Posee un buen número de clientes tanto personas particulares como empresas privadas que lo contratan de manera temporal. El es el único proveedor de su familia, la esposa cuida de sus 2 hijos menores de edad. Su trabajo le ha permitido mantener a su familia humildemente, la prioridad en estos momentos es la de cambiar el piso del cuarto de los hijos y la sala de su vivienda, ya que se encuentran dañados de tanto tiempo y uso.

loans.use: Buy materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Ashmatallah

texts.en: Ashmatallah lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is the father of two children. He has a retail shop. He started this business one year ago. During this time, his business has been normal. Now he wants to expand his business, so he requested an individual loan to complete his stock. He wants to make a good income to help his family. He is happy with this loan process that helps poor people around Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Tres Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Twelve women form the Tres Estrellas Association and have worked with Pro-Mujer for approximately 4 years. They are a very joyful group, and they are happy with the benefits that this center offers them. Eight of them are married and on average have about 4 children each, with the majority being less than 10 years of age. They each perform different activities such as selling prepared meals, running a café and making products woven with alpaca and offer them in the different markets of the city of La Paz. They would like to request bigger loans to inject capital into their businesses to obtain greater earnings for the well-being of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

12 mujeres conforman la asociación “Tres Estrellas” que trabajan con Pro-Mujer hace 4 años aproximadamente, un grupo muy alegre y contento con los beneficios que el centro les brinda. 8 de ellas son casadas y tienen un promedio de cuatro hijos, en su mayoría menores a 10 años. Se dedican a diferentes actividades, como ser la venta de comida, cafetería, tejidos en alpaca productos que los ofrecen en los distintos mercado de la ciudad de La Paz. Ellas quieren tener mayores créditos para inyectar de capital a sus negocios de esta forma obtener mayores ganancias para el bien de sus niños

loans.use: Purchase capital to inject into their businesses.

loans.name: Busairi

texts.id:
Busairi lives in Tuban, renting a simple but hygienic room for $15 per month. He has been a junk collector for the past 5 years. He has no other skills nor the funding to start other business. Everyday, Busairi roams around Tuban area from dawn to dusk to seek and purchase unused junk. He only takes rest to eat lunch. After full day of work, he brings his collected junks to a junkyard that repurchase his goods to be recycled and resold. Busairi hopes that with loan from DINARI he can purchase more trash instead of seeking around.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Saat ini, Busairi tinggal di Tuban dengan menyewa sebuah kamar seharga Rp.150.000 per bulan. Keadaan kamarnya sangat sederhana, tetapi lingkungannya cukup sehat. Sudah sekitar 5 tahun yang lalu klien memulai usaha ini, dan sampai sekarang masih bertahan. Selain karena tidak memiliki usaha yang lain, juga karena tidak memiliki modal untuk memulai usaha yang lain. Setiap harinya, mulai dari pagi sampai sore hari, Busairi harus berkeliling di sekitar wilayah Tuban untuk mencari dan membeli rongsongan. Dia hanya beristirahat pada saat makan siang. Setelah seharian bekerja, hasil yang didapatnya dibawa ke tempat pengumpulan barang rongsokan untuk kemudian ditimbang dan dijual. Busairi berharap, dengan modal pinjaman dari DINARI, dia tidak perlu lagi mencari tetapi cukup membeli lalu kemudian dijual lagi.

loans.use: Increase Working Capital

loans.name: Melikhanum

texts.en:
Melikhanum T., 25, is married and has two sons. For the past nine years, she has been selling milk and yogurt to the local factory.

She has applied for a loan to purchase one additional dairy cow and fodder. This will increase her output and generate more sales to the factory.

loans.use: To purchase an additional dairy cow and fodder

loans.name: Salote

texts.en: Salote S., 28, is married with three children. She has three years of experience in the taxi business. She works in the village community one day each week; she expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). She has had six previous loans through SPBD. SPBD loans are Salote’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan through the traditional banks. She will use part of her loan to support her kids at school and improve their home; her husband is the general manager for their buisness and has the additional qualification of performing air conditioner repair.

loans.use: To purchase replacement equipment for her taxi business, mostly labor.

loans.name: Fatima's Wanafaraja Group

texts.en:
Fatima is 30 years old. She is married and she has one 7-year-old child. She became a clothes seller in 2000. Every day, she works from 7 AM to 12.30 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Fatima now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sophia, who has business dealing with food sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Ruqaiya

texts.en:
Ruqaiya baji is the wife of B. M. and lives in an area of city Lahore named Ismail Nagar, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 12 years. She is the mother of four children: three daughters and one son. Her two daughters are married. Her younger daughter is in 8th standard. Her son is in the 7th standard (grade).

Her husband is a carpenter by profession. He makes wooden material (kitchen cabinets and doors) on order. Ruqaiya baji has a business of making coverlets. She makes coverlets and sells them in the market and earns a profit. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy wood for her husband so that he is able to complete the orders of his customers.

loans.use: To buy woods to make kitchen cabinets and doors

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun N. is 44 years old mother of three in Trapaing Chum Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory, while the other is attending the local school. Mrs. Bun N. works as a farmer, but she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile, thus badly affecting her crop growth. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Bun N. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to improve her field conditions to produce a better crop. Her husband, Mr. Mean Lorn, is a firewood seller who earns a small income to support his family. Her husband is located on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to improve field conditions

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio S. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en pareja con Severiana de 41 años. Antonio, por cosas de la vida no pudo tener hijos, fue por eso que decidieron junto con su compañera, adoptar una niña que hoy ya tiene 6 años de edad.

Comenta que provenía de una familia muy humilde y por tal motivo no pudo terminar sus estudios en la primaria.

Antonio desde muy pequeño se dedicó a trabajar en la olería de su padre, tal es así que continua hasta hoy día con dicha actividad, la cual es la elaboración y venta de ladrillos.

Actualmente es él quien maneja todo el negocio y ya cuenta con una clientela muy bien formada, principalmente los propietarios de depósitos de ventas de materiales de construcción.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante y consiguió progreso tanto para él como para toda su familia.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para la compra de una buena cantidad de leña para almacenar, ya que utiliza la misma para la cocción de sus productos.
texts.en:
Antonio S. , 46, lives with Severiana, 41. Antonio, who because of life circumstances was unable to have children, decided with his companion to adopt a daughter who is now 6 years old. He comments that he came from a very humble family and therefore was not able to complete his primary education. Antonio recently began to work in his father's brick works, continuing up to the present in the activity of preparing and selling bricks. It is he who actually manages the whole business, and he already has a loyal clientele, mainly proprietors of construction supplies warehouses. Thanks to his effort and dedication, he has succeeded in getting ahead and making progress as much for himself as for his whole family. At this time he needs a loan to purchase a good quantity of firewood to store up, which he uses to fire his products.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Файзуллаева Махбуба живет в районе Гиссар. Змужем и имеет двоих детей.Имеет средне -техническое образование.По специальности техник-гидролог.  Живут отдельно от родителей . Муж в России на заработках. Сама работает в диллерском центре. Предоставляет услуги перевода денег,продает сим-карты и запчасти для мобильных телефонов.Решила получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и сделать небольшой ремонт в помещение. Это поможет привлечь новых клиентов и увеличить доход. Кроме того она одна во всем кишлаке , которая предоставляет данные услуги. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahbuba F. lives in the Gissar region. She is married and has two children. She has secondary technical education and is a technical hydrologist by profession. She lives separately from her parents. Her husband is working in Russia and she works in the dealing center. Her job is to provide money transfer services, sell SIM cards and mobile phone parts. Mahbuba decided to apply for a loan to increase commodity circulation and to do some repairs in the building. This will help her attract new clients and increase her income. Besides, Mahbuba is the only one in her village who provides these services. She will be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: La Purisima Group

texts.es:
Los miembros del g/s LA PURISIMA viven en el reparto camilo ortega de la ciudad de Nindiri a unas 5 cuadras de la sucursal de adim.  Son personas  bien expresivas y de trato muy amable.
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado mantener su negocio, manifiestan que con la ayuda de adim han mejorado las condiciones de su vivienda, negocio y de su familia, en la actualidad están en su octavo ciclo.
