 Doña Mariza es la coordinadora del g/s,  comenzó su negocio con venta de golosinas y helados, en la actualidad tiene una mini pulpería que con ayuda de su esposo ha sacado adelante  compro una mantenedora para la ofertar gaseosa, hielo y helados  Este g/s ha participado en los talleres que desarrollo empresarial ha impartido,  el éxito de este g/s es la comunicación y solidaridad que ellas mantienen.
Dicen estar agradecida por que adim además de crédito las ha capacitado, lo que han aprovechado para el manejo exitoso de sus negocios
texts.en:
The members of g/s La Purisima association live in the Camilo Ortega village in the city of Nindiri, about five blocks from the Adim office. They are very expressive and very friendly people. With a lot of effort and dedication, they have managed to maintain their businesses and with the help of Adim they have improved their housing, businesses, and their families. Currently, they are on their eighth cycle.

Doña Mariza, the coordinator of the g/s, started her business by selling sweets and ice cream. Now, she has a small store. With the help of her husband, she has bought a cooler for sodas, ice, and ice cream.

This g/s has participated in business development workshops and its success is due to the communication and solidarity that they maintain. They are grateful because, in addition to a loan, Adim has given them skills, which they have used to successfully manage their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To provide a wider variety of products.

loans.name: Nau

texts.en:
Mrs. Nau C. is a farmer in Boeng Vaeng village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a 3-hectare field where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on the crop. Additionally, her field has a lot of insects to damage her crop and her field is also far from the irrigation system.

In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Nau C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and fuel for a pump for her field. Her husband, Mr. Chhuok Chhin, is a driver who can make very little income to support the family. Mrs. Nau C. is 35 years old and the mother of a child who is just three months old. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and fuel for a pump

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam, 45, lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Bassam has been a blacksmith for three years. He is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools for his work. This is the first time that Bassam has requested a loan. His clients can be anybody. Bassam decided on this business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his work

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon P., 51, and her husband, Mr. Mot Ma, 53, live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.  They were married in 1978 and have seven children: one son and six daughters. Two of their daughters are married and live outside the family home, one son is a construction worker and two daughters are garment factory workers.

Mon has been selling vegetables for almost one year.  Before she used to sell boiled corn. She buys vegetables from Koki market for resale at Chbar Ampov market, located in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises cows for resale. The couples hopes to that their business will be able support their children’s education. Mon is applying for a loan of $500 to purchase cows to raise.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise.

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.ru: Боймуродов Файзулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 26 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Уже 10 лет занимается производством национальных сундуков. Бизнес приносит доход. В данный момент наступил сезон по реализации данного вида продукции , поэтому Файзулло решил получить кредит и использовать его для покупки материала. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Faizullo B. lives in Gissar. He is 26 years old, married, and has two children. For ten years he has been working making traditional chests. This business provides his income. This is the season for this kind of production; therefore, Faizullo has decided to take out a loan and use it to buy materials. He can pay off the loan in six months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials

loans.name: Abror

texts.ru: Аброр не имеет постоянной работы. Свой доход он имеет от выполнения разных работ и еще он занимается куплей продажей мелкого рогатого скота на местных рынках. Доход небольшой, но так как Аброр хорошо разбирается в этом, торговля скотом приносит стабильный доход. Аброру 32 года, женат и имеет 2 детей. Аброр собирается получить займ и пустить его в свой маленький бизнес.
texts.en:
Abror does not have regular employment. The income he has comes from completing a variety of odd jobs and, in addition, he buys and sells small-horned cattle at local markets. It is not a lot of money, but since Abror is well versed in it, the cattle trade brings in a stable income. Abror is 32 years old, married and has two children. He is planning to take out a loan and invest it in a small business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. is married with 2 children and has received an education through Junior High School. Since 2006, Doris has worked as a seamstress in the Elmina area making clothes and also selling materials. While Doris works as a seamstress, her husband is employed as a salt producer.

Doris’ husband pays their family’s financial expenses, and because of this, she is able to focus her attention and monies on her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional sewing materials for the sewing of her customers' clothing and with the new profits from her expanded business, Doris plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: purchase additional sewing materials for sewing

loans.name: Dalis

texts.es: Dalis tiene 20 años, es soltera, vive con su padre y sus abuelitos en la casa de ellos. Desde hace un año cuenta con una tienda de repuestos para motos y motocarros en un espacio de su casa, inició este negocio a raíz de que padre es mecánico y cuenta con gran cantidad de  clientes, y Dalis aprovecha esto para ofrecerles los repuestos para sus vehículos. Esta labor le gusta mucho porque está aprendiendo mucho sobre el comercio, además que con todas las personas a las que atiende, ha hecho buenas amistades. El deseo de Dalis, es que su negocio siga creciendo hasta llegar a tener una industria especializada en metales. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita comprará más repuestos para implementar su tienda adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Dalis is 20 years old, single, and lives with her father and grandparents in their house. For one year she has run a spare parts store in a part of her home for motorcycles and motorcycle buggies. She started this business from the ground up as her father is a mechanic and has a lot of customers, and Dalis took advantage of this to offer them spare parts for their vehicles. She enjoys this work a lot because she is learning a lot about business, and furthermore, with all of the people that she assists, she has made good friendships. Dalis’ desire is that her business continues to grow until she is able to have a business specializing in metals. This is her first loan with MFP, and with the money that she is asking for she will buy more spare parts in order to adequately set up her store.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Don Gustavo V. M. es un señor de 45 años de edad que vive con su madre , en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.
Debido a las pocas fuentes de empleo que ofrece la  comunidad, don Gustavo quiere  incursionar como microempresario en el área de la agricultura especializándose en la siembra de arroz para vender  tanto en su comunidad como en lugares vecinos, que según su criterio, hay un excelente mercado ya sea por medio de venta a intermediarios o al público directamente. 

Desde muy joven don Gustavo se ha dedicado a la siembra de arroz, por lo tanto, dice que tiene bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo tiene un terreno en el cual ha sembrado arroz anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente
Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Gustavo es un micro crédito de ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del terreno, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del arroz y lograr una buena cosecha.

Don Gustavo es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera crecer a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Mr. Gustavo V. M. is 45 years old and lives with his mother in a small rural community of Costa Rica called Las Delicias de Upala, located in the Alajuela Province. Businesses here include double-branched produce (meat and milk) and growing various basic grains such as rice, beans, and corn among others. As there is high unemployment, Gustavo wishes to begin a small agricultural business specializing in growing rice to sell in the community. According to Gustavo, there is an excellent market to sell to middlemen or directly to the public. Gustavo has worked growing rice since he was very young so he has experience caring and maintaining this type of harvest. He has land in which he as grown rice before with good results, which is why he wants to grow more. Thanks to this type of business he has considerably improved his family's quality of life. Gustavo is now requesting a micro loan of 300,000 colones to prepare the land, and buy seed, fertilizer and other supplies necessary to guarantee an optimal rice harvest. Gustavo is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban (The Datraban Business Credit Collective), one of 100 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and with it he hopes to grow personally and economically. He notes that thanks to this type of organization and other loan facilitating means he has been able to spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for rice production

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: khady D. est parent beneficiaire a camberene specialisee dans la vente de tissus en provenance du mali.elle capitalise deux ans d'experience dans cette activite qui commence a se developper.elle emprunte cinquante mille frs pour l'ajouter a son fond personnel en vue de pouvoir accroitre ses benefices.
texts.en:
Khady D. is a client parent in Camberene specialized in selling cloth from Mali. She capitalizes on two years of experience in this business, which is starting to develop. She is borrowing 50,000 francs to add to her own capital with the aim of growing her profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira J., from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, is 38 years old, married, and the mother of two school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a clothing business whose main source of income comes from selling clothes to local community members. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over two years, earning approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elvira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase more products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Manolo

texts.en:
Manolo G. is from the village of Zone 1B in Del Carmen, Iligan City. He is 37 years old and single. To make a living, Manolo owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where he sells a variety of different products in the local community. Manolo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In July 2009, Manolo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manolo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Manolo's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: 20 De Enero San Fabian Group

texts.es:
El banco 20 D. Enero San Fabian, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Huancavelica, Departamento D. Huancavelica. Es una comunidad muy organizada que en forma conjunta tratan D. salir adelante. La actividad principal D. la población es el Comercio.

Gladys es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Gladys se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. manzanas acarameladas y otros dulces, los cuales ella distribuye en los colegios D. su comunidad. Ella esta solicitando un préstamo D. S/. 500, con los cuales comprara manzanas y azúcar, insumos necesarios para elaborar sus productos.

Roxana es casada y tiene un hijo. Roxana, venD. productos D. belleza por catalogo, negocio que gracias a los prestamos que recibe, va creciendo cada día mas. Rozana solicita un préstamo D. S/400, con los cuales va implementar un puesto para la venta D. sus productos.

Yesenia tiene  una niña D. 03 años y es madre soltera. Yenesia, al quedarse sola se dedico a la venta D. prendas D. vestir y comidas en las ferias, lo cual le genero ingresos para poder  sostener a su pequeña hija. Yesenia esta solicitando un préstamo D. S/500 para comprar D. prendas D. vestir, para surtir su stock.
texts.en:
The January 20th San Fabian Bank is located in the community of Huancavelica in the department of Huancavelica. It is a very organized community in which together they try to move forward. The principal activity of the population is commerce. Gladys is married and has 3 children. Gladys makes and sells caramelized apples and other sweets, which she distributes to the high schools of her community. She is asking for a loan of 500 soles with which she will buy apples, sugar, and consumables necessary to make her products. Roxana is married and has one child. Roxana sells beauty products by catalog. This business, thanks to the loans she receives, is increasing day after day. Roxana is asking for a loan of 400 soles with which she will start a stand where she can sell her products. Yesenia has a three-year-old daughter and is a single mother. Yesenia, as a single woman, sells clothing and food in the markets. From these sales she generates income to be able to support her little daughter. Yesenia is asking for a loan of 500 soles to buy more clothing to supply her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The 16 members of the community bank ask for a loan of 6,500 soles to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Miriam Liliana

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive junto a su abuelita y a su hija de 11 años de edad en la ciudad de Reque, ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta directa de productos de belleza; todas las tardes visita a sus clientes, tanto de Reque como de Chiclayo, les ofrece sus productos y los asesora en la elección de los mismos, durante todo este tiempo su negocio ha ido creciendo y ahora le dedica todo el tiempo que tiene disponible.

Su actividad es la única que sostiene a su familia por lo que día a día trata de dar todo de sí para conseguir clientes nuevos, ella desea comprar más productos para así captar más clientes por lo que se encuentra solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 500 nuevos soles, los que le ayudarán a lograr sus objetivos.

Su mas grande anhelo es poder brindarle a su hija una educación de calidad y también darle a su abuelita una mejor calidad de vida.

Miriam es muy conocida entre sus vecinos los que la quieren y estiman mucho debido a su buen carácter y disponibilidad en los momentos en que la necesitan.
texts.en:
Miriam, 34, is a single mother. She lives with her grandmother and her 11 year old daughter. They live in the city of Reque, which is located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling beauty products for two years. Every afternoon she visits her customers in the city of Reque as well as the city of Chiclayo. She offers her products and advises on their selections. During all of this time, her business has been growing. Now, she spends all of her available time on the business. Her activity is the only one that supports her family. Therefore, day to day, she tries to give all of herself to attaining new customers. She wishes to buy more products in order to gain more customers. That is why she is asking the Institution for a loan for 500 PEN. That will help he achieve her objectives. Her greatest wish is to be able to provide her daughter with a quality education and to give her grandmother a better quality of life. Miriam is very well known among her neighbors. They care about her and hold her in high esteem because of her good character and her availability in the times they need her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Kèmi

texts.fr: K. Kèmi est née vers 1955 à Adjarra. Kèmi est mariée à GBEMENOU Houdji. Le couple a quatre enfants dont trois sont encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Adjarra. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Kèmi vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. C’est des divers (chaussures, bols, bassines, vêtements…) que Kèmi vend de façon ambulante. Kèmi est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Kèmi demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
K. Kèmi was born around 1955 in Adjarra. She is married to GBEMENOU Houdji. The couple have four children of whom three are still in their care. The family lives in Adjarra. Thanks to the revenues from her business, Kèmi comes to the aid of her husband in regards to family expenses. What Kèmi sells is a variety of goods (shoes, bowls, tubs, clothing...) as she goes from door-to-door. She is an ALIDé client who repays her loans. To satisfy her customers further, she's asking for a loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and bags

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap S. is a villager in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Arn Samruol, is a construction worker.  He needs some construction supplies to support his work. Thus, Mrs. Sopheap S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She will use the rest of money to buy eight piglets and pig food. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 49 year old married man and the father of 4 children. He works in the house construction business and is the sole support for his family. He has been involved in this industry for more than 25 years. Today, Mahmoud is requesting a loan of $1,200 US to purchase wood in order to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: purchase wood

loans.name: Yamina

texts.es:
Yamina tiene un pequeño negocio donde recibe contratos para eventos por servicios de comida, te, y otros 
Vive en la zona de villa tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres
El crédito será destinado para compra de vajillas y equipos para cocina  y así con este crédito mejorara sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
Es primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Yamina has a small business where she receives contracts to provide food, tea, and other things for events. She lives in her parents’ house in the Villa Tembladerani region of the city of La Paz. The loan is to buy dishes and kitchen equipment to improve her income and quality of life. This is the first time that she has asked Impro for a loan. Her desire to succeed has given her the opportunity to get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dishes, pots, and other utensils to improve the service in her catering business

loans.name: Belen Group

texts.es: Es un banco comunal “Belen” esta representado por la señora Jenny y conformado por 15 socios (as) que pertenecen al mismo barrio y de la misma zona todos con actividades comerciales diferentes como la venta de pan al por mayor, comida, cosméticos, ropa, joyas y a la costura de prendas de vestir. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia pero no es motivo de problema para las socias del grupo ya que ellas cuentan con clientela fiel y con su experiencia saben como salir adelante sin problemas. El crédito será destinado para aumentar o mejorar sus negocios con mas mercadería, insumos y materiales que ayudaran a mejorar sus ingresos y por consiguiente a brindar a sus familia una mejor calidad de vida La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Belen" is represented by Jenny and consists of 15 members that live in the same neighborhood. They all carry out different commercial activities, such as selling bread wholesale, selling food, cosmetics, clothing, and jewelry, and also sewing articles of clothing. Just like any commercial area, competition always exists, but it is not a problem for the partners of this group, since they can count on a faithful clientele. Also, with their experience they know how to get ahead with no trouble. This loan will be used to improve their businesses with more merchandise and materials which will help improve their incomes, and consequently provide their families with a better quality of life. Our partners are in their first loan cycle, but they already have experience in solidarity groups, for which they are committed to give everything of themselves in order to get ahead, with responsibility and unity.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital/merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Kawama Kakaire Jamilah Group

texts.en: K. Jamilah is the president of her group.  She is married with six children, four of whom are going to school.  She also takes care of an orphan who is in sixth grade.  K. Jamilah sells new clothes and has been in business for one year. She is seeking a loan to add capital to her business by purchasing inventory. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to raise and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is a 19-year-old single man living in Ain Knayya, Southern Lebanon. He has been an auto-electrician since 2008 and has requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy necessary equipment and car batteries. This is Maher’s second year of experience with microcredit, which he believes is the primary supporter of his work. Tourists, friends, neighbors and relatives are his clients. He hopes to expand his work and to start a small family soon.

loans.use: To buy equipment and car batteries.

loans.name: Roberto Isaias

texts.es: El señor Roberto Isaias M. tiene 49 años de edad vive en el Barrio la Borgoña, es casado y su esposa se dedica  a la venta de frutas, aportando a  los gsatos del hogar, ellos son una familia muy humilde pero trabajadora tienen tres hijos los cuales son independientes, se han dedicado desde hace 22 años al cultivo de la piña, los cuales se han presentado con escazes por los problemas de sequia, ellos han solicitado este prestamo con el objetivo de comprar materiales agricolas que cuiden sus cosechas tales como los fertilizanet y pestizidas, esto les beneficiaria a gran medida por que podrian producir una cosecha de primera, que la lograrian vender a un buen precio, esto a futuro les daria la oportunidad de diversificar sus siembras y proveerles mejores condiciones economicas para la familia.
texts.en:
Roberto Isaias M., 49, lives in the la Borgoña neighborhood, is married and sells fruit to support his household. They are a very humble but hard-working family. They have three independent children. For the past 22 years he has farmed pineapple. However, due to the prevailing draught conditions, crop yields have been poor. They are requesting funding to buy agricultural supplies, like fertilizers and pesticides, that will help them produce better crops. This will be of great help in that they will be able to produce a top quality crop to sell at a good price. This will mean, in the future, an opportunity to diversify their crops and provide better living conditions for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Storing and selling charcoal

loans.name: Francisco's Group

texts.en:
Francisco R. is from the village of Villa Cayaban. He is 41 years old. Francisco is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Francisco is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $155 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Francisco joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es: José Miguel A. R. de 28 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel, lugar en el cual vive junto a su madre y su hermana. José es un hombre muy soñador y visionario quien estudió odontología en la universidad, esto con el deseo de poder ayudar a otras personas que lo necesitaran. Es por esto que hace 2 años que el inició su propio consultorio, el cual esta ubicado en su propia casa de habitación. José solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su consultorio, adquiriendo todos los elementos necesarios para elaborar su trabajo, así mismo a través del préstamo solicitado a Integral, el espera comprar maquinaria mucho más moderna con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. José posee el deseo de poder poner en práctica todo lo aprendido durante muchos años, lo cual lo ha ido logrando poco a poco, pero que ha pesar de todos sus esfuerzos aún no lograba obtener muchas de las herramientas que el deseaba para su consultorio, ahora el ve una esperanza, ya que con el dinero obtenido se le facilitará en gran manera equipar su negocio.
texts.en:
José Miguel A. R., 28 years of age, resides in the department of San Miguel, El Salvador He lives together with his mother and sister. José is a dreamer and a visionary, having studied dentistry at university with the hope of being able to offer help to others who may need it. This wish of his led José to open his own dental practice 2 years ago, setting up an office within his own house. Jose requests a loan through which he would be able to have sufficient money to invest in his dental office, acquiring all the necessary elements to properly carry out his work. He also hopes to use the loan he requests from Integral to purchase much more modern machinery, for the purpose of offering better services to his patients. José hopes very much to put into practice all of the skills he learned during his many years of school. Bit by bit, he has been able to expand his office's capacity for dental service, but in spite of all his efforts,he still has not been able to obtain many of the tools that he needs to offer a full range of high quality dental services. Today, he sees cause for hope in the loan he requests, since the money he obtains would finally enable him to fully equip his dental practice.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de equipo para clinica dental.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Restaurant furniture

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
Magnolia is part of the Los Diamantes communal bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members all hailing from the Cuzco area. Magnolia is 36 years old and lives with her spouse and their two children, aged four and two months. 

Magnolia runs a restaurant business out of her house. When she first opened the restaurant, she only sold soups in the morning. She has recently expanded and is now open for lunch as well. During lunchtime she sells “menus del día”, a set-priced lunch that typically includes a soup, drink, and main dish. Magnolia also holds a job working in a clinical laboratory. 

Magnolia will use her Kiva loan to further improve her restaurant business. Magnolia is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Restaurant Supplies

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
If you subsist on agriculture like N. Annet has found out, you need enormous reserves of patience to succeed. That particular attribute has manifestly worked in N.’s favor. She is a living testament to this. She speaks with pride of how her seven children are now all attaining an education in high institutions of learning.

N.’s proficiency in attending to her banana gardens for the last thirty years in Kakungu, Ntungamo, has borne her fruits. In a month, she makes profits to the tune of 300,000 UGX. The only major drawn out problem that has plagued her business has been the persistent low banana market prices.

It’s N.’s reckoning that this loan will come in handy in helping her enhance her banana plantations through mulching and the buying of fertilizer.

loans.use: To enhance her banana plantations through mulching and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Tito  Doroteo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestro socio es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr. TITO,  Nuestro socio tiene 48 años  es separado y tiene 3 hijos, de 18, 16, 8 años de edad, nuestro socio se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz, papa, habas, entro otros productos, el socio también cría ganados vacunos para la venta, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un pequeño toro, para criarlo y hacerlo reproducir en su debido tiempo.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Tito is a member of the “Sacro” (Sacred) Communal Bank. He is originally from the community of Cruz Pata in the town of Chinchero, which is part of Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

Sr. Tito is 48 years old, separated from his spouse, and has three children (ages 18, 16, and 8). He is a farmer who has land on which he grows corn, potatoes, beans, and other products. Tito also raises cattle to sell. He is requesting a loan to buy a small bull to raise for breeding in due time.

He appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a small bull

loans.name: Abd Al Nasser

texts.en:
Abd A. Nasser is a 25-year old single man who lives in Lebanon and has more than 10 years of experience working in a hair-cutting salon. He has owned his own business for more than a year, and most of his clients are close contacts and friends. 

Abd is applying for a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner A. Majmoua, his first such request, to expand his business and pay for a medicA. operation his sister badly needs.

loans.use: To expand his business and pay for a medical operation for his sister

loans.name: Béti

texts.fr: Née en 1958 à Djeffa au Bénin, H. Béti est mariée à HOUESSOU Gbétodé, un cultivateur. Le couple a huit enfants, dont quatre sont à leur charge. Seulement certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a près de quinze ans que Béti s’est installée avec son mari au quartier Gomin, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji.  La famille vit ensemble et le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Béti n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour se prendre en charge, Béti fait la transformation du manioc en farine de manioc à son domicile et vend ensuite son produit fini à sa clientèle. Béti achète ses matières premières à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Béti sollicite l’aide financier de ALIDé, afin d’augmenter son stock de produits et de se faire plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1958 in Djeffa, in Benin, Ms. H. Béti is married to Mr. HOUESSOU Gbétodé, a farmer.  The couple have eight children, of whom four are in their care.  Only some of the children have had schooling.  For almost fifteen years, Béti has been living in the Gomin district, in the community of Sèmè-Podji.  The family lives together, and the couple share in covering their different family expenses.  Béti did not attend school.  To support herself, she processes cassava tubers into cassava flour in her home and then sells her finished product to her customers.  She purchases her ingredients in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. This is the first time that Béti has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to increase her inventory and to bring in more income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wood for his work.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 41, owns and operates a rice commerce where the main activity is buying and selling rice. Also, she goes to purchase rice in bulk from the rural farmers and stocks it for a while before selling it to increase her profit. She has another financial earner in her husband who currently is engaged in a recycled goods business. The family takes care of two kids who are attending school. 

Recently, S. purchased a hundred kg of rice from the regular middlemen but she can’t satisfy the needs of her customers due to the lack of funds. Therefore, S. decided to request a loan as capital to order buy more rice and resell it to gain income.

loans.use: to buy more rice so as to make more profit

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Tes R., 61, is married and resides with her husband and three childR. in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. R. is a housewife while her husband is a security guard, earning an income of USD 3 each per day. The three childR. are all drivers, earning an income of USD 9 per day each to help cover the family expenses.

R. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a plot of land to build a house for her family. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand the faming business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to build a house.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline D. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 45 years old. Evangeline is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Evangeline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business.

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.en:
Mahabat E. is from Talas, which is situated in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She is 29, married, with three children.  Mahabat and her husband are expecting a baby this year. 

 Mahabat is a young and entrepreneurial woman.  She finished secondary school, but could not continue her studies. Seven years ago, in order to support her family, Mahabat decided to begin her business activities in cattle breeding. Mahabat started this business with a capital of 5,000 KGS.  Today she has twenty milch cows, whose milk she sells to the local dairy factory, earning about 14,000 KGS a month.  She has also a plot of land where she grows potatoes and perennial herbs, which serve as concentrate of forage for her cattle and ensure a high quality of milk yield.  

Mahabat wants to use this loan of 120,000 KGS to buy more milch cows in order to increase her sales of milk and also acquire new customers. With the revenues from this loan, Mahabat plans to build a barn for her cattle to provide good conditions of cattle maintenance. Mahabat’s young family is learning to overcome difficulties and resolve problems and she is full of energy for the many achievements on her way.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cattle

loans.name: Michael Otieno

texts.en:
Michael Otieno O. is 45 years old and he supports four members of his family. His spouse is Jane Otieno who is a businesswoman and generates an income of about Ksh10,000.They have three children, aged 21 years, 16 years and 5 years old.

Michael is a businessman and he specializes in men’s suits, which he has been doing for the last ten years in a busy street in Narok Town.

He learned about KADET LTD from a market awareness program done by KADET staff within Narok Town. This will be his seventh loan with KADET and he has paid off the previous loans on time with no default. He is planning to spend the money on buying more suits to add to his current stock.

From the anticipated profit from the expanded business, Michael will pay college and school fees for his children. He also anticipates opening up another shop in a different street within Narok Town.

His hope and dream is that he will own a house where he can operate the shop and become a wholesale trader. He is a hard-working and business-oriented man.

loans.use: To buy more men's suits to add to his stock

loans.name: Julito

texts.en: Julito D. is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old. Julito is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Julito runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Julito has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Julito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julito is requesting a new loan of 16,500 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Julito from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joseph Soine

texts.en:
Joseph, 27 years old, has practiced farming in Naivasha town since 2003.  He sells his products in the local market where he fetches a tidy sum.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his second loan.  He plans to use the cash to harvest the peas which he planted early this year and also to buy wheat seedlings which he plans to plant after he harvests the peas. 

Joseph hopes to venture into commercial farming in the near future.

loans.use: To harvest peas in the farm and buy wheat seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mr. Sorn S. and his wife are the good parents of five children. Sorn S. was not available on the day the photo was taken, so his wife was photographed instead. For his daily income, Sorn S. owns a small machine that he uses to provide a rice-milling service to fellow villagers. As another source of family income, his wife raises a few pigs. In order to create additional revenue, Sorn S. is requesting a loan to buy a hundred kilos of rice that he will resell or mill before reselling. Sorn S. is hopeful that the loan will allow him to increaS. his income to make sure that his family attains a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a hundred kilos of rice that he will resell or mill before reselling

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel G. is from the village of Barangay 17, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Maribel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel owns & operates a business making and selling home made sausage, hotdogs, and chorizo in the local community. She also buys and sells dried fish like pinikas and tamban. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maribel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital for the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Maribel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital for the business.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 41 years old. Leo is married and has two children aged 10 and 7. To make a living, Leo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Leo has been farming for more than a few years now. He is hoping to increase his yield and have a better income.

Leo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leo is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: William De Los Reyes

texts.es: El señor William tiene 38 años. El se dedica a la venta de medicamentos. Cabe señalarse, sus productos los compra en Managua al por mayor para obtener mejores precios y obtener mayores ganancias. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos, pues ha sido de gran ayuda, inicio a su negocio hace 6 años, buscando una fuente alternativa de ingresos para brindarle manutención a su familia. Pues con muy poco capital de trabajo ha salido adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de medicamentos.
texts.en: Mr. William is a 38-year-old man who sells medicine for a living. It should be pointed out that he purchases his products wholesale in Managua so that he can obtain the best prices and bigger profits. This is not the first time that he requests a loan, as they have been a big help. He started his own business 6 years ago in an attempt to find an alternative source of income to support his family. He has managed to get ahead with just a little capital. The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase medicine.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marlene Yolanda

texts.es:
la sra. Marlene Yolanda V. M. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el caserio el Cedrito, el Triunfo Choluteca, Marlene se dedica a la fabricacion de piñatas y coronas, sus productos los fabrica en su casa de habitacion.
Marlene es madre de 2 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.
Marlene y su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos. 
Marlene se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para empezar a fabricar sus piñatas y coronas, sus tiempos libres lo dedica a su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las piñatas y coronas, en esta epoca muchas personas revientan piñatas, tiene varios pedidos.
su meta es poder crecer mas con su negocio y que las ganancias sean buenas.
texts.en:
Marlene Yolanda V. M., age 29, lives in the Cedrito settlement in the El Triunfo municipality, Choluteca department.  Marlene makes piñatas and funeral wreaths in her house.

Marlene has two children who attend the community school.  Marlene and her husband work hard in order to get their children ahead.  Malene gets up at five every morning to start making her piñatas and funeral wreaths.  She devotes her free time to her family.

She will use the loan to buy materials to make piñatas and funeral wreaths.  During this season many people crack open piñatas, and she has various orders.  

Her goal is to be able to grow more with her business and that she gets good earnings.

loans.use: To buy materials to make piñatas and funeral wreaths

loans.name: Mario Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Señor Mario C., tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la Comarca Namanji, en Estelí, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el sector agrícola.
El recuerda que empezó desde los 10 años de edad ayudando a sus padres a limpiar frijoles. Dejo de estudiar cuando apenas estaba en 2do grado de primaria; Luego su padre falleció cuando el tenia 13 años de edad y tuvo que seguir trabajando duro para ayudarle a su mama.
A los 20 años de edad se caso, pero siguió viviendo con su Mama para ayudarla, fueron sembrando poco a poco repollo, cebolla, chiltoma, y recogiendo dinero para seguir mejorando. A invertido en algunas maquinarias como: pozo, regaderos… etc.
Realizo este crédito para la siembra de cebolla en especial, pero desea mejorar poco a poco la variedad de cultivo. Espera obtener buenos resultados de esta siembra, en especial que el producto sea de mayor calidad para venderlo a un mejor precio.
Sus metas son seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y ayudar a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando y puedan tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mario C. is 27 and lives in Comarca Namanji, in Esteli, he has more than 10 years of experience in the agriculture industry.

He remembers starting when he was 10 years old helping his parents clean beans.  He quit studying when he was only in 2nd grade of elementary, his dad passed away when he was 13 and he had to work hard to help his mom.

When he was 20 he got married, but continued to live with his mom to help her, they started growing little by little, cabbage, onion, 
sweet pepper, making some money for betterment. He has invested in some technology such as a well, irrigation system, etc.

He requested this loan to particularly grow onion, but he wants to improve the variety of his crops little by little.  He hopes to get good results from this crop and get a better quality product so he can sell it at a higher price.
His goals are to continue improving his quality of life and help his children study so they can have a better future.

loans.use: To grow onion

loans.name: Luciano Evaristo

texts.es:
Luciano Evaristo V. V. tiene 57 años de edad. Vive en unión Libre con la compañera y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las blancas Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Luciano Evaristo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Luciano Evaristo V. V. is 57. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his partner and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has 2 children.

The members of the V.R.C. 26 de Noviembre ["November 26th"] are located in the Las Blancas neighbourhood belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Luciano Evaristo has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for five years. He buys his products in Agripac and sells them in the market in Ventanas.

He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to be able to build a house.
He enjoys sports.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en: Felicisima is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: firewood, used clothing and pig fattening. Her 58-year-old husband, Julio, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 23 and 32 years old. Felicisima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Felicisima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,900, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy new equipment for farming so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business. Felicisima is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase new equipment for farming

loans.name: Book Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOOK JOM est créé depuis un an et demi. Il est composé de 25 femmes qui sont du même village. Elle se sont regroupées par voisinage et par affinité. Le petit commerce est leur activité principale. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de THIEO ADI

Madame Jeanne D. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des parents. 

Elle développe une activité de petit commerce. Elle vend des tissus. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement.

Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise à partir de son activité elle paye de cours de renforcement pour son fils qui se prépare à faire un exement. Elle participe également à la prise en charge de certaines dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group Book Jom was created a year and half ago. It is made up of 25 women who come from the same town. They formed the group through neighbourhood and social connections. Their main activity involves running small businesses. The group belongs to the Village Loan Group of Thieo Adi.

Ms. Jeanne D., standing all the way on the right in the photo with the raised hand, is responsible for the group. She is married and has two children. She also has two other children in her care, who were entrusted to her by their parents.

She has developed a small business selling fabric. Her new loan will allow her to strengthen her business by raising her ability to buy supplies.

With the profits that she draws from her business, she pays for a review course for her son, who is preparing for an exam. She also contributes to paying for certain household expenses.

loans.use: To buy fabric for resale

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  soft drinks retailing, motorcycle transport and farming. Her husband Fermin, who is 54 years old, works as a miner to earn his living.  They have 15 children who are between 18 and 42 years old. Merlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 to buy additional goods for her business so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Merlinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her business

loans.name: Samina Maryam's Group

texts.en:
Samina maryam is a very supportive lady. She operates a decorative embroidery business to financially support her family. She receives orders from different members of her community and fulfills them on time to earn for her family. 

Her husband also involved in the same embroidery business. He operates his shop in the market and provides machine as well as hand embroidery services to his customers. He is very well known among his clients for his good quality work and receives regular orders every month. 

Samina has 2 sons. Both are still too young for school. Samina wants to enroll her eldest son in school in the near future and for that purpose she saves profits every month from her work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will buy embroidering material such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity to offer better quality services to his clients. 

Samina is hopeful that an investment will help her husband to further improve his business and increase his monthly profits.

She lives with her family in the area of Kalar abadi which is a small residential area in Gujranwala. Gujranwala is a midsized city of Pakistan and known for its industrial importance.

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Samina Maryam”.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Family issues matter to Luzviminda M., 39, as much as matters pertaining to her own business. Minda, as she is called by friends, reached only high school and fervently wishes that her children will reach farther than she did. She is married to Ronald, a vendor. They have five children. Two are in high school, another two study in elementary, and the youngest is not yet of school age. They used to live in Pangasinan, but at present the whole family resides in Libertad, Pasay City.

Aside from the profits of their tricycle operations which go to their family's needs, Minda focuses on her food stall as another primary source of income. Everyday she prepares breakfast and snacks as part of the menu, serving the customers who are too busy to prepare their own meals or those who stay on the road too long and do not have enough time to go home to eat. Minda has her own space in the community's public market, and she has sold from there for thirteen years now. Ronald helps her with the daily tasks. Every month they are able to earn around $320.

To help her expand her food stall, Minda is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will use this money to purchase necessary ingredients for cooking, such as cooking oil, coconut, eggs and brown sugar, as well supplies such as spaghetti noodles and macaroni. Minda recognizes the big help the loan represents in her business, as it helps her augment her family's needs with increased profits.

According to Minda herself, daily sales become low during the rainy season. Another challenge to her comes as the result of her child's early marriage. This child of hers was not prepared to establish a separate home, and still lives with them. Minda prays that her child and her son-in-law will find a decent job to support themselves. For her other children, she prays that they would fulfill her dream of seeing them graduate from college. Minda wants to see her business grow and have good sales daily. She also dreams of having her own commercial space. 

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase necessary ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur A. is 27 years old. He is working together with his father who taught him best business practice. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells different kinds of detergents, soap, shampoo, toothpaste, shaving cream and washing powder, and many foodstuffs in his store.  
 
Today, Zaur is requesting a loan of 900 AZN to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Zaur’s main goal is to become successful entrepreneur, build his own house, and have his own family one day. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more items to increase his stock.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba Y. is married to a farmer. With 10 children, they have a rather large family to support. Aba makes a living selling kenkey, a Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough. It is usually served with pepper sauce and fish. The income Aba makes helps pay for their children’s school fees and some of the household expenses. 

As their family grows, so does the need to make ends meet. Aba wants to grow her kenkey business and needs a loan to purchase more maize so that she can prepare more kenkey. Additional profits she makes will be used to provide for her family and also reinvested back into her business for further growth. 

Aba is showing the soaked maize yet to be processed into corn dough to be used to prepare the kenkey.

loans.use: to buy more maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 37 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Fe is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and rice in the Philippines. Fe has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Fe has been farming vegetables and rice for five years now, and has borrowed from NWTF six previous times.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to buy more farm land and to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is now 39 years of age and married with four school-aged children. Saturnina is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

Saturnina is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her corn farm. Saturnina has been growing corn for 15 years.

In the future, Saturnina hopes to have a large crop of corn in order to gain income to satisfy the daily basic needs of her family, most especially the educational needs of her children. She also believes that she can improve their status of living and start another kind of business through the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her corn farm

loans.name: Hamilton Darwin

texts.es:
Hamilton Darwin tiene 19 años, es soltero vive con los padres. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Hamilton se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es ser profesional.

Le gusta hacer deporte y estudiar.
texts.en:
Hamilton Darwin is 19 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank called “Narcisa de Jesus” is located in the neighborhood of Recinto San Temistocles, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Hamilton is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Ventanas each month and then sells at the fair located in the same area.

Hamilton is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be to acquire needed supplies. The challenges he faces include pests, crop diseases, and changes in weather. His dream is to become a professional.

Hamilton enjoys playing sports and studying.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La Sra.Liliana, de 26 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Alberto de 27 años de edad,con quien tiene 2 hijas. Se encuentran viviendo la Ciudad de Itá ya hace unos años.
La Sra. se dedica a la costura. Actualmente posee un taller con 4 maquinas industriales, 1 overloock y una collareta, tanto ella como su cónyuge se dedican a la costura y confeccionas prendas de todo tipo, tanto para damas,caballeros y niños.
Solicitan el crédito para la ampliación de su taller de costura, ya que el espacio se esta volviendo demasiado pequeño para la cantidad de trabajo que realizan, ademas de esto necesitan los kits de costuras, también hilos y agujas. Creen que el credito les sera de gran ayuda para todos los planes que tienen respecto al taller.
texts.en:
Liliana is 26 years old and married to Alberto, who is 27, and they have two daughters.  They have lived in the city of Itá for a few years.

Liliana works as a seamstress.  She has a workshop with four industrial machines, one overlock sewing machine, and a sewing machine for collars.  Both she and her husband sew and make all types of clothing for women, men, and children.

She is asking for this loan to expand her sewing workshop, since the space is becoming too small for the amount of work that they do.  They also need sewing kits, thread, and needles.  They believe that this loan will be a big help to all of the plans they have for their workshop.

loans.use: to expand her sewing workshop and purchase materials.

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es: La joven Claudia Elena tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 3 años, la experiencia que ha obtenido en su negocio ha sido muy reconfortante. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. Claudia tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, siempre se ha hecho responsable por proporcionarle las cosas más básicas, a pesar de que ella no pudo terminar sus estudios quiere que su hija logra ser una profesional. Este crédito es para la compra de  perfumes, calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, sabanas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Claudia Elena has a business selling general merchandise.  The experience she’s gained in business over the last three years has been very reassuring.  Most of her customers request quite a variety of products.

Claudia has two children in her care.  She has always been responsible for providing them with the basics despite not being able to finish her studies; she wants her daughter to become a professional. 

This loan is to buy perfume, footwear, clothing in general, cosmetics and sheets, among others.

loans.use: to buy perfume, footwear, clothing in general, cosmetics and sheets, among others.

loans.name: 67 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs Chien has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Chien is 51 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Chien is the group leader of the 67 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

This is Chien's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Chien has been involved in this business for 7 years.
The main hardship that Chien faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chien hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 54 years old and married. He and his wife have been blessed with two children. The eldest is married and working while the youngest is still studying. 

Benjamin is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has managed this kind of business for ten years and is thankful because he is able to sustain his family. His wife helps with planting the rice. 

Benjamin would like to ask for a loan of 30,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to support him in his farming business. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides, as well as to pay for labor. He hopes that he can increase his yield, which would allow him to save money for his security once he is too old to work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Kision

texts.en: Kision is a thirty one year old married man with four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for three years. He started with capital of 300,000 shillings from coffee savings and now he has capital of 3,000,000. His hardship is high inflation rates and his vision is having another retail shop. He also wishes to educate his children. Kision needs the credit facility to buy sugar, salt and drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, salt and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sry

texts.en:
Sry is a farmer working in Ornlong Veng District, Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. She grows rice and has been in this business for many years. She is married to Chen who also works. They have given birth to two kids who they support with their profit. Both of her children are attending school. 

From this business, Sry earns approximately $2 USD per day.  Sry would like to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm materials but lacks the capital.  So, she wishes to have help from Kiva. She will use these funds to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm materials to help her earn a living.  

Sry hopes that these funds will help her make more profit, and she is very grateful for all the lenders that help her family. She says that everything she does is for her family’s well-being because she’d like to give them a different lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm materials.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 38 years old, married,  and has two children.  She is a hardworking business woman who sells clothes to make a living. She has been in this business for 14 years. Alice has expanded her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management. Her desire is to further expand her business within five years. Alice is requesting for a loan of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy clothes.

loans.use: To purchase clothes.

loans.name: Hormiguitas De Palcoco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS DE PALCOCO” iniciará su décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Angélica es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda de barrio, venta de colchones, venta de comida, venta de cerveza, venta de huevos, venta de carne.

La señora Angélica, indica es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de tullmas (adornos para el trenzado de las mujeres de pollera) que viene trabajando has diez años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su mama.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana y máquina de hilar) que adquirirá de la feria 16 de julio y posterior a la elaboración de sus productos los venderá en las ferias de su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Hormiguitas de Palcoco” (Little Ants of Palcoco) is starting its eleventh loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of eight members who are led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Angélica, who is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses to get ahead such as managing a neighborhood store, selling bedspreads, selling food, selling beer, selling eggs, and selling meat.

Sra. Angélica says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after being invited by a local promoter. Angélica currently has a business making and selling “tullmas” (decorations for the pleats on women’s skirts) for 10 years. She learned this skill from her mother.

The loan she is receiving will be used to increase her capital for buying wool and a spinning machine that she will acquire at the July 16th fair so that she can make her products to sell at the community fairs. Working in this manner has enabled her to generate income to support her family. Angélica is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Angélica said that she enjoys the health classes and the loans.

loans.use: to purchase wool and a spinning machine.

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
Anaclita is 64 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past six years Anaclita has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from motorcycle rentals. She has borrowed and repaid 12 previous loans from NWTF.

Anaclita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store. She aspires to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in the school. She has a clothes selling business in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.
Mary requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan, with the hope of expanding her business. She will use her profits to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles
