loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods to sell.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy Y. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Kimtray Leng, live approximately twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. They have three daughters -- one attends school and the other two are still young.

Mrs. Savy is a garment factory worker and her husband is a mason. A recipient of a previous Kiva loan, she is now requesting another loan of $1,000 to expand and improve the house where she lives.

loans.use: make improvements to her house

loans.name: Suren

texts.en: Suren H. lives in Katnaghbyur with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and grandson. Suren and his wife are engaged in agriculture and his son works abroad. The family gets its main income from agriculture. The household economy includes seven cows, two sheep and 15 chickens. Suren cultivates 0.3 hectares of potato. He also grows apple, grape and plum trees. Suren applied to SEF to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es: Lizet tiene 31 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina junto  a su esposo  Carlos  de 35 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Lizet es una mujer muy laboriosa, y siempre trata de sobresalir ante las adversidades del destino. Ella es comerciante tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en el mercado del distrito de Quimbiri, es así que la  bodega que posee es la primera en abrirse, a partir de las 06 de la mañana recibe a sus primeros compradores, pues tiene variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 03 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el día. Con el tiempo piensa invertir sus ganancias y ampliar su negocio ya que tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes. Este es su 12avo crédito de Lizet con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho con el progreso de su trabajo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy  responsable. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Lizet, 31, is a very cheerful and hard working woman. She lives in her own home in the community of Villa Quintiarina alongside her ​​husband Carlos, 35, and their beloved 3 children, to whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. 

Lizet is a very hard working woman and she always tries to get over any adversities brought by fate. She is a trader and has a general store in the market of the district of Quimbiri. Her store is the first one to open. She receives the first buyers at 6 in the morning, and she has a variety of staple products.  What she likes the most about her job is talking to her customers. She has been in this line of business for 3 years and thinks that the hardest part is standing most of the day. Over time she plans to invest her profits and expand her business, because there's a great demand by her customers. 

This is Lizet's 12th loan with MFP and she believes the money of the loan will help her with her business. She is a very responsible partner in her communal bank. With the loan requested she will buy more supplies for her business to stock up merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock up her store.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley M. is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. Shirley has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from selling used clothes.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Semalyn

texts.en:
Semalyn is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 54 years old. Semalyn is married and has six adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Semalyn makes and sells food, running a snack-vending business in the local community. Semalyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Semalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Semalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Semalyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business This will be the second loan taken out by Semalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

location.town: Liloy-Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan padre de un hijo esforzando por que su familia salga a delante y tengan una mejor calidad de vida decidió solicitar un crédito en la institución para mejor su servicio y calidad en su venta y atención al cliente de su negocio es de entera satisfacción saber que que gracias al crédito otorgado contara con un equipo de extractor de grasa para su negocio, el inicio sus actividad es de forma muy simple y  fue hace mucho tiempo atrás obteniendo buenos resultados por el crecimiento de la zona y conocido por la calidad de su producto el cliente tiene deseos de crecer en la vida a un mas al realizar su trabajo todos los días a partir de las 10:00 am hasta las 22:30 pm, para cubrir sus necesidades tanto de el como de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is the father of one child. He strives to help his family move forward and have a better quality of life. Juan decided to request a loan from Emprender so that he can provide better service, improve the quality of his sales, and do a better job attending to his customers. He has the satisfaction of knowing that his loan will allow him to purchase an oven vent for his business.

Juan started out with a very simple business. Over time, he has achieved good results and growth in the area. As a result, he has become recognized for the quality of his product. Juan desires to grow in life in addition to his job. He works every day from 10am to 10:30pm to cover the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase an oven vent.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
La Sr. Vicente es comerciante hace más de tres años. Es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada. El tiene una despensa bien surtida en la Ciudad de Coronel Oviedo. El Sr Vicente nos comenta que el mismo atiende su despensa ya que él es soltero y vive en su casa.
También nos comento que el era vendedor ambulante nada más y con mucho trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación logro salir adelante y tener su propio negocio en su propia casa, y dice también que nada es imposible cuando uno se propone.
El solicita el credito para el abastecimiento de su negocio con mercaderías como por ejemplo enlatados, comestibles bebidas y demás. Tiene las esperanzas puestas en el credito ya que lo ve como una oportunidad de progreso.
texts.en:
Vicente has been a merchant for over three years.   He is a very hard working, self sacrificing person.  He has a well stocked store in the city of Coronel Oviedo.  Vicente tells us that he himself tends to the store since he’s single and lives in his house.

He also commented that he used to only be a street vendor but with much work, effort and dedication he managed to get ahead and have his own home based business.  He also says that nothing’s impossible when you propose to do it.

He is asking for the loan to stock the store with merchandise like, for example: canned goods, beverages, foodstuffs, etc.  He has his hopes pinned on the loan because he sees it as an opportunity for progress.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, beverages, canned goods and others.

loans.name: Juana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del banco comunal la Positiva del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos.
Lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos hace 10  años aproximadamente, se dedica a la venta de  producto de belleza, es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo y muy puntual  con las cosas que tiene que hacer.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará: 3 esmaltes, 5 bolsos, 3 estuches de aretes, 1 collar, 4 colonias para hombre, 3 talcos para pies, 4 labiales, 2 cuartetos de sombras, 2 perfumes para mujer, 3 shampoo, 3 enjuagues, 2 espumas de afeitar y otros productos más que son muy solicitados.
Con este negocio ha podido cumplir con todos sus cuotas a Manuela Ramos sin ningún inconveniente, porque sabe administrar bien su negocio y  tiene  clientes muy responsables.
Agradece que Manuela Ramos por permitirle tener acceso a los préstamos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “La Positiva” (The Positive) which is in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 65 years old and has four children.

Juana has worked with the loans from Manuela Ramos for approximately 10 years. She sells beauty products and is very dedicated to her work. In addition, she is very prompt with the things she has to do.

This new loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy three nail polishes, five bags, three cases of earrings, one necklace, four colognes for men, three foot powders, four lipsticks, two packs of eye shadow, two perfumes for women, three shampoos, three hair rinses, two shaving creams, and other products that are frequently requested.

With her business, Juana has been able to repay all of her loans to Manuela Ramos without any problems because she knows how to manage her business and has very responsible customers. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to access the loans.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics and toiletries.

loans.name: Edelberto

texts.en:
Edelberto is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 1 child. 
Edelberto has a pigpen and sells matured pigs. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for pigs.
Edelberto has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edelberto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is  45 years of age and married with 9 children between 12 and 24 years of age. He is a farmer and also does tailoring and has a butcher business. He has been a farmer  for 25 years. Stephen bought his own land on which he cultivates his crops and this explains how hardworking and determined he is about farming. He has a big volume of customers especially traders from Mbarara which is the neighboring district and also locals buy matooke (banana/plantain) from his farm in large quantities. With this Kiva loan, he plans to buy good farm tools, seeds, mulch, manure and to hire workers. Though lack of rainfall is a problem in parts of Uganda, the western part of Uganda receives a reasonable amount of rainfall. Ibanda district  is one of the districts found in the western part of the country where Stephen lives and farms.

Agriculture in Uganda and the entire sub Saharan Africa employs the majority of the population and it's contribution to the the growth domestic product (GDP) is very significant. Governments in Africa including Uganda have  embarked on a campaign to promote agriculture in the region to fight hunger and poverty. The only challenge is climate. Agriculture activity in Uganda is determined by the prevailing climate at that time. Artificial measures to provide water to crops encounters many limitations. However, some parts of Uganda have comparatively favorable climate for agriculture, mainly farming.

loans.use: to buy good farm tools, seeds, mulch, manure and to hire workers.

loans.name: Kuljan's Group

texts.en:
Kuljan is the leader of this group. She is 55 and married to a security guard. Together with her husband she has raised five sons, three of whom work in the family’s furniture store while the other two sons work in construction.

A few years ago the family was engaged in selling auto parts. With the profits gained, Kuljan opened a workshop where she and her sons now produce furniture. She also breeds cattle for the additional income it brings.

At the moment Kuljan is applying for a 70,000 KGS loan because she needs additional funds to buy more cattle for breeding. In the near future she plans to start repairs on the house.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 62-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and only child. He has owned a taxi for the past six years. Despite his older age, Ahmad must proceed with his business operation because he is the sole income provider of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to make much-needed repairs to his car such as repairing the engine, repainting it, etc. In the future, Ahmad is planning to hire a full-time employee to act on his behalf since he is planning to give up work because of his age.

loans.use: to make repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La señora Flor es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Productivas del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y tres hijos mayores.
Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir y lo realiza en su propia casa, ha implementado un pequeño taller y cuenta con máquinas que le facilitan su trabajo para dar un mejor acabado a sus prendas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 kilos de licra, 4 kilos de algodón, 10 metros de blondas, 2 conos de hilos.
Las prendas que confecciona las vende a un precio módico porque sus clientes son personas de bajos ingresos, pero aun así está obteniendo ganancias en cada una de las prendas, también recibe trabajos de costuras (composturas).
Ella vive sola con su esposo, él es trabajador independiente y lo que ganan es suficiente para ellos dos y para los gastos fijos de la casa, ya educaron a sus hijos y eso les da mucha tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Flor is a member of the Mujeres Productivas communal bank in Manatay district, Ucayali department. She is 49 years old, married and has three adult children. She makes clothing in her own home. She set up a small workshop and relies on machines that facilitate her work and give her garments a better finish.

With her new loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, she will buy 5 kilos of lycra, 4 kilos of cotton, 10 meters of lace and 2 cones of thread. 

She sells the garments she makes very reasonably because her customers earn low wages, nevertheless she makes a profit from each item she sells. In addition, she also does mending. 

She lives alone with her husband. He is self employed and earns enough for the two of them and for fixed household expenses, since they have already educated their children and that gives them great peace of mind.

loans.use: to buy fabric, cotton, lace.

loans.name: 06.01.15 Đông Vệ Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Lan is 52 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province.  Lan is the leader of a 5-member group, named the 15 Đông Vệ Solidarity Group.  She operates a stall where she sells clothing, a business in which she has been involved for more than 10 years.  Lan’s main business hardship is a lack of capital.

In 2011, Lan joined Kiva partner Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing for resale.  Lan has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She hopes to build a house with her business profits.  Also, Lan hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for her resale business.

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Homoine, Provincia de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 já concluiram os estudos e para 1 frequenta a 10ª classe. Fez 4ª classe e naõ continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e  sustenta mais 2 netos, sua mãe e sua sogra que vivem com ela. 

Saiu da sua terra natal com os pais ainda pequena, é comerciante ambulante ha mais de 13 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para a sua casa (areia, cimento, blocos, barrotes, e outros).
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa e mobiliar, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Etelvina was born in the district of Homoine, in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. She is married and has four children; three of them have finished their studies and the other is in the tenth grade. She went to school through the fourth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports two grandchildren, her mother, and her mother-in-law, who live with them.

She and her parents left Homoine when she was still small. She's been selling products door to door for more than 13 years and earns about 3,000 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account.
She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase construction materials (sand, cement, cinder blocks, rebar, etc.) to continue construction on her house.
She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku so she can complete and furnish her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, cement, cinder blocks, rebar, etc.) for her house.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
El Señor Marco Tulio, tiene 45 años, vive con su esposa en el municipio de Tocoa, Colon; tiene una hija de 4 años de edad.
Su actividad económica actual, es la sastrería, confeccionando trajes para toda ocasión, uniformes para escuelas, colegios, e instituciones públicas y privadas.
Ha logrado establecer su negocio de sastrería con mucho esfuerzo, trabajo y además  con el apoyo de su esposa. La limitante que ha tenido es la carencia de recursos que le permite cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
Actualmente ha decidido solicitar su primer préstamo para poder abastecer  de materiales e insumos (telas, hilos, utensilios de costura).
Él esta considerando utilizar sus ganancias  para ampliar su negocio y buscar una superación que le permita mejorar su condición económica y lograr  la sostenibilidad familiar.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio, age 45, lives with his wife in the Tocoa municipality, Colon.  He has a four year old daughter.

His current business is tailoring.  He makes outfits for all occasions and uniforms for elementary schools, high schools, and public and private institutions.  He managed to establish his tailoring business with a lot of effort and work in addition to his wife’s support.  The limitation that he has faced is the lack of resources that allow him to cover his customer demand.

He has currently decided to request his first loan to be able to stock up on materials and supplies (fabric, thread, sewing utensils).

He is considering using his income to expand his business.  He will look for a way to improve that will allow him to enhance his financial situation and to make it stable for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 43 años vive con su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 11 a 22 años de edad, él comercializa pescado desde hace alrededor de 18 años, su negocio está ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde hay mucha afluencia de público, lo cual hace que tenga clientes fijos entre vecinos comerciantes  y amigos.  Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y convertirse en mayorista gradualmente, porque en la actualidad compra en pequeñas cantidades y constantemente. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un congelador para lograr almacenar los productos correctamente y poder comprar en mayor volumen pues en la actualidad lo hace en una pequeña caja de icopor. Sus productos los vende a crédito y la mayoría de sus clientes pagan cada 8 días y también vende de contado. Pedro es un hombre que le gusta su trabajo y ofrece siempre a sus clientes lo que ellos necesitan y pueden pagar.
texts.en:
Pedro is 43, lives with his wife and 5 children, who are between the ages of 11 and 22 years old. He has sold fish for about 18 years. His business is located in the center of the city of Barranquilla, where there is a steady flow of people, which helps him have regular customs between neighboring vendors and friends. His dream is to grow his business and gradually become a wholesaler. Right now, he is constantly purchasing small quantities. 

This is his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will use the Kiva loan to purchase a freezer. The freezer will allow him to store his products correctly and to purchase larger quantities at a time. Right now, he stores the fish in a styrofoam cooler. He sells his products on credit, and most of his clients pay every 8 days. Other customers pay cash. Pedro is a man that likes his work. He always offers his clients what they need and what they can pay for.

loans.use: purchase a freezer

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 50-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 10 and 19 years. All of them are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan for two years.

Sadia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Huan

texts.en:
Huan is 51 years old. She is a member of Duc Lan cluster. She has four children. One of them is still small. 

Her main job is farming. She grows rice and also raises chickens. She has had this job for four years. She has a monthly income of about 5,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 6,496,000 VND and repaid punctually. This is her fifth loan from SEDA. This time she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Akauny

texts.en:
Akauny is a 29-year-old married woman with no children. For two years, she has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan. 

Akauny is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchaase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gulkayir

texts.ru:
Гулкайыр  проживает в селе Жаны-Арык на севере Кыргызстана со своей семьей с тремя детьми, младшей из которых семь лет. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Гулкайыр  с мужем откармливают скот, начав этот бизнес в 2003 году. На сегодняшний день,   Гулкайыр  в своем хозяйстве имеет 1 дойную корову, 5 овец, 1 бычка и 5 коз; продажа молока, молочных продуктов и мяса позволяет получать около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  В свободное время,   Гулкайыр  занимается рукоделием – изготавливает подушки, одеяла, что также является небольшим доходом в бюджет семьи. 
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса,   Гулкайыр  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и  перепродажи.    Доходы   Гулкайыр  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем намерена заняться реконструкцией дома.
texts.en: Gulkayir lives in the Zhany-Aryk village in northern Kyrgyzstan together with her family of three children, the youngest of whom is seven years old.  Much like many other rural families, she and her husband fatten up livestock, after starting this business in 2003.  Today, Gulkayir's business has one dairy cow, five sheep, one bull and five goats.  Sales of milk, dairy products and meat allows her to earn about 8,000 som (KGS) per month.  Gulkayir is also involved in craftsmanship in her free time.  She makes pillows and blankets, which also serve as a small income for the family's budget.  In order to further grow her business, Gulkayir requested a loan in the sum of 40,000 som (KGS) form the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company for the purchase of sheep to fatten up and resell.  She plans to invest the profits from this loan into further increasing livestock headcount.  In the future, she plans to get involved in making repairs to her house.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Ut

texts.en: Mrs. Ut is 28 years old and lives in Prey Chor district with her husband and two school-aged children. She grows rice crops for her livelihood and her husband works as a construction worker from place to place around the country. She is a responsible mother who always takes time to educate her children to be good people at home. Currently, Ut’s husband has faced difficulty with transportation due to the lack of a family-owned vehicle. And he has more expenses for motor-taxi fees to get to his workplace. It would be better if her family owned a motorcycle. So now, Ut wants to acquire her first loan from Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband to use to commute to his workplace. In the future, Ut plans to rebuild her house and make it comfortable for living.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Gloire De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GLOIRE DE DIEU est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Cécile est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Cécile a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Cécile est âgée de 38 ans ne vit plus avec son mari. Cécile a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Cécile  vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Cécile vend depuis dix ans des boules d'akassa (pâte de maïs fermenté)à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Cécile  vend aussi du poisson. Cécile s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Cécile ensemble avec les membres du groupe GLOIRE DE DIEU, sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et l'huile.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juliet is 35 years old and both of her children are in school.

Juliet has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Delia Del Carmen

texts.en: My name is Delia del Carmen A. and I sell products for women such as creams, lotions, perfumes, soaps, deodorants and make-up. I have had my business for three years, and my clients are excellent.  My products are distributed to different stores around the capital of my country, Tegucigalpa. My business generates the income I need to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory so that I will be able to sell to more stores around the city.  With increased sales I hope to pay for my two sons to go to school, they are now coming of age.

loans.use: To purchase deodorants, lotions, creams, perfumes, soap, make-up, kitchen utensils and towels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Felista Wanjiru intends to set up a green grocer shop

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine A. was born in 1988 in Pabo Atiack county, Amuru district, Northern Uganda. Irine's mum died of poison in the year 2001. Currently she is living with an uncle in the Pece division of Gulu town.

Irine is single and currently employed part time with Life in Africa as the Breakfast Club tea girl at WE Center Gulu. The Breakfast Club is for night commuter children, who walk each night to the center to sleep for fear of being abducted by rebel forces. Irine is a hard working lady who makes sure that every child at the center gets breakfast each morning.

With her loan, Irine plans to establish a public pay phone. The phone will be located on Awich Road, plot 23 adjacent to Mola Clinic. She has contracted a lady who will be operating the business and she will pay her a monthly salary equivalent to 10% of the profit. She will be using UTL as the service provider because the cost per unit charged is relatively lower than other service providers.

She expects to make a profit worth over 200,000/= per month. She believes that the business will have a great impact on her life by empowering her economically with enough income to sustain her own basic needs and help others.

Irine expects to refund the loan after a period of 6 months.

Below is her budget plan:

Fixed line phone...............................120,000=

Airtime.............................................100,000=

Rent................................................15,000=

Labor................................................15,000=

Total 250,000=

*Please note - the amounts noted here are in Ugandan currency, the Ugandan shilling. 200,000= is equal to roughly $120US.

loans.use: Irene would like to buy a pay phone.

loans.name: Lino Ventura

texts.es:
Lino is from Cadereyta, Nuevo León, and he has 12 years experience as a blacksmith. Previously, he worked in a workshop for somebody else, but his desire to move forward inspired him to save money to go off on his own. And this is how, two years ago, he came to open his own blacksmith and soldering workshop. He started with very few tools and material, but thanks to the high quality of his work, he was quickly able to increase the number of orders and clients. Now he has someone to help him meet the demands of his clients.

Currently, Lino needs a $475 loan to purchase material to finish his pending jobs and, thus, offer good customer service and continue expanding the business. He will return the loan in 6 months. You can contribute to the growth of this business. Lino greatly appreciates the opportunity to improve that you can provide him.

Lino es originario de la localidad de Cadereyta en el estado de Nuevo León, tiene 12 años de experiencia en la herrería, anteriormente laboraba en un taller para alguien más pero su deseo de salir adelante lo motivó a ahorrar para poder independizarse y así fue como hace dos años abrió su propio taller de herrería y soldadura, comenzó con muy poca herramienta y material, pero gracias a la buena calidad de los trabajos que realiza pronto logró incrementar sus pedidos y clientes, por lo que ahora cuenta con la ayuda de una persona para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes.

En estos momentos Lino necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de material para poder realizar los trabajos que tiene pendientes, con esto podrá ofrecer un buen servicio sus clientes y continuará creciendo, el devolverá esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, Lino agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar.

loans.use:
Purchase of materials

Compra de material

loans.name: Anwari

texts.en:
I have lived in Vehari all my life, a small town about three hours away from Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan. I am married with seven children. My husband suffers from paralysis so I am the breadwinner of the family. Since I know how to sew, I took a loan last year and bought myself a sewing machine, but made little money from that venture as people were only willing to pay very little for my work. However, I still managed to repay my old loan.

Now, I am planning to purchase cloth from Vehari’s city market to sell at a higher price in nearby villages. A loan of $100 will help me start my new business. This might help us to cope with our daily expenses and help me put food on the table.

loans.use: Purchase cloth from the city to sell in villages at a profit

loans.name: Mastla

texts.en:
Mastla N. owns the Mercy Unisex Hair Salon in downtown Kampala. The streets in this area are very busy with vendors pushing carts, bicyclists delivering goods and the hustle and bustle of commerce and a constant flow of people. She works on her clients hair just on the second floor where there is a respite from the traffic.

Mastla is 26, married, with four children. She has owned her business for 7 years and has been a member of her lending group for 6 years. With her loan she plans to buy more braids, weaves and chemicals. Braids and weaves are very important in the lives of Ugandan women. It is one of the few things they can treat themselves to. The weaves and braids are tightly woven into their own hair in a variety of styles.

In time, Mastla would like to be able to start an additional business in which she wholesales braids, weaves and chemicals to other salons.

loans.use: Mastla plans to use her loan to buy more braids, weaves and chemicals for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Nining

texts.en: Nining is 35 years old and has an 18-year-old child. She buys sandals on credit for re-sale and can earn US$ 5 per week. Her husband, N., is a laborer who earns US$ 4 per day. Nining is requesting a loan of US$ 75 to buy more goods to sell. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Mann

texts.en: Mrs. Mann S., 35, is married with two children both of whom attend school. She works with her husband in a rubber plantation as labourer, from which they earn $3.50 each. Mrs. Mann S. would now like to purchase a hectare of rubber trees from the growers in her area so that they will not have to work for them, and can instead sell their own runner for a profit. This is why they would like to borrow $1000 to do this job effectively. She believes that this will enable her to raise her family's living conditions and enable her pay for her children's eduction.

loans.use: To purchase a hectare of rubber trees and resell them for a profit

loans.name: Sunilda

texts.en:
Sunilda sells a variety of candies, cakes and pop corn to the children and teachers of primary school in Café community of Santo Domingo.  Sunilda has three school-going children, and she and her husband have to struggle in order to support their studies.
As she talks about her dream for the future, Sunilda says that she would like to have a house where her family can live comfortably.  She also wants to have a local place where she can operate the business. That way, Sunilda won’t have to take her merchandise everyday to the school, and people will be able to visit her store to make the purchase of these goods.
She is requesting a loan of $375 to buy raw materials to keep producing her candies and cakes.

loans.use: To purchase of raw materials to keep producing candies and cakes for her customers.

loans.name: Ndfuna

texts.en:
Ndfuna (age 48) has had a shop at The Nile Market since 1997. She sells a variety of grocery products to the local villagers. She is married and has six children ranging in age from 26 to 16-year old twins. Her husband is a school teacher and supports her business enterprise.

She hopes one day to breed chickens at her home and be able to sell eggs and poultry to the market.

loans.use: Ndfuna is looking for a loan to help grow her business by increasing stock levels in her shop.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana has been a member of the Communal Bank “Love and Truth” for 10 years.

Juana is 47 years old. She is married with 9 children, and 5 of them live with her. Juana travels to different fairs in the region three times a week to buy pigs and sheep, which she then raises for butchering. Later, she sells the meat at wholesale in the Santa Clara market and she also sells it from house to house.

Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles (approximately $737.00 US). This money will be invested in the purchase of cattle, goats, and pigs.

Juana’s dreams are for her children to become professionals, to build another house, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Gearhart and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad hace 10 años.

Juana es casada, tiene 47 años y 9 hijos de los cuales 5 viven con ella, Juana viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 3 veces por semana donde compra cerdos, carnero y luego lo beneficia, la venta de la carne lo realiza al por mayor en el mercado Santa Clara y también de casa en casa.

Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno, caprino y porcino.

Los sueños de Juana son que sus hijos sean profesionales, construir otra casa y que su negocio mejore.

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles (approximately $737.00 US).  This money will be invested in the purchase of cattle, goats, and pigs.

loans.name: Jurka

texts.en: Jurka is a  48-years-old widow with two children from the town Derventa. She receives monthly disabled benefits in the amount of 500 KM. Jurka is requesting a loan so she can buy seeds and cultivate her land. This is her second loan at the MCO WWI. She will sell the vegetables she raises, which will increase her monthly incomes.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Verónica is a hardworking lady and loving mother of a ten-month-old little boy. Since the birth of Rubén, she has not turned down any work nor has her desire diminished to put forth her best efforts with the goal in mind of providing stability and security for her family. She started out selling a wide variety of fruits during festival days in small nearby towns, always accompanied by her dear little boy, however, due to the discomfort and weariness of her baby she decided to make a change. She is now selling beauty products/cosmetics by order. Thanks to the gift she has for salesmanship and the large number of friendships that she is able to rely on, this business is allowing her to cover all of the necessities of her home. She is now requesting a loan so that she is able to use the capital to keep more beauty products in stock in order to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Kristy.

Verónica es una laboriosa dama y amorosa madre de un pequeño de diez meses. Desde que le concedió el don de la vida a Rubén no ha desestimado ninguna labor ni ha disminuido el deseo de poner su mayor esfuerzo con el fin de ofrecerle estabilidad y seguridad a su familia.Se inició vendiendo una amplia variedad de frutas, los días de feria en los pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca, siempre acompañado de su querido niño, pero viendo la incomodidad y cansancio de su bebé decidió cambiar de oficio. Actualmente viene incursionando en la venta de cosméticos de belleza por pedidos, gracias al don de persuasión que tiene para las ventas y a la gran cantidad de amistades con la que cuenta, este negocio le esta permitiendo cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar y el deseo de contar con mayor capital que le permita tener productos de belleza en stock para incrementar sus ganancias la conducen a solicitar un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase in capital in order to offer a greater selection of cosmetics.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat U., 34, and her husband, Mr. Ty Soung, 36, who live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1994 and have four children, two sons and two daughters, all attending the local school.

Mrs. Sophat has been selling steamed corn in the village for four years, while her husband drives a taxi, carrying people from Kampong Thom Province to Kampong Cham Province. Currently his taxi is broken, so Sophat is requesting a loan of $500 to repair it.

loans.use: To repair her husband’s taxi.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 27 years old. She is married and she has two children. She became a tailor in 1995. Every day, she works from 10 AM to 8 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $165 from her sales.

Salama now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business

loans.name: Assadllah

texts.en:
Assadllah is married and the father of 6 children. He lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. A. has a house near the street. All his neighbors have their houses and make shops in their houses, but he is unable to do this. He works in a governmental place in Kabul and has a small salary. He can barely support his family. He is unable to make any shop in his house.

Therefore, he has requested an individual loan of US $1100 with a term of 18 months to build 2 shops inside his house to rent out. He will take the rent money to help his family and make his house better each day because it has a good location.

He is happy with the loan process in his country for workers and for those who want to spent the money to benefit and help their families. In this poor country, he wants to say it is a big help for the people of this country. He wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: To build 2 shops inside his house

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una madre abnegada, dedicada a la agricultura y al trasporte de sus productos a los mercados de diferentes ciudades para su comercialización. Su esposo (en la foto), nos comenta de la ardua labor de Mercedes, a quien calificó como la mejor madre de familia y ayuda idónea para los trabajos agrícolas que realizan juntos. Esta pareja desea seguir adelante con su trabajo y solicitan este préstamo para incrementar su producción, para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, útiles en todo sembrío, para así aumentar sus ganancias y tener la capacidad de satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a self-sacrificing mother, dedicated to farming and to the transport of her products to the markets of different cities for their commercialisation. Her husband (in the photo) tells us about Mercedes’ hard work, whom he describes as the best possible mother of a family and an ideal helper for the agricultural labours that they undertake together. This couple wants to improve their lives with their work, and are asking for this loan in order to increase their production, in order to buy fertilizers, useful in all plantings, in order to improve their harvests and to have the capacity to satisfy the needs of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for the fields she cultivates

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina M. has been selling mattresses in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She works for twelve hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $95 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more mattresses for her business and increase her sales and profit. If this loan helps her to expand her business, she intends to use the increased profits to reinvest in her business so that it can continue to grow.

Amina is 34 years old, married, and has four children, aged 2, 5, 8, and 12. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Halima, who has her own small business selling charcoal and firewood in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more mattresses for her shop.

loans.name: Mrs. Sory Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of ten members, is located in Phsar village in Kampong Chhnang Province. The members plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Sory C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is 54 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are laborers while the others are enrolled in the local school.  Her husband, Mr. Soeung ChansE., is a duck breeder. Mrs. Sory C. sells chickens in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand; she has a lot of customers and increased demand. In order to support this business, Mrs. Sory C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more chickens to sell to her customers. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. These borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has an overall delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Lupita Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del g/s  LUPITA viven en el barrio los altos de Nindiri sobre la carretera tipitapa, Managua este grupo tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a escuelas de  primaria lo que les permite ser unas  personas bien comunicativas y accesibles en la sociedad. Iniciaron sus negocios ambulantes, comprando los productos en el mercado oriental de Managua y vendiendo de casa en casa en los barrio aledaños a su domicilio
 Rebeca es una señora que valora mucho y dice sentirse agradecida con adim por que además del crédito, las capacita para que ellas puedan salir adelante. Siente que el aprendizaje mas importante que ha obtenido al trabajar con ADIM ha sido reconocer cuanto vale ella como mujer honrada y trabajadora. 
Sus créditos lo utilizan en la compra de productos por mayor  para ofertar y obtener precios más bajos y poder aumentar sus ganancias.
Ellas  esperan poder participar en las capacitaciones de desarrollo empresarial. Quiere además seguir siendo cumplida en sus pagos como hasta ahora lo ha sido, para poder obtener mayores beneficios
texts.en:
The members of the group Lupita live in the Los Altos (the Heights) neighborhood of Nindiri on Tipitapa Road in Managua. This group had the opportunity to attend elementary school, so they communicate well and are approachable in society. They started their own traveling businesses, purchasing items in Managua's oriental market and selling them by going house to house in nearby neighborhoods. Rebeca is a wonderful woman and she says she is grateful to Kiva partner ADIM for not only the loan, but also the ability to improve. She feels that the learning experience that she has gotten by working with ADIM has allowed her to realize how valuable a honorable and hardworking woman is. The women use their loans to buy items wholesale for lower prices and increase their profits. They hope to participate in training workshops to improve their businesses. They also want to stay current on their loan payments, as they have done until now, to continue to receive benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items wholesale to offer better variety

loans.name: Mith

texts.en:
Mrs. Mith N., 49, is a farmer and lives in Taboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1980 and learned the farming skill from her parents. N. grows rice in two seasons- - dry season and rainy season. Each day, she can typically make about $5/day of income. Meanwhile, her husband works buying cattle and reselling them for a profit. He can typically make about $3.50 per day in revenue.
Mrs. Mith N. has lately requested a loan from KIVA to purchase more cattle to expand her husband's business. The increased number of cattle will generate more profit for her household. ( Her husband is pictured)

loans.use: To buy more cattle to generate more profit.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice G. is married and has four dependants. She has completed schooling through the primary level. Alice sells beans and groundnut which she distributes to her costumers. She also sells spices and other items at the Amoabin market near Cape Coast, which she has done for about a year now. Her husband is a farmer. Alice uses her income to support her husband in paying the rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Alice will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more beans and groundnut in larger quantities to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alice plans to reinvest in the expansion of her trade in groundnut and beans.

loans.use: To buy more beans and groundnut in larger quantities to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou G. is 49 years old, a mother of five, and married to Wilfredo, 50 years old, who is a farmer.  

Her five children include Wilma - 28 years old, Wendelyn – 25 years old, Wilfredo G. Jr. - 23 years old.  They are all college graduates currently working in Manila as teachers.  Her other two children are still studying in high school. They are William - 20 years old, and Willinda -16 years old. 

The village where her family lives is a poor village at the moment, and quite distant from the market proper of Tumauini. 

Marilou has an agricultural machine for rice and corn, commonly called a thresher, in their village which is operated by her husband and some paid laborers, especially during harvest season.  Their thresher helped a lot to other farmers in their village because with the machine, they were able to minimize time and it made harvesting easier for them.  Moreover, they were able to employ some farm laborers during the peak season of harvest. 

But still, their income is not enough to sustain the needs of the family because they only earn money during the harvest season.  So, Marilou wants to avail a loan amounting to Php 6,000 to start a new business in meat vending and other kinds of products in their village.  She hopes it will be approved, and that the business will last long for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To start a new business

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en:
Zaher A. is 30 years old, married and lives with his wife and their three children in Gaza City, Palestine. Zaher has been working as a farmer for ten years. He grows different kinds of vegetables.

Zaher approached Kiva's partner, Ryada, because he wanted to purchase more farming aids, such as herbicides, fertilizers and other necessities, in order to manage his crops appropriately. He hopes that his increased profit will allow him to better support his family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more farming aids such as herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Mwamvita

texts.en:
Mwamvita has been a clothes (khanga) seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60 and works at her business for 12 hours daily.

A member of the Ujamaa group loan, she is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more khanga for her resale. She is hoping to increase her profit and grow her business through this loan.

Mwamvita is 30 years old, is married, and has a five-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more khanga for resale.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Casado, tiene 47 años.

El es originario de la huasteca, donde los quesos son muy solicitados, el al llegar a mante y observa que casi no se venden mucho por ahi, decide poner su negocio de quesos y mas adelante tambien perfumes que observo que solicitaban mucho.

El pide el apoyo para un refrigerador para guardar los quesos y evitar que se echen a perder, le ha hido muy bien casi todo lo que vende es por pedidos.

Sus ganas de trabajar, lo han echo muy conocido en la zona donde vive, y tiene una gran demanda de queso, pero no tiene donde guardarlo. 

en tanto los perfumes fue un extra que tambien se le ha hido vendiendo muy bien.
texts.en:
Married, is 47 years old. He is from the Huasteca region, where cheeses are very popular. When he arrived to Mante and observed that they are not sold much there he decided to start her cheese business and in the future will also sell perfumes as they are requested a lot. He is requesting the support for a refrigerator to keep his cheeses to prevent them from going bad. It has gone well for him and almost everything that he sells is by special order. His desire to work has made him very well-known in the area where he lives. There is a great demand for cheese, but he does not have anywhere to keep it. In terms of the perfumes, it was an extra that has been selling very well.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is 34 years old. He is married and has a son who is currently in nursery school. He lives with his wife and son in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. His wife is a seamstress by profession. 

Christian is a commercial driver. He conveys goods and passengers from his community to nearby towns. He says his bus needs to be given a thorough maintenance in order to be in good working condition. He would like to obtain a loan to pursue this dream. 

Christian has been in business for eight years. He hopes to maintain his car in good condition so as to remain in business. Christian desires to improve upon his family's standard of living and to give his son a sound education.

loans.use: For bus maintenance.

loans.name: Otgonpurev

texts.en:
Otgonpuregv O. is 34 years old. He is married and is the father of two children, both of whom attend an elementary school. His family lives in a small house with one room in a "ger" (a yurt or nomadic housing tent) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

With his spouse, Tuvshinjargal, he has been selling firewood. He buys timber mostly at wholesale prices, cuts and bags the wood, and resells it. To expand his retail business, he aims to open a small store next to his little house on the plot of land he owns.

In the summer of 2007, he started baking bricks manually to sell. Baking a brick manually takes time and hard work. Otgonpurev intends to buy an automated brick baker. His plan is to build a store and a big house instead of the one room small house in which they now live. Otgonpurev says that "it is tough to live with four people in such a small house. I'm looking forward to having a big beautiful house with many bedrooms where my daughters can grow up for several years."

With this loan, he will buy a brick baking machine.

In the picture, Otgonpurev is sawing firewood with his spouse and one of his son.

loans.use: To buy a brick-baking machine

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Mr. T. Wilson is a carpenter. He is 45 years old and blessed with six children who are all in school. He owns a carpentry workshop in Ibanda. His experience in carpentry enables him to produce quality work attracting many customers. He is using the loan to purchase more wood to make furniture for his customers. He aspires to expand his carpentry workshop in the same location and attract even more customers.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to make furniture for his customers.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Сухроб – опытный фармацевт. Собственный аптечный киоск находится в городе Вахдат. Свои кредиты он использует на расширение своего бизнеса. На следующий займ он хочет закупить медикаменты. Он рад сотрудничеству с нашей организацией и благодарит наших партнеров по КИВА.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Suhrob is a skilled pharmacist. He has his own pharmacy shop in the city of Vahdat. He uses his loans for his business. His plans for the next loan include the purchase of medicine. He is happy to be in corporation with this organization and is thankful to the partners at KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Medicine

loans.name: Amani West Group

texts.en:
Demetelia is a member of the Amani West borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is a 33-year-old woman, married, and mother of 4 children. Her children are aged 18, 15, 12, and 6 years old.

Demetelia started her own shop 8 years ago. She works 14 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 80,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Demetelia’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Demetelia hopes to save money and expand her business.

Veronica, another member of the Amani West borrower group, has also requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her own business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hog raiser.  She engaged in this business for she wanted to help her husband in providing the needs of their family and also to maintain her business and somehow uplift their poor living situation.  Since she do not have enough capital to support the daily feeds supply of her hogs, she is now asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP7, 000 as additional capital. Aside from raising hogs, Elizabeth is also into retailing of bagoong” (shrimp paste) which she purchases from the nearest market and sell in their village.  She found out that this business is more productive and beneficial for her family.  

She is 41 years old and they are living in the simple village of Binarzang Quirino, Isabela. They have four children;two are studying while the other two chose to stopped and work as housemaid to help them earn a living. 

Elizabeth is hoping to help all her children through her business.  She prays for all of them to always be in good health.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna is 61 years old and married with five adult children, all of whom are fully independent. Despite her age, Susanna works very hard because she always wants to look healthy and make an income to support her elderly husband, who is a pensioner. For the past four years Susanna has been selling home products, such as cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates, at the community market where she lives. She wants to use her loan to buy an increased stock of plastic items and kitchen sets. She would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of plastic items and kitchen sets

loans.name: We Dee Woman Group

texts.en:
This is Marie K., Aminata D. and Serrah K.. They named their group We Dee Woman.  They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are getting from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each. This loan can significantly impact the lives of these people. They will be able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees.  They will also be able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loan. 

Marie K. (right) is the leader of the group. Marie is forty-two years of age and was born in Waterloo. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Their first child is in college, the other has just sat to the West Africa Senior Secondary Schools Examinations, and the others are in Junior Secondary School I and II. Marie sells market food since a child. With this loan, she will be able to add more goods into her stall.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel A. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Sopocachi, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa.
El señor Miguel es rentista del magisterio, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de pisos en dos habitaciones  que por el pasar del tiempo se deterioraron.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Miguel A. and his wife live in their own house in the Sopocachi neighborhood on the west side of La Paz. Miguel is retired and supports his family with his pension. This loan will be used to repair the floors in two bedrooms in his house, which have deteriorated over time.

This is the second time Miguel has applied for a loan. He has been rated favorably by the socioeconomic analysis of the lender, so he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of floors in two bedrooms of his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more equipment for her business

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: Cesar Augusto de 36 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 niños, de 14 y 4 años respectivamente, labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como colector de ingresos desde hace 11 años.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito y espera seguir siendo beneficiado con el Fondo Kiva, pues desea seguir mejorando su casa de habitacion construyendo un pequeño porche, levantar un muro y hacer las gradas, poco a poco a ido haciendo su casita mas comoda para sus hijos, su esposa se encarga del cuido de la casa y de los niños. El mayor sueño de Cesar es lograr tener su casa con las condiciones basicas para que sus hijos crezcan en ambiente comodo, ademas que estos estudien y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 14 and 4 respectively. He has been working for the town of Juigalpa as a tax collector for 11 years. Cesar is requesting his 2nd loan and hopes to continue as a Kiva beneficiary. He wants to continue his home improvements by building a small porch, erect a wall, and install steps. Gradually he has been making his home more comfortable for his children. His wife is in charge of looking after the children and maintaining the home.

Cesar dreams of having a home with the basic necessities so that his children can grow up in a comfortable environment. He also wants them to continue their studies and become good people.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a small porch, erect a wall, and install steps

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia I. is from the village of Baybay, Panalsalan, in Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Amalia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Amalia owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the local community. Amalia has been running her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amalia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Amalia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for sell

loans.name: Jenny Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Jenny F., es madre de familia de tres hermosos hijos dos ya que trabajan y uno estudia la secundaria, su trabajo es maestra de secundaria que ha ejercido durante veinte seis años, junto con su esposo ya que también el trabaja como docente. Estudio en el colegio Normal para sacar su diploma y poder cumplir con su requisito. Gracias a Dios y a su trabajo han logrado poder hacer su casa toda de concreto para mejor seguridad. Poco a podo han comprado los muebles, ropero, pero a un su casa es de suelo, lo cual ella desea poder poner piso ya que sus muebles se están fregando, en la mera tierra es por eso ve la necesidad de comprar piso para una mejor higiene como para poder gozar de una mejoras mas, para después comenzar a repellar y a pintar su casa todo esto solo  lo puede hacer a largo plazo ya que toda esta caro pero si con una esperanza a futuro de poder arreglar su casa bonita
Con el crédito anterior logro poner toda la electricidad a su casa con su medidor para una mejor distribución de energía como mejor seguridad. Muy contenta de poder lograr sus planes como madre de familia a través del los prestamos.
texts.en:
Sra. Jenny F. is the mother of three beautiful children. Two of them work while the other one is a high school student. Jenny has been teaching at the high school level for twenty years. She works with her husband, who is also a teacher. Jenny studied at a teacher’s college to earn her degree and was able to complete all of her requirements.

Thanks to God, her work has allowed her to build a concrete house to provide her family with better security. Over time she has purchased furniture and installed a closet, but her house has a dirt floor. She wants to install flooring because right now she has to constantly clean her furniture. A proper floor will also provide better hygiene and help her family enjoy additional improvements. Afterwards she will be able to begin plastering and painting her house, which can be completed over the long term. All of these improvements are expensive, but she hopes they will make her house more beautiful.

With her previous loan, Jenny was able to equip her house for electricity by installing a meter for better distribution of energy. This provided her family with more secure conditions. She is very happy that she can use these loans to fulfill her plans as a mother.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to install a floor

loans.name: Tamensu Development Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Tamensu Development' group from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty traders who have formed themselves into a group in order to apply for a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. Consequently, their living conditions will improve so that they can better support themselves and their school-going children.

Ramatu C. on the right in the photo is the leader of this group. Ramatu was born in Kafe, near Magburaka about forty-five years ago. She is married to a motor-bike driver and they have three children who are attending secondary and primary schools respectively.

Ramatu sells firewood and has been in this business for nearly ten years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy a truck full of firewood and pay transportation costs to carry the wood to her house.

loans.use: Buy a truck full of firewood and pay transportation costs

loans.name: Davaajav

texts.en: T. Davaajav is a 46-year-old single mother who lives with her two sons in the province of Arkhangai in central Mongolia. They live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". Her oldest son is 17 years old and is a university student. Her youngest is 14 years old and attends a local secondary school. Davaajav operates a dairy product trading business out of a rented stall at the local market in her town. She started her business in 2000 with capital of 50,000 tugrugs (~35 USD) and has built a stable operation over the years. She has worked hard to grow her business and has been able to save money for her children's education. Today her working capital exceeds 300,000 tugrugs (~210 USD). Davaajav is optimistic about the future and has many plans for her business. She says, "With my business profits I hope to buy a house in the future." She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~210 USD) loan to purchase a variety of dairy products to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Alyeris Maria

texts.es: La joven Alyeris de 26 años de edad, habita junto con sus padres, es una joven de iniciativa que ha logrado tener su propio negocio en venta de ropa, cosméticos y prenda de plata y oro laminado. Todo esto con el propósito de tener su propio dinero y no depender solo de sus padres, lleva  siete años en las ventas, en donde ha hecho mucha clientela que le hacen encargo, vende al contado y al crédito. Lo único es que muchos clientes abecés le atrasan el pago y eso le perjudica por que trabaja con poco capital. La mercancía la tiene en su cuarto el cual se le hace incomodo. Su necesidad es poder hacer un local pequeño en donde pueda tener su propia venta. Lo cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines y comenzar la obra. Gracias a estos préstamos ha logrado mantener su venta de prendas el cual inicio con el apoyo de Afodenic y es su once avo crédito y esta logrando cada día mejoras en su vida.
texts.en:
Alyeris is 26 years old and lives with her parents. This young woman took the initiative to start her own business selling clothing, cosmetics, and gold and silver laminated garments. Alyeris started this business so that she could earn her own money and not become dependent on her parents. She has been making sales for seven years. Her customers place their orders with her and she accepts payments by cash or on credit. The only problem is that many of her customers delay their payments, which hurts her because she is left with little available capital.

Alyeris stores her merchandise in her room, which makes it uncomfortable. She needs to have a location from where she can sell her products. For this reason, Alyeris will purchase materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and crossbeams so that she can begin construction. Thanks to her previous loans, she has been able to maintain the sales business that she started. With the support of AFODENIC, Alyeris will receive her eleventh loan which will help her continue making improvements in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a location where she can sell her merchandise

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel M. is from the village of D'Ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She is 41 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ethel owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Ethel has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ethel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ethel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ethel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ethel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mrs. Ouk Vorn Village Bank Group

texts.en: A village bank loan consists of eight people who all live in Kandal village in Takeo province. The members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Ouk V. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members of the village bank loan. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for a living. Her husband, Mr. Keo Bin Tha, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support their living conditions. Since Mrs. Ouk V. and her family live in an old house, Mrs. Ouk V. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house.  She will use the rest of the loan to buy wire fencing to protect the livestock from stray animals. Mrs. Ouk V. is a mother of two children who are both too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to build a new house and to protect the livestock

loans.name: Merian

texts.en:
30-year-old Merian is married to Richard and they have two children. Her oldest child is aged 6. She wants her children to have a proper education so she works hard to be able to save this early.

Merian is involved in rice farming and currently owns a hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field. She hopes to grow her business to earn more and also to improve her family’s living conditions.

Merian applied to CEVI for a loan of Php 8,000. This loan will be used to supply her farm inputs like seed, fertilizer and other supplies.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 63 años, es divorciada hace 23 años, pero de aquel matrimonio, tuvo tres hijos, adultos e independientes, por el que solo vive con su hija y su esposo en su casa, ubicado en un barrio al sur de Lima. Se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, establecimiento que se encuentra en el primer piso de su casa, por lo que ya lleva dieciséis años en este negocio. Desde entonces atiende con mucha amabilidad a cada uno de sus clientes, ya que sin ellos, no hubiera crecido su bodega y no hubiera percibido mas rentas. Es así que abre su tienda a las 6:00am de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche, y cuando  se va a comprar más mercadería, su hija se encarga de la venta de bebidas, por lo que Isabel regresa prontamente a su casa, ya que no le gusta mantener cerrado su negocio.  Su mayor anhelo es que su bodega esté repleta de varios productos,  asimismo quiere arreglar las fisuras de las paredes de su casa, provocado por un  movimiento sísmico. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, además como líder de su grupo comunal, incentivará a todas sus compañeras que sean también puntuales en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de diversos productos para abastecer su bodega, asimismo desea derivar parte del crédito en la compra de materiales de construcción para arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Isabel is 63 years old and has been divorced for 23 years, but from that marriage she has 3 children who are independent adults. She lives alone with her daughter and new husband in her own home in a neighborhood in the south of Lima. She runs her own business selling groceries and staples in a store built in the first floor of her house. She has run this business for 16 years. Since then she has attended to her every one of her customers with a lot of friendliness because without them she would not have been able to grow her inventory and her profits. For this reason she opens her store at 6am until late at night. When she leaves to buy merchandise, her daughter is in charge of selling beverages. She always hurries home because they do not like to leave the business closed. Her greatest wish is to have her warehouse full of various products. She also would like to fix the cracks in the wall of her house that were caused by an earthquake. This is her 6th loan cycle with MFP and she agrees to pay her account punctually. As leader of the group, she will also encourage all of her colleagues to be punctual with their payments as well. She is asking for a loan to buy various products to stock her warehouse and to buy construction materials to fix her house.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products to stock her warehouse

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 43 years old and married with two children. He is a self-employed professional veterinarian.  He has been in this business for 11 years and his customers are livestock farmers.
